Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Modern, Great service & Location!”
Reviews.Author: xxLaniexx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for new year 09-10. As prices go up quite a bit over new year in most hotels around Amsterdam we got a really good price for this one! First impressions walking in to the hotel was how great the service was and how beautiful the lobby was. There was a log fire burning which was really nice as it was snowing outside. Going into our room we were gobsmacked because of the size of it! It was so spacious, clean & cosy at the same time. The bed was HUGE!!! and also really comfy, I slept very well whist staying here. The curtins are great too as they block out ALL of the light. There was a flat screen TV, wine glasses, cups, coffee facilites & a fridge. The bathroom was also very modern and clean. We loved the shower. The room was cleaned every day. I've been to Amsterdam quite alot and we just loved this location of this hotel, it wasn't far from central station or the dam square, less than 5 mins walk to each. Overall a great stay and I would most certainly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Quality lodging, Outstanding concierge”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBill
Reviews.Content: This property is about what you would expect from a Marriott Renaissance. High quality furnishings, good location, excellent club lounge, attentive personnel. However, this property also has an outstanding concierge named Leo. He Is an American who studied Dutch history in Holland and is wonderful at sharing his knowledge with guests. Please make sure if you stay here, that you allow him to plan a walking trip for you, particularly if you enjoy history. One negative. The directions on the website are very confusing coming from Central Station. Get better directions or spend some time wandering around, like we did.

Reviews.Title: “central, modern, clean and great service”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte003
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a short stay. Excellent service, breakfast really good. Rooms a bit small but lovely and comfortable. 5 minutes from the station. They do great deals so worth looking out for them on their website. The only downside is some rooms are quite far from the lift as it is a bit hotel and a bit of noise from outside but nothing major.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveuk123
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely clean modern hotel with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “A near perfect base in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Nevsank
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel many years ago when it was the Sonesta. I remember it well then and had heard good reports since its Marriott takeover and its Renaissance branding. My expectations were high and we weren't disappointed. I really can't find anything to criticise(apart from the unnecessary piped music in the restaurant which was turned off at our request). The staff were excellent in every department, rooms comfortable and well furbished and the Club lounge was excellent. Will make this my base for the future in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Beware pricey extras”
Reviews.Author: pansymclean
Reviews.Content: well located for the train station (with great links to Schiphol) but a bt too close to the Red Light district, this is a good if rather standard American style hotel. Good rooms, comfy beds, nice shower and good fitness room. But extras come at a price. They wanted alomst 20 euros a day for wifi; 27 euros each for breakfast and then offered a club deal for 75 euros to include those plus a room upgrade (not necessary) and evening drinks and snacks. Fortunately if you take a right turn there are lots of cafes on Singel offering breakfast which have a much more Dutch feel. Comforting for those from the US who like to feel at home - but little to give much of a European feel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Esca51
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and took my chances. What a wondeful hotel!! Front desk staff was awesome and friendly. Rooms were large and very clean. Walls are a little thin, we could hear a child crying but did not bug us to much (as we have kids of our own so we know how traveling with them is) Close to the train station and walking distance to Dam Square and other sites. Resturant down stairs is good but staff could be more attentive. There are resturants and markets close by if you do not want to eat at the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FirstLast34
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and clean although on the small side with a turn Down service. Based in the center of Amsterdam. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KWarner
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to train station, nice area easy to walk to from station. In spite of being close to some of the "coffee bars" it is close to good restaurants and the central station. The rooms are nice however try to avoid a room on the lower floors near the street as they unload the supply trucks early in the morning. The concierge lounge is nice, beer and wine are complimentary and the food and snacks are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location!”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple times on business and really is a great hotel. Rooms can be a bit small, but this does vary hugely. Staff always helpful and polite. Always happy to know I am returning when I travel to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: starfromstalbans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. Everywhere we wanted to go to was close to this hotel which was convenient. A little expensive for breakfast and meals however the room was very comfortable and served a good overall experience. This hotel is stone throw away from central station which was also a plus point. We took the train back to the airport. Sights like the canal,red light district, dam square, flower market , sisha bars and coffee shops were all walking distance. We did use the trams to get around no.2 goes to van gough museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and warm people.”
Reviews.Author: Alex A
Reviews.Content: Every 4 years my wife and I go to Europe but we always begin/and end our visit in Amsterdam. The hotel we choose is important for location and that is why we have always booked the Marriott Renaissance. The ambience of the makeover they have completed recently was amazing. The welcome area and lobby are warm and inviting. There is a fireplace and seating where we always had coffee and waited for our friends to arrive. The location is perfect for everything including restaurants, walks, canal boats, clothing stores, souveneers and even groceries. A 2-minute walk up the alley will bring you onto a major tourist walk where you can find everything. The tram is a short half block walk that can take you right to the museum area as well. The rooms are a bit small but comfortable with newly designed bathrooms. Wi Fi and wired rooms are available for a fee, but we would walk to a Bulldog nearby that offered free Wi Fi. There are 2 restaurants on property and the one we enjoyed for breakfast or early lunch was the Koepel CafÃ©. We could sit outside and enjoy the nice weather, or indoors if inclimate happens. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone especially first time visitors, as the staff is ready to help you with your daily plans. We even had the concierge walk us over to the canal boats to get us on the best selection. We did travel in March this year so we could see the beautiful tulips blooming ~ it was worth every penny we spent to see this array of beauty. You can take a guided tour or go on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: nemrac_coco
Reviews.Content: I stayed there recently for 1 night. It's located within 5 mins walk from the Centraal station and is really an excellent base to explore the sights in Amsterdam by foot. It's walkable to the Red Light District, Dam Square, Flower Market, and many many more sights. The concierge and staff are always helpful, and the room was big and comfortable. I would highly recommend any traveller to stay here if they want a conveniently located hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LotharFL
Reviews.Content: Our recent saty at this centraaly located hotel near the train station was certainly worthwhile. The staff was very attentive and the concierge service was outstanding. Rooms were recently updated with a modern flair. Certainly worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Beauiful, centrally located Amsterdam hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Hauserj
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Renaissance! The Concierge was extremely helpful and the hotel was beautifully decorated. Nice size rooms for Europe. Great location and it was convient for public transportation. It would have been perfect if it had free wifi!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid...”
Reviews.Author: TravelHamster
Reviews.Content: Very safe pair of hands if you are staying in central Amsterdam. Its in a good location and is clean, friendly, rooms are a decent size and you cant really fault it in those sorts of respects. THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NOTHING WRONG WITH THIS HOTEL. Its just not spectacular in any way either I guess. Maybe its because we are getting a little spoilt but it just felt exactly the same as millions of other hotels I guess and maybe I'm writing this having not had enough sleep. The service in the bar and the restaurant was always a little slow and Im sure this was a 1-off but I had to change the electric room-key 4 times in 2 nights! Dont let this deter you though, its a perfectly suitable (probably actually quite good) hotel in a great location centrally.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great location, great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelerAttarha
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night and had the best hotel experience I've ever had in Amsterdam. Early checkin worked without problems, room was clean, staff was nice. The breakfast here was amazing and had a lot of things to choose from. I will always come back to the Renaissance Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: floricuse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights for business. Hotel is very well located (5 minute walk from Centraal Station, 10 minutes to De Wallen and 5 from the Jordaan) and very comfortable. Staff was very courteous and accomodating. Rooms were a bit small, but quite clean, stylish and comfortable. My company held a three day meeting across the street at the Koepelkerk, the hotel's meeting space. The building is a nearly 200-year old church that has been converted for business meetings and is absolutely amazing. Central meeting room is in the church rotunda and just oozes charm. For a group of up to 125-150, this is a very unique space to hold a gathering. Food was also very good...highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location ,stupendous service ,real gem in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Shanij60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an example to high quality in all aspects: the staff is the best possible ,the location is not less than perfect and the rooms are renovated suppliyng great comfort and sleep quality. Beside that they serve a very good breakfast and the hotel bar is also a great spot. With no doubt - BEST HOTEL IN AMSTERDAM!!

Reviews.Title: “Brillant - by far the best hotel experience and I shall definetly go back!”
Reviews.Author: benbowna
Reviews.Content: I am the sort of person who never writes reviews, but after my weekend stay at the Renaissance I felt I must. I arrived at about 10pm and the check in was swift and very welcoming. The room was fine for one person, but would have been a bit tight for two - but that wasnt a problem for me as I was out sightseeing all day. It was also so clean (I mean really spotless) and functional with a bed that was so comfy I just did not want to get out of it. It is true there is no tea or coffee making facilites in the room which is a shame and I hope they review that, but that really is the only negative thing I can say. What really made the hotel was the staff. From the concierge, the bar staff, the housekeeping team, everyone really could not have done enough for us and was so friendly and welcoming. Directions, room reservations, helping with luggage or whatever you needed assistance with - they provided it. It made my stay on the whole very very enjoyable. We plan to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Over rated!”
Reviews.Author: Saran S
Reviews.Content: Well, where can I start? This hotel claims to be a 5 star but there is:- -no coffee in the room -no free wifi -billing system always sucks (they hold on to 5 times to your stay bill on your credit card and you have to beg them to release it) -cunning mini bar which double counts after you remove one chocolate bar -their 9th floor rooms are actually on a different part of the hotel which feels like ibis and god forbid if your rooms keys don't work, you have to walk a mile back to the reception! Enough said!

Reviews.Title: “Very well placed for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BertyBrit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within a few minutes walk of Central Station and from thence there are fast (c.20 minutes) direct connections to Schipol. A weekend rail pass works out at about â‚¬7.50, whilst a cab from the airport is more likely to come in at around â‚¬40. Amsterdam is a small city and most places are accessible from the hotel by foot and for the less nimble, access to the extensive tram network is very close by. Because you are situated close to the canals and are on the edge of the Red Light district, evenings can prove a little boisterous in a pleasant sort of way. Thanks to the ineptitude of British Airways, our visit should have been longer than the two days that it was, however we did manage to pack in a fair amount. Key places to visit are the Rijksmuseum, which has been in a curtailed form for a number of years, but will be fully restored and re-opened in 2013. It does however feature a very good exhibition on Dutch maritime history, as well as many fine and familiar paintings, including â€œThe Night Watchâ€�; also not to be missed is the Amsterdam Museum, which is close to the Calwerstraat and deals specifically with Amsterdamâ€™s history, which is brought to life in a number of very good ways. We did not eat in the hotel and when offered breakfast at â‚¬27.50 per night, felt that there ought to be and indeed found some extremely good (and arguably much cheaper) alternatives. Evening meals only proved difficult in terms of the huge choice and numbers â€“ red meat eaters will be in steak heaven in that there seem to be an enormous number of steakhouses, including some very well known chains. Restaurant of the moment is Momo, where booking is an absolute must and is a good place to people watch. We liked the hotel and its staff very much. The only unsurprising downside was that everything seemed to have price, although the staff more than made up for this in various ways. Our room which could have been a little larger was dominated by an extremely comfortable king-sized bed and had a good view out the front. All things considered we would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “The only spot for me in AMS!”
Reviews.Author: DionneJDavis
Reviews.Content: 5mins walk from the train station. Right in the middle of everything. Great public areas, restaurant, and lobby bar. The rooms are perfectly fine. The staff is great! They are super attentive and helpful, making one feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything!”
Reviews.Author: Vronge
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for three nights during winter break. It was just great and I would recommend it to anyone going to the wonderful city of Amsterdam! Excepitional comfortable beds, friendly staff, clean, trendy and great location

Reviews.Title: “Close to everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Gracia12
Reviews.Content: This is our second hotel for our European trip. We chose hotels primarily based on location, and this one is a treasure! Within walking distance to the central location, even more near to the tram central station. The tram will take you anywhere in Amsterdam. The beauty of this gem is with everything within walking distance it is located in a quieter street, without the heavy crowd and the bicycles! Clean room, adequate space to have two big suitcases. Clean bathrooms. I commend the staff for trying to be nice and helpful. Breakfast was always good. We love a full breakfast. I just wish that wifi was free or at least cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rouniuyizu
Reviews.Content: Went there during my vacation recently and a good hotel to stay. The room is big enough and the lounge is good. The location is also very convenient, no matter whether you wanna catch a train in time, enjoy a casual walk along the river, or even visit the fanous red light zone.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for business or leisure travelers”
Reviews.Author: nyc2italy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night this February and found the hotel to be very centrally located, clean, with good-sized rooms and a nice, helpful staff. It is not a charming hotel by any means (just a typical modern chain hotel) but it is very clean, the rooms were surprisingly big and it's very close to the train station. The next time we go to Amsterdam, I think we would choose to stay more in the residential area farther away from the train station and the red light district, however, if you are looking for a good place convenient to the train station then I would definitely recommend this hotel as a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mixed service”
Reviews.Author: victoria_adams
Reviews.Content: I arrived late following a delayed flight due to the snow in Schipol, to join friends who had flown earlier in the day. We though 1 quick beer before bed would be a good idea and the hotel had no bars open even though this was before midnight. We were told the only place to get a drink was in our rooms so we just went to bed. The staff member was quite rude and given this was a Friday I was a little surprised that nothing was open. The hotel room was large and clean and we had access to the club lounge where the breakfast was limited but tasty but as with most trips to Amsterdam we did not spend very long in the hotel so difficult to recommend or critisise

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you expect of a Marriott/Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravisJGood
Reviews.Content: If you are a Marriott Rewards person, like me, you look for Marriott Properties. This hotel meets US standards and feels like an American hotel. Food is excellent and even the bar has 3 food menus to choose from. Close to the train station which makes for a short walk, however many cabs will refuse to drive you there as the distance is so short, which can be a pain with luggage. Walk is about 10 minutes. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: NatashaAnderson
Reviews.Content: Location Hotel is in the best location, over the road from the station and a 10 minute walk to all the attractions. Check in was not until 3pm and i arrived around 10am to ask if they could store my luggage so i do not have to carry it around. They told us the room was ready and checked us in within 5 minutes We stayed in a club floor room, the room was huge with a comfortable bed and very modern decor. The bathroom was a tad bit small but had a bath which was nice to relax in after a long day of walking around (In the snow!). I am really fussy when it comes to hotels and this is a 5 star hotel. If you book a club floor room you have access to the club lounge which offers all beverages and snacks at certain times as well as breakfast. We also ordered room service which was quick and the food was so tasty All the staff were friendly and the cleaners kept our room immaculate. If i ever go to amsterdam again i will not think twice about staying here. Natasha & Michael Liverpool

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoungeOnTheBeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Amsterdam on business. This is without a doubt the nicest hotel in which I've stayed in Europe (at least so far). The hotel is beautiful. The staff is very friendly and helpful and go far behind the minimum requirements in helpfulness and friendliness. The bed was comfortable and I was able to control the temperature in the room (I'm very hot-natured, so this is an issue in some hotels). The bathroom was small, but certainly not cramped. There was ample space for me to work at the desk. The hotel is within easy walking distance of central station, so it's great for business trips. I suspect it would be nice for a vacation as well. The location is also close to a number of restaurants so you can walk for dinner (or hop on the train or tram if you want to go somewhere else). I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have asked for a nicer stay”
Reviews.Author: RhondaRoams
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, quiet and very well kept. The staff was friendly, helpful and at times hilarious. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. Breakfast in the reataurant was VERY good and the breakfast in the lounge was good, too. Great coffee! All the staff went above an beyond to make our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “thanks for your all”
Reviews.Author: DosNguyen
Reviews.Content: Helen and I traveled 3 European country trip, including France, Belgium and Netherlands, all staying in Marriott chain, but the best is here, Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel: beautifull, chammed, comfortable and very friendly...Thanks all for yoor help but especially we want to thanks to Shasa ( or Sasa?, a beautiful black lady), a supervisor there, she responded our request very quickly and easily. Dos Nguyen from San Francisco, USA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, No surprises”
Reviews.Author: EdgarSGuatemala
Reviews.Content: I booked the Renaissance Hotel for a short 2 days stay in Amsterdam. I went for this hotel based on its location walking distance from the Central Station. I had to catch a very early train so the location was very important. I was not dissapointed, the location is near everything, I do not know if the service in other hotels is good or bad but I do not think that it was the best service I ever had. First of all I flew almost 10 hours to get to Amsterdam and arrived early, I wanted an early check in and did not get it. I wanted to have breakfast very early in the morning but found out that the restaurant opened until 7 a.m. (or something like that). Other than that the staff was very friendly and the room was more than acceptable. In general peolple in the Netherlands speak very good english.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Bumble2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located for all of the sights. Being just a short walk from Centraal Station it is quick and easy to get from the airport to hotel without the added cost of a taxi. The rooms are well maintained and to a high standard. The staff are without exception very friendly and welcoming and the food exceeded that which I have received in more 'expensive' Amsterdam hotels! Great base for a trip to Amsterdam and good location to meet up with Amsterdam based friends for drinks and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “good to find usual high standard at Renaissance Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Vecchio59
Reviews.Content: Good size rooms, nice and cozy lounge with warm service. definitely a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Friends in Holland”
Reviews.Author: VaGal2005
Reviews.Content: We spent nine days in The Netherlands this spring, six of which were at this hotel. It is an excellent property. Service excellent...lovely rooms....great location. Of course you are one block from a brothel but in most cases you are close to one anyway. The Palace (recently renovated) and lots of restaurants are within walking distance as well. Breakfast buffet was about $40.00 per person...truly sticker shock for us. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: tkripala
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here the last three times I visited for business. The location is fantastic! Just a five minute walk to the train station. It is close to shopping and most of the tourist attractions. The rooms are comfortable and staff were very courteous and helpful. Their breakfast buffet is very good though expensive and they have a free espresso and latte machine for those who don't want to eat.Only negative is that they charge for Internet access unless you have a Marriott Gold guest status.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pleasant rooms”
Reviews.Author: StevenG2
Reviews.Content: Modern entrance friendly reception staff. Well decorated and comfortable bedrooms. Close to station and tram stops well priced bar snacks, mini burgers a tasty option. There was a large breakfast buffet but expensive. I will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: sea7212
Reviews.Content: Always stayed in this hotel. Great location. 5 minutes to the train station. The rooms are clean. Staff is excellent. Very tasty breakfasts - a great choice. Excellent bar. There is access to business lounge. Negative is a lot of tourists:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CopeTravel
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay a couple of days at this location on December 27-29. The really great thing about the hotel is the location. It is about a 4 minute walk from the Central Amsterdam station. The area is really great and you can walk to almost all of the attractions in the area. There is shopping, food, tours, red light district - all in walking distance. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Of course it was the holiday season and the hotel was absolutley beautiful. The food in the restaurants was great as well. Room was great for myself and very modern. If you are staying in Amsterdam. I highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: PoliticalHack2
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location, Great Staff, Comfortable Room, Superb Concierge Lounge. And the Concierge has a cool handlebar mustache. I don't know what else you could want when traveling to Amsterdam. It is obviously on the expensive side though.

Reviews.Title: “nice quaint cosy hotel but terrible food”
Reviews.Author: afrequenttraveller20
Reviews.Content: nice bathrooms, nice beds, small rooms but horrible food

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanD4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Renaissance for 8 nights and enjoyed the hotel, location, and the staff. This is a very well run establishment, extremely professional in all areas while being outgoing and friendly. The Amsterdam Renaissance is head and shoulders above Brussels Renaissance in every detail. I can't say enough good things about the staff, especially the concierge staff. They were so helpful, even helped us find a luggage repair shop. You will not go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS, IMPECCABLE 5 STAR DELIGHT”
Reviews.Author: hotelinspecytor
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the Hotel reception, you are met with pristine articulate smart professionals with a genuine smile on their faces, eager to welcome you to their hotel. The doorman to the junior porter are brilliant, polite and so eager to be of assistance. The rooms are cosy, modern, absolutely meticulous, clean, superbly stocked with toiletries, and incredibly comfortable modern mattress, and choice of pillows. The towels in the bedrooms and bed sheets, and curtains could have been provided from Harrods in London, excellent quality. even the windows are clean, not a speck of dust around. A choice of heating or air condition , which works. Modern televisions, and a great work station unit, and comfortable sofa and chairs. The corridors are clean and modern, lifts impeccable and clean. Breakfasts amazing choice, top quality and most helpful waiter/ress service, who continually want to pour fresh hot coffee or other hot drinks. A chef to make you eggs your style, and cleans the frying pan after each use. A beautiful bar, well stocked. This is a 5 star hotel, or should it be called a 7 star hotel, thinkthe latter. Siutuated in a brilliant position 8 minutes walk from Central station, same to damm square and the shops. A totally safe refined area.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Diamondzeta
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I often like to 'pop' into Amsterdam. We always stay here, it is very clean, tidy, and modern without being overbearing. The staff are always friendly and greet us with a smile. Cannot wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, spacious & great service!”
Reviews.Author: DayungBidayuh
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location just a few minutes away from Amsterdam Central train station. Looks like it has undergone a recent reno! Loved the contemporary/modern decor. Very uncluttered (just the way we like it). The rooms were spacious, which helps greatly if you travel with young kids. There are lots of restaurants & shops nearby. If you're willing to spend a little bit more, go for the club lounge. One always gets some extra perks with "the club/executive" option like free wine, hors d'oeuvre/snacks & internet. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Strong Service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mvanderh
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Amsterdam for many years, I know this hotel is located in the right side of town. Away from the real tourist traps, but slap bang in the middle of where real 'Amsterdammers' live. Bonus is walking distance from Central Station, which makes the use of taxis redundant. The hotel itself is understated but luxurious. Rooms are good, especially the club ones are big. LIke with all high-starred chain hotels, everythings works smooth and as you would expect it. The executive package (with lounge access and breakfast) seemed good value for money. The lounge is spacious, and the 7 PM snacks were plentiful and delicious. Breakfast was fairly standard, but of good quality. Internet speeds were excellent, whihc was one of the main points of choosing the lounge. All in all, a very good looking hotel, in the right place with the right services. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in great physical condition but service has declined”
Reviews.Author: sautillo
Reviews.Content: It is "low season" so the hotel seems to be understaffed. Breakfast is no longer servd in the executive lounge. You go to the regular crowded restaurant. During the low season, the value of the executive lounge declines. Non-Dutch workers are service-oriented and helpful. Native Dutch workers at the hotel seem to have an attitutde of "don't bother me" and "if I provide you with service I am doing you anfavor". I have stayed here several times in the past and given a high rating. I no longer can. So next time, I will return to the Marriott Amsterdam. I hope that the native Dutch workers treat the non-nativemDutch workers better than they are treating the guests. I am sadly disappointed inthe attitudes I have beer encountering.

Reviews.Title: “Short visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lahti56
Reviews.Content: Two quick days in Amsterdam. The Renaissance was very pleasant and I was able to check in early. They offer a free coffee bar in the lounge area. It is a short walk from the Central Station. i8f you don't want to fight the lights on the west side of the station is a walk with an underpass, mainly for bicycles but you can use the sidewalk to avoid the traffic and lights. it follows Singel Street that will take you to the street that the hotel is on. The concerge was helpful as was a young bellmen who stood in when the concerge was away. If you go out the front revolving door and turn right you are 100yds thru the alley to Spuistraat Street and there is a cafe/bakery on the SE side of the street that is great for breakfast. There is also a grocery tore on this street NE as you leave the alley. Small rooms but it is what it is in Amsterdam. Very clean and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, alright location, although a little pricy”
Reviews.Author: Swissycub27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, contemporary and very clean, in fact, I really can't fault it although the room we were given was a "King Deluxe" and truth be told, the room and bathroom were on the small side. That said, we didn't spend much time in the room except for sleeping and so really, with the delights of the city so near-by I wouldn't be too concerned, after all, why travel to Amsterdam to spend all your time in your hotel room!? The hotel was very easy to find, you literally walked straight down from the main railway station and within 5-10 minutes, you were at the hotel - that said, the hotels entrance is cleverly hidden down a smaller side street which at first did confuse us. As soon as you enter the hotel, you are wowed! Modern, contemporary and very slick and clean!. The staff were friendly, polite and definitely willing to help no matter the request (in fact it was our anniversary and we were given a complimentary bottle of red wine!). The bar wasn't that impressive but as I said earlier, there are many better places to eat and drink than within the hotel - for example, just round the corner on the main road is a fantastic Argentinian Steak house, a must! Breakfast was fantastic, lovely setting and a fantastic spread of food. The "executive lounge" was spacious and a nice extra which we didn't expect. All in all, I cannot fault the hotel, its everything you pay for, although for being so close to the Dam expect to pay for such service. And for that note, for those on a tight budget this hotel may not be the best of choices but for what you pay for, you will not regret it. After all, quiet road, small walk from the station and to the Dam, close to shops, cafes, coffee shops, restaurants etc and very helpful concierge staff!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, less than stellar neigbhorhood”
Reviews.Author: DCjourneygirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was wonderful with amazing staff and the best restaurant ever! The rooms are spacious and the water pressure in the showers will melt away the stress of a long flight or long day of sightseeing. The executive lounge is well stocked. The concierge staff is very helpful and always willing to help. And the beds are like sleeping on a cloud, so comfortable! The location is near Central Station and adjacent to red-light district and coffee shops on one side. It is fine as far as safety goes because that area is so touristy however it is not as nice as other parts of town, especially near Vondel Park or the museum district. It is walking distance to many things and so it is not a terrible location, just know it is a bit seedy depending on which direction and street you choose to walk on. The other direction has the very fashionable streets and is much nicer. The hotel also has full-day bike rentals for just 15 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations stepped up their game!!”
Reviews.Author: JMfromMemphis
Reviews.Content: My last visit to this hotel was about 2 years ago. At that time this establishment was getting a bit worn and torn, but I was willing to give it a try as I read they had recently completed a renovation. Was I ever in for a surprised.....new entrance, sleek new lobby, new restaurant, updated rooms. NICE! My check in was very quickly handled by a friendly staffer. My room was clean, neat, and well appointed with new furniture and a king sized bed, albeit typically Euro sized (small). The bathroom has seen a major makeover...a significant upgrade from the past. In addition to being a nice place to stay, you have the benefit of being less than five minutes from the central train station. (It's an easy walk with just a couple of bags. Unfortunately if you have a ton of luggage you may have a problem. Amsterdam cabbies are renowned for refusing very short haul rides to nearby hotels, even if it's pouring raining.) The hotel's location is on a relatively quiet side street off the beaten path of tourists in the dam district. Tourists attractions are all within walking distance. My only gripe about this establishment is one that I have with most European hotels....overpriced internet service ($26 a day) and overpriced, though excellent breakfast buffet ($34 at the current exchange rate). The hotel restaurant (Scossa) is excellent. Most hotel restaurants are fair at best, but not this one. Check out their mediterranean flair. Ok, Renaissance, you've earned my business back, thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very modern”
Reviews.Author: lmbunl95
Reviews.Content: Had a layover in amsterdam and my friend used points for this stay. It was a fantastic hotel, amazing beds, great shower and a real hairdryer. Sky tv if you want to chill and relax while watching some tv. The staff spoke excellent english and was able to give us directions to local sites. The conceirge level had an abundance of amentities including usa today and tons of food/snacks/beverages.

Reviews.Title: “great location and nicely modern in an old building”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here and loved it. Walking distance from central station, and just far enough off the strip to be peaceful. Also had a very nice club lounge with good breakfast and great happy hour snacks. Perfect way to start a night out on the town.

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: Seth G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best in the city, when visiting Amsterdam I usually stay at the Marriott which is a good hotel but the location leaves much to be desired. The Renaissance had it all, ideal location less than a 2 minute walk to the central rail station which is where all tours start from and there is an endless supply of great places to eat all in walking distance. As for the staff they could not have been nicer or more helpful. The hotel is very clean bright and modern. If you are staying for work or pleasure a comfortable bed and a hot shower are essential and the Renaissance did not fail. A very special thank you to the concierge team who helped out with a medical situation; they arraigned for medical attention and all follow up care. They saved the vacation! The Renaissance will be my new hotel of choice when visiting Amsterdam! I look forward to my return in a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler1691
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the hotel. Great location, very close to Central Station and a 5 minute walk from the tram. Beautiful interior. I had access to the concierge level and took full advantage of it. Breakfast was good, but don't expect a hot meal. Cereals and european style with breads, pastries, cold cuts, cheeses and fruit. Coffee maker was poorly located, so it typically had a backup every morning. Evening socials were also good with a variety of hot and cold appetizers. Room was great. Very good size, excellent and comfortable bedding. TV channels were too limited - no free movie channels. But lots of news channels. Concierge was very helpful with restaurants - always on the mark with recommendations. Well appointed gym. Hotel bar was also nice. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance - perfectly wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: shazlizdav
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel made the half term WONDERFULLY RESTFUL for us - could never stay anywhere else!!! We (husband and self) and 14 / 17 yr old sons. Spent all October half term here - quiet position, wonderfully comfortable huge beds, excellent food, boys ate everything with great gusto! NO complaints whatsoever, the staff are THE MOST CO-OPERATIVE, I have ever come across anywhere, ( beat the American Renaissance staff hands down) believe me - I AM FUSSY :) The lovely people working in the EXEC. LOUNGE proved to be epitome of Customer Service, especially Ridayu and Carlos - no task too big. The hotel is perfectly positioned for trains, trams and buses. The info provided on arrival covers everything you'll need and any other query will be answered promptly and with the reassurance and learned knowledge of 'locals' living and working within the city. Don't hesitate, stay here you'll not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of thieves”
Reviews.Author: Jorge H
Reviews.Content: On the way to Amsterdam I bought a bottle of CK be perfume at the airport. I was travelling only with carry-on luggage so I needed a 100ml bottle. We arrived at the hotel in the afternoon and I threw the packaging and receipt to the dustbin. I used the perfume next morning and then we left with my wife to go to the city. Probably that was the last time I saw it cause in evening I couldn't find it. Next morning (we stayed in Renaissance for 2 nights) when I started packing my bag I searched the room and belongings thoroughly and the CK bottle was simply gone. I used it only in the bathroom and it vanished together with the packaging, receipt and other rubbish from the dustbin. I informed the security and they checked that apart from us no one entered the room, except for the room cleaning of course. However security just shrugged their arms stating they have no evidence to accuse anybody. It's not a matter of lost perfume but I must say I am simply surprised. I work in the travel industry and have slept in hundreds of hotels all over the world, sometimes in cheap and lousy small hotels in Guatemala, India or Cambodia. Although you are always warned in such places to take special care of your belongings I have never had such negative experience. I used to work 7 years for a Dutch company and visited Amsterdam a couple of times a year and experienced different hotels in the city. I find the city amazing , thrilling but always safe. I am very disappointed that after all those good impressions I got robbed in a pricey and renowned Renaissance hotel - chain of the Marriott hotels. Apart from this negative story I must say the hotel itself is quite nice, the localization is superb, close to the shopping alleys, bars and restaurants, nightlife and RedLight District, canal cruises etc. , just 5minute walk to Central Station to take you to Schiphol. The room was tiny , but comfortable, and it was very quiet in the night. In other circumstances I would have recommended this hotel, however now I must say either stay away or you might have your personal items stolen from the room or secure all your items in a chain locked suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on a Club Room.”
Reviews.Author: Potakas
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a weekend and everything was excellent. The hotel is indeed beautiful. I booked a cheap guest room and I was upgraded at check in on a Club room due to my Marriott Rewards Status. The club room wasn't something exciting and I didn't have any view but the club lounge is one of he best on Marriott's network.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: skill123
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night in this hotel but couldn't fault it. Service at checkin was friendly, good and efficient. The room was very nice, modern and new and the bed was amazingly comfortable. I didn't pay - a friend did - so I don't know how much it cost! The location is great. 5 mintues from Centraal and the old town but just far anough out of the way to be quiet. I would stay here again if I had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “central location paid heavily”
Reviews.Author: Niedrig
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Good: 5 minutes from central station, walking distance to major shopping areas, clean rooms, good bed. many restaurants in the vicinity. so, so: rooms rather small, low water pressure in the shower, a little noisy, surroundings of the hotel low range: dirty and crowded. Cleaning personnel talks very loud in front of the room. bad: price policy: the room rate is already high. If you add internet and breakfast, it gets out of control. If you travel with your own car, the price for the garage is beyond common acceptance. May be for Amsterdam, this is what to expect for a good hotel? We may still come back if we want to use the train for our traveling.

Reviews.Title: “gr8 Location”
Reviews.Author: VibhooSachdeva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance for 4 days while in Amsterdam on holiday . the Price were liter high as it was winter season. But for the location, the price probably wasn't too bad. The location was the best! It's only a 5 minute walk to Centraal Station where you can catch a train to almost anywhere. Trams also run from there and there is one leg of the tram system that you can catch one block over from the hotel. You can walk to a ton of places and restaurants from this location. It was so nice to be able to walk around and visit different neighborhoods and when you get tired, just hop on a tram. The concierge gave an easy explanation of the tram system and offered helpful tips. It was charged to the room and I didn't have to wait in line for tickets at the museum. The entire staff was excellent, helpful and pleasant. The room was fairly large for a European hotel. It had two large windows that opened up onto one of the side streets which provided a nice view. The room was clean and the beds were nice. I had no problem with noise; not from other rooms or from the outside. Although coffee was not provided in the room,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: va2pa2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance for 30 days while in Amsterdam on business. I can't comment on the price since the company paid, but I believe it was a little pricey and wi-fi did cost extra. But for the location, the price probably wasn't too bad. The location was the best! It's only a 5 minute walk to Centraal Station where you can catch a train to almost anywhere. Trams also run from there and there is one leg of the tram system that you can catch one block over from the hotel. You can walk to a ton of places and restaurants from this location. It was so nice to be able to walk around and visit different neighborhoods and when you get tired, just hop on a tram. The concierge gave an easy explanation of the tram system and offered helpful tips. Speaking of concierge, I bought tickets to the Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum from them. It was charged to the room and I didn't have to wait in line for tickets at the museum. The entire staff was excellent, helpful and pleasant. The room was fairly large for a European hotel. It had two large windows that opened up onto one of the side streets which provided a nice view. The room was clean and the beds were nice. I had no problem with noise; not from other rooms or from the outside. Although coffee was not provided in the room, I always stopped by the coffee station near the lobby on my way out in the morning. There's also an Albert Heijn nearby for groceries and snacks - it's just up the alley on the side of the hotel, just one block away. There are lots of restaurants and shops nearby....there was always something to do or somewhere to go. Overall, they made me very happy for 30 days for which I am very grateful. I'm already planning my next trip back and will definitely stay at the Renaissance again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service.”
Reviews.Author: BEQS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October for the weekend. I used my Marriott reward points so didn't pay the normal rates. The executive lounge serves nice free wine and the food was adequate although they couldn't keep up with the demand as the lounge was crowded. Our room was clean although the sink was blocked and emptied slowly. Hotel location is excellent for train access and for generally walking around the river areas. We would easily pick this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice typical 5* chain hotel but awful restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: HendrikM
Reviews.Content: This is a very good business hotel. Excellent location 5 mins from Centraal it has all the standard features expected on a 5* hotel. The service is good, the rooms are well appointed, maybe on the small side but very clean and comfortable. I was extremely dissapointed about the restaurant however: the sublime taste of the carpaccio was spoilt by some kind of cocktail sauce and the parmesan shaves were so frozen I couldn't taste anything. The risotto equally failed to impress with a rather soggy texture and lack of taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in centrum”
Reviews.Author: AnitaSk
Reviews.Content: The location is really 5 min walk from Central station and 2 min to the busy central district, but still secluded from the noise of vibrant Amsterdam. Stuff was very helpful and polite and met all our needs. The rooms are great and very comfy - the beds and pillows at Marriott are always ensuring best sleep ever. Breakfast is good, but very pricey- 25 EUR. There is a great dinner deal, though (especially compared to breakfast) - 32 EUR for a 3 course meal with 2 glasses of wine. And the food was really tasty!The only downside is no free wi-fi, ridiculous priced at 20 EUR (or more, can't well remember) per day.

Reviews.Title: “No power!”
Reviews.Author: ting w
Reviews.Content: Although location of this hotel is two blocks from the main train central station, everything was working out well until the power went out from our hotel room sometime in the middle of the night. Then, did not turn on until after check out. We were offered to get ready and dressed in another room but I couldn't collect my belongings in the dark to even move rooms!!! I feel that for it being a "renaissance" and you basically pay for services, they did not do a very good job in keeping my faith. They also offered for us to hang out in the elite room (which we already had access). We couldn't charge our laptops or phones... pretty aggravating. Also, I would not pay for an upgraded room with a "street view" unless you want to hear party music all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel close to station”
Reviews.Author: crackersX5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family and had a twin plus extra bed in room, the extra bed was good quality mattress and full set of linen I slept very well. There was a turn-down service and a chocolate left on pillow which was nice touch. No coffee making in room but limited coffee in reception, not sure of the times when available. No free wifi. The breakfast was excellent and catered for all tastes and diets, ate far too much but good start to day. Concierge was very helpful and the service from staff first class, did not eat dinner there as preferred to eat out. Hotel is around 10 minutes from Central Station as long as you have case on wheels its an easy stroll, good location for boat trips and Anne Frank House, cafes and bars close by and can walk bit further to visit the other sights and night life. We took a tram to museum quarter as public transport is excellent and easy to use. This hotel would suit all travellers except those on a budget, but after a long day as a tourist it was nice to have a comfortable bed, your choice.

Reviews.Title: “great value,great location”
Reviews.Author: ZETA333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property in October for 2 days. I loved loved loved the location. This hotl was modern, with great service and an amazing Club level lunge which provided breakfast,snacks and dessert, with unlimited beer,wine beverages. The exercise room was well equipped and I took full advantage of it. The rooms were spacious and clean. The hotel provided tickets to local attractions and were only minutes away on foot to many attractions. I would definately recommend this hotel for its value, service and location

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Good”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: When I review the Renaissance I must point out that I didn't actually experience too much of the food so my comments are based on the accommodation only. The rooms are a great size, very clean and full of the necessities for a week away from home. Yet everything comes at a price; the wireless is extortionate and I hate to think what the minibar stock cost, but a more luxurious hotel has a higher price band. Position wise, the hotel was in a great position. It's a stones throw from Central Station and on the right side of the Damrak. A quick stroll and you find yourself in the wonderful Jordaan area and away from the tourist areas that we all love to hate. A great hotel, thank goodness my company paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs or Fleas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: daz1967Stockport
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times in the past, I booked 3 rooms this time for 6 men, many months before I travelled, yet was made to share a queen bed with another man!!!!! So were my friends. It was October, definitely no Mosquitos lol, yet I was bitten 4 times in bed, not good. I am a platinum Marriott card holder, got no assistance from staff whatsoever, won't stay again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: linkedlist
Reviews.Content: The advantages in favor of the hotel: 1. Very good location- 5 minutes walk from the train station 2. The interiors of the hotel and the rooms were very good. 3. the staff was very helpful and you can buy many museum tickets in the hotel itself. I checked in a little bit early and absolutely has no issues. I would give it 4 stars instead of 5 coz of these two reasons: 1. It is a little pricey, although I suspect hotels in Amsterdam are generally expensive. 2. Also the location itself doesn't lead to any views from your windows. All in all, if i visit Amsterdam again, I would strongly consider choosing this hotel again for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “central location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_M_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: Overall a really great stay. Our room was excellent, a good size and very clean. The staff was unbelievably helpful from check-in to check-out. Everyone was very very nice. The location is also fantastic, very central and within walking distance to everything. Also very close to the tram stop if you prefer to take the tram. We did not hear much outside noise at all (our room was on the 1st floor). We could tell that one of our neighbors was smoking in their room (the hotel is non-smoking) but the staff prompty took care of the situation quickly. We would highly recommended this place to stay! We hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: JMcGorman
Reviews.Content: The photo available online doesn't do the hotel justice. It's located on a quiet, little street near the Red Light district. East access to Central Station. The staff was very friendly and accessible and our room, although small, was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: atina_11
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is in a great location, in a nice quiet street, nearby in the tourist areas and also near the Central Train Station. Room was clean and comfortable, stuff were very helpful and friendly. Scossa restaurant was amazing, great food at a good price and i also enjoyed the lounge, which has nice atmosphere and very good service. I would stay there again gladly, there is nothing to complain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: gdlstx
Reviews.Content: LOCATION- Excellent location especially if you want to be near the Central Train Station. It's literally around the corner and a hop across a couple of streets. Can't be missed. Very convenient when you're totting luggage. To get around town, public trans (S-bahn) can be caught just up the street from the hotel - about a 3 minute walk. It's very easy to ride and will get you to all touristy parts w/ ease. Or if you're interested in the city tours; you can catch the very noticeable double-decker in front of the station. STAFF- Anytime we had to interact w/ staff, it was pleasant. Very much in keeping w/ Marriott's customer service standards. Note: front office manager, Steve Provance goes above and beyond to be helpful. ROOMS- The rooms are very much what you would expect from a Marriott property. Very clean, large, and comfy. At least they were on the club/concierge level. Great place to return after walking all day, which is exactly what you'll do in Amsterdam. Note: I believe this building is shared w/ a night club in the rear. If you're a light sleeper be certain to request a room at the front of the hotel. Otherwise, you'll hear the music well. It wasn't a nuisance for me but I'd imagine it would be for some. As well as rooms with windows facing the alley. Most young kids park their bikes there and congregate after club hours before taking off. They aren't at all obnoxiously loud or anything like that but they can be heard at 3am. RESTAURANT- Within the hotel, there are a couple of different choices that are fine. A bit over-priced but that's typical within hotels. I'd recommend venturing into the city for a variety of food options- from various regions. I was pleasantly surprised to see so many different cuisines in Amsterdam. Overall, a great stay and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay at central location”
Reviews.Author: Merkey
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is in a great location, a short walk from the Central Railway station and the touristy areas of Amsterdam. But what's great about it is that it is off a quiet street and although our room faced the front of the hotel, it was peaceful and quiet. We had the benefit of a corporate rate and our room was slightly on the small side, it was obviously newly renovated. In fact the room did not reflect the slightly old and anonymous looking common areas on the room floors. The concierge and reception staff were professional and helpful but a bit frazzled during the busy weekend turnover - however, they dealt with all of our requests promptly. Overall, there was nothing particularly special about the hotel but a good choice for a short break in central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “discover amsterdam staying here ,”
Reviews.Author: jjmat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference , the hotel has extended into another buiding, and added more rooms. however to get to few of those extended floors , its going thru a maze , got lost a few times on the first day , and to reach room 935 , carrying my luggage was indeed difficult , it was situtated between 2 floors tucked away in a corner, next to an office. My room window opened into the narrow street and few feet away from the neighbouring house window. Restaurants are good, location is also great to central station and other sights around and to the tour companies, Concierge was excellent. wireless Internet were overpriced . and the room rates are slightly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell_edi
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel central location and very clean too. The night bar was great! Delicious cocktails and Pantelis kept us very good company!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Natalie3107Sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference in Amsterdam and came back for a short stay after a side trip to Switzerland. The first room we stayed in on the first floor was nice and spacious. The second time around we were put in the room numbers 900 and above which are about a 400 metre walk and two lifts from reception. The second room we were in had super low ceilings in the shower and above the bed. I think I bumped my head about 4 times in 3 days (really painful). Also - it really annoyed me that there was no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Coffee and tea was complimentary in the foyer during the morning but nothing is available at night except expensive room service. Also - no free wifii. Not even in the foyer. Will not be coming back. Even the stroopwaffles at reception couldn't lure me back.

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in room...!!!”
Reviews.Author: shopgirl007
Reviews.Content: First I need to say that we stayed there 2 years ago: we choose the Renaissance because of its location - also the rooms looked very nice on the webpage - like newly renovated. We payed the night before to get an early check in. They found my reservation, but gave us a dirty room - after that we were changed to a room facing the street - that was unbelievable loud, because the windows were sooo old - not soundproofed. Finally we get a room on the third floor - well - ok, also we ask for a high floor room. Breakfast was very crowded - nobody cared about guests or anything. One day the coffee machine was broken - not important for us - we drink tea all the time, but all the others guests were not amused! Also there are lots of guests to stay one night there before doint a cruise - so you have luggage everywhere on the floors... and lots of people running around. They closed the restaurant on Sundays - like many other ones - very strange, because you need somewhere to have dinner - also Ã­tÂ´s a Marriott and I havenÂ´t seen that before! The roomservice we ordered was made without any love - pancakes - the lady became roud when we asked to order that (it was on the menu). Also the minibar-lady - who seemed to be the same than the roomservice lady was loud when she checked and refilled the minibars on the floor - like: IÂ´m awake to earn money, so you (guests) can also wake up... - NICE TOUCH!!! The best was on our last night when we noticed that thereÂ´s a mouse in our room! We just want to get out for dinner on my birthday and saw the mouse running around in our room. We called the duty manager and he didnÂ´t trust us to 100%, because in the meanwhile the mouse dissapeared - the roomdoors donÂ´t close correctly - so theres space between carpet and door - the mouse could "visit" any room on the floor. The room itself was nice, but because of having a mouse in - not acceptable - just 1 point! He offered a room move and a bottle of wine - which never arrived. I told them at check out, but the lady didnÂ´t care - she had the message on the screen that somebody delivered it to our room and if itÂ´s on the screen it should be the truth! We booked over the internet - a very discounted rate, maybe thatÂ´s why they didnÂ´t cared that much, but we would never return!

Reviews.Title: “double room come only with french bed”
Reviews.Author: RialtoBE
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, great location but room in the first floor to the street are bad isolated: You hear the cars driving by, people talking, car doors slamming. The double room come with french bed (1.6m) and rooms are quite small. Hotel is in walking distance from the station and next to the lovely single gracht.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Paul_UKNortheast
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our holiday, before ferrying back to the UK after a two week tour of the Alps in our Ford Model A. The location was great and our car was immediately parked in their secure, on site, under cover garage.The staff were excellent and immediately offered us an upgrade (for a fee). By the time you worked out the additional internet, breakfast and complimentary all day free drinks in the Club lounge (all of which were included), they paid for the upgrade in themselves! We had a large Club room on the back of the hotel, above the lobby area - it was excellent. Thanks for a perfect end to a perfect holiday for us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessiandAmir
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam for our Honeymoon a day earlier than originally planned and realized we had not informed our reserved hotel (the Crowne Plaza) of the change in our plans. To our dismay, they were sold out for that night, so we hauled our luggage around the corner to the Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel and we were SO happy we did! The hotel staff is amazing - incredibly nice, friendly and helpful. Breakfast was wonderful, the room was nothing short of beautiful - large and clean and absolutely charming. We loved the hotel so much, we tried to cancel our stay at the Crowne Plaza and remain at the Renaissance - but were unable to. The room at the Crowne Plaza did not even come close to comparing to the room at the Renaissance - in fact, the entire hotel paled in comparison! Please learn from our mistake and book the Renaissance for your entire stay in Amsterdam - its such a comfortable, incredible treat - you will be glad you did!!! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, well-maintained, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: nycpeg
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel as a base during a 3 week vacation to northern Europe, staying 4 different times on arrival and departure of myself and friends as well as when touring Amsterdam. The location could not be better, just a few blocks from the train station so easy to get to even when dragging heavy luggage. The staff was competent and pleasant. One of the concierges was particularly helpful in planning long distance bike rides around the country. I had access to the executive lounge which was well stocked and had interesting evening hor d'ouvres. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly, No tea making facilities!”
Reviews.Author: Fi89
Reviews.Content: As frequent British tea drinkers, there were no tea making facilities which spoilt our stay. Room service for tea was possible but expensive at the current exchange rate at 4 euros each! No free wireless in the foyer which for an establishment this size was surprising. But everything else was okay and the location was fab!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Renaissance in Amsterdam and didn't have to take the subway or a taxi one time! The hotel is located directly across the street from the train station and you can easily walk with luggage back and forth. The hotel is also walking district from the Red Light District, the Anne Frank House and great shopping, restaurants, etc. The concierge desk helped us book a canal tour and we were able to purchase the ticket at the hotel and put on our hotel bill. The concierge desk also suggested two great restaurants. The rooms are fine sized, what you expect of a hotel. The bathrooms were updated and TV was good sized. We really didn't spend too much time in the room! :) We had access to the concierge lounge which was FABULOUS! The breakfast was awesome and the "happy hour" with free apps and cocktails served as our dinner 2 nights! I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tofinogal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here using our Marriott points so I cannot comment on the value - but having used the points, we were comfortable with our decision. I have some mixed feelings about this hotel. On the one hand, there's nothing wrong with it all - nothing to complain about - but on the other hand, not a lot stands out, either. Our room was relatively small though perfectly adequate and faced in to an internal square (they call them "quiet rooms" - and they are, if people don't have their windows open while partying, which happened only one night but hey, it's Amsterdam and we were on holiday and it was pretty tough to complain about it and we didn't - doesn't affect our opinion - just thought I should mention it). When I'm on holiday I like to sit in the hotel and read with coffee or a drink and to watch the sights - well, I couldn't - so that, and the fact that internet was so expensive and sometimes iffy (I think it was 20 euros a day), are the only 2 downsides. The location is truly excellent - the hotel is walking distance to the train station (we took side-trips to Delft, the Hague); the Red Light District (odd! but very interesting!); the canals and everything actually, that there is to do. We walked and walked and walked. I never did manage to orient myself and was forever getting lost and wandering in circles (literally, one time I thought I'd walked a good distance and found a solo lunch spot and I looked out the back door and voila, there was the hotel) - but my husband got the hang of the city and spent hours traipsing around and exploring. The front desk staff were more-or-less welcoming but the concierge staff I found, were excellent. We found the restaurant to be expensive and did not eat there. I believe the breakfast alone was 26 euros. We found little bakeries and a grocery store (Albert Heijn) close-by and bought bread and cheese. So I give this hotel 4 stars but mainly for its location. It's just a place to sleep. A comfortable place to sleep, but could be anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZoriMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from August 11 to the 14. The service was great and the people were friendly. The hotel location is close to everything, I will definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Originally selected this hotel based on its location in Amsterdam for what I need to do. My first impression when we arrived was how small and crowed the lobby was with luggage piled everywhere, for a minute I thought I was back in the train station. During my entire stay the lobby was always crowed and not easy to get around because of luggage piled everywhere. Just off the lobby was a cruise boat courtesy table with people standing a rounding looking for divine intervention, always adding to the congestion. Evidently this hotel caters to people going on cruises out of Amsterdam during the summer. The room was small and over looked the street, which turned out to be noisy all night. This was the third Marriott property in Europe that I stayed at on this trip that had Internet connectivity problems, so I couldn't use my laptop in the hotel during my stay. In general a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pumpduster
Reviews.Content: Great hotel albeit the rooms are a bit small by USA standards. The location was terrific near Central Station, Red Light District and access to the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: PedroPortugal
Reviews.Content: The Renaissence has a great location so you can walk almost everywhere in the centre. Reception desk are usually crowed and check-in takes a long time. Stayed in a well appointed junior suite, clean and comfortable but thin walls (yes, you can hear everything from room next door...) and too dark for my taste. Amsterdam is a grey city with not a lot of sunlight and so are the rooms: windows are small and lights are dim which make it a bit depressing. Room service menu is not inspiring but buffet breakfast in main restaurant in excellent. Overall an average experience and I would probably try a different hotel next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel---poor check in staff”
Reviews.Author: LindaM2
Reviews.Content: We arrived for 1 night before a cruise. We paid a lot of money through Holland America Cruises for a deluxe room. Our room wasn't ready, so we had lunch on the property. I specifically asked for a quiet room because we were jet lagged from flying overseas. We were given a beautiful room, but it was next to the ice machine which was very audible in the room. Then, we were moved to a very small room which had less than a foot between the dresser and the bed.It was smaller than a cruiseship cabin! There was no room to move the suitcases to the side of the room to store them. Thank goodness the bellboy took pity on us and called the front desk to intervene. On the third try, we were put in a quiet deluxe room---that the cruiseline paid for. I felt the front desk (Samantha who spoke with an American accent) was taking advantage of jetlagged customers. We asked for a quiet room initially, so there shouldn't have been an issue. We paid for a deluxe, normal sized room so they shouldn't have tried to pawn off an unusually small room on us. Other than that, the hotel was in a great location and it was lovely. I just felt that we were being taken advantage of. Just be aware that they may try to stick you with an unsatisfactory room initially!

Reviews.Title: “good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: miss_celie
Reviews.Content: this hotel was booked through laterooms so we had no idea about it before we went - big american hotel obviously nice big rooms lovely bathroom. no coffee or tea making facilities in the room but if you take the lift down to the foyer there is free coffee (real stuff!!) available 24/7. we were room only but got room service in the afternoon one day very good reasonable and efficient

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: dsressex
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Amsterdam on numerous occasions and in some great hotels (The Sofitel Grand, The Pulitzer), but this is the best so far. The location is terrific: 5 minutes from the station and 5 minutes from the lovely neighbourhoods of the Jordaan. It felt a long way away from the livelier aspects of the city, which when you're travelling with a child is a good thing. The staff were helpful and the room spacious, ok it didn't have the canal view of, say, The Pulitzer, but then it did't have the noise either. The breakfast was truly excellent, everything really fresh and delicious; it is very pricey, so you need to get a rate that includes it. We also had the option of a 3pm check out time - very civilised. N.B. the best deal I found was on the hotel's website, which had the same room rate as the supposedly fab last minute sites and included the breakfast that they didn't. If you can, go for the Club Lounge option. It's a restful place and hot and cold drinks, newspapers etc are free all day. Amsterdam is not cheap, so it was good on occasion to go there for a coffee/juice rather than have to find a cafe. In the evening they serve wine, beer and an array of snacks, well it's almost a dinner buffet - a lovely way to start the evening. There are no cheap good hotels in Amsterdam (well, not as far as I know), if you are going to pay a hefty room rate then do it here - it's almost value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Amsterdam made the trip even better!”
Reviews.Author: Sherpa_Guy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - great location - short walk to the train station - central to most things you would like. The rooms were very clean, the staff were very helpful and friendly. The only complaint was the neighbours across the hall were very loud - but security took care of that after other guests complained. Overall an excellent stay at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: meetjimbo
Reviews.Content: An absolutely perfect location in the heart of Amsterdam. The clean and modern decor, the helpfulness of the staff and the fantastic club lounge amenities make this one of the finest Renaissance Hotels I've stayed in. Just a 5 minute walk from the Central Station, and within walking distance to everything else you would want to see and do in Amsterdam. Really, not much else to say. If you want a great place in AMS, you can't go wrong with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: WDWDolphinFan
Reviews.Content: We had a 3-night stay here in late June. Location was good, room was fine,. all as you would expect from a 4-star spot. No complaints, but nothing really exciting to us about the the hotel, either, other than the breakfasts. The breakfast buffet was one of the most extensive I've ever seen in Europe, and was quite good. Lots of options, both American-style breakfast items and European. Breakfast was included in our package, and was a real asset. No fee for internet access from computers set up in the lobby was nice, too. I would echo the comments about the cruise-line crowds, which could crowd the lobby and overwhelm check-in and concierge staff on occasion, although most of the time the lobby was fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but expensive for what you got.”
Reviews.Author: lineri
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here (3 separate rooms)and the rooms were all quite small. They offered to upgrade us for an additional 75 euro per room per night. We opted not to do that. No wifi in hotel, had to go across the street to get it at a restaurant. Breakfast very expensive at hotel so we went out every day to eat. Staff was friendly and helpful but hotel is over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not quite 5 star quality or service”
Reviews.Author: EperAgi
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel because of the reviews and location. Arrived on Friday and stayed until Sunday afternoon. The hotel didn't disappoint but there were a few issues we didn't expect from a hotel of this rating. The hotel is in the middle of the main happenings but in a quiet side street , so had no problems with noise. The rooms are clean and so is the hotel. The decoration is pleasant. The check-in / check-out was smooth and we were welcome to leave our luggage after the Sunday check-out. What surprised us was the poor quality of the bed (very soft, and well worn) and lack of free Wi-Fi. (Internet costs Â£20 a day via ethernet) Especially in a hotel with conference rooms we did expect available Wi-Fi connection. And finally, the maid knocking on our door Sunday morning despite the privacy sign was a little annoying. All in all a good hotel without the 5 start feel in a very central but quiet location. Not sure if it is worth the full price so look out for offers which they usually have. .

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeepdon
Reviews.Content: (Note that we stayed on a rate booked through DFDS Seaways, and can't comment on the value of the normal room rates). Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The front desk staff was excellent, and took a personal interest in making sure we found the sights we wanted to see, even recommending more "locals" things such as out-of-the-way outdoor markets that they thought we might enjoy. The concierge was also helpful and always ready with recommendations. Rooms were extremely spacious, very modern, and very comfortable. Very Euro-modern decor, which I enjoy - it's clean and unobtrusive. A note: This hotel has an arrangement with Holland America Lines, whereby cruisers stay a night in the hotel prior to their disembarkation. That means the place can get CROWDED, especially on cruise departure mornings. The staff handles things very well, but it's just a mass of people. Old people. Americans, mostly, which means they can get a bit rude (I'm American, and I always regret when I see that behavior, but I see it a lot). The restaurant serves a wonderful breakfast spread with the full-American buffet items as well as numerous cooked-to-order offerings. You're right in the middle of everything touristy - a short walk to tram stops, a 10-minute walk to Amsterdam Centraal Station for intercity trains, and thousands of restaurants, cafes, shops - and yes, "coffeeshops."

Reviews.Title: “Nice but avoid one side of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadridClydo
Reviews.Content: Just an update..... I have stayed at this hotel about three times since my last review and all has been fine.
