It is still the most upscale place I have stayed in Amsterdam with a good location. Rooms and amenities are really nice. I will complain about 1 small thing and good advice for other travelers..... I stayed in room 116 which was right above a major street so lots of noise in the morning from traffic and assorted trucks. Try to take an interior room or one on any other side of the building. 116 up for maybe another 20 rooms is on the only busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: gferraez
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all great location, great staff, installations, the only thing is the price it's a little expensive but if you can pay it this is the place to be in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BellaB_10
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel the location is perfect 5 minutes from the central station and right in the centre of Amsterdam!! The staff are ok not really that friendly but the concierge were nice. The rooms and location are good. We ate in the restaurant and the food was nice also teh bar is really cool and their cocktail menu has lots of choice. I will be definelty returning!! They have another bar that serves coffee etc I would have to say that that is not all that I asked for a latte and it was very tiny and expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekends in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: clamrj
Reviews.Content: Sometimes the service you receive from the staff at your hotel can make your trip so much better. Advice and guidance from concierge at the Renaissance in Amsterdam absolutely made our trip. We only had three days to see amsterdam but with the help of the concierge we had a wonderful trip. He outlined a combination of locations we could easily access on foot (the flower market, Dam Square with the royal palace, etc.) and sites to access via canal boat (museums, parks, etc.) that allowed us to see many of the sites without a lot of stress. From now on I'll make sure I put the guide books down long enough to consult the true experts, the locals. The hotel is also an easy walk from the central trainstation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Reb65
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, this hotel offered excellent service. The amenities are outstanding. When booking make sure your rate includes breakfast as the cheapest set menu was â‚¬24 per person. The room was fantastic and the bed extremely comfortable. Be warned though, no tea or coffee making facilities, however, I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & luxurious hotel complex”
Reviews.Author: yuli_stoinov
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this clean, friendly modern & luxurious hotel complex. We stayed for 4 nights in the end of May and had unusualy hot weather for the season and country (almost 30 C). The location was just great, about 500 m from the Central Station and in walking distance to the Dam. The service was discrete and very efficient and friendly and the hotel is beautifully looked after. Breakfast was a delight! Thank you for a lovely stay. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Marriott property in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: First off, I am a Marriott Rewards member, so I enjoy some additional perks when staying in a Marriott property. This includes access to the club lounge, which in this hotel is very clean, well stocked, and has a nice layout. I also get free internet, another very nice perk. The fitness facility is nice here, which is huge for me being a frequent flier. I was here on vacation, but still,,,,I eat therefore I must sweat a little on the treadmill. The location is really the value in this hotel. Its a 5 minute walk if you are a fat turtle from the train station, and right in the middle of the shopping without actually being in the middle of the hustle, bustle, and noise. You can really walk Amsterdam from edge to edge in 30 minutes, and this location is easy for access to East and West side museums and sight seeing. The hotel staff here was very helpful. My girlfriend had to ship something back to the states and they found us a box, tape, and a FedEx label. The staff is like the city: warm and pleasant. (Unless you are standing in the middle of the bike path. Just a little advice,,,,make sure you pay attention to where you are walking and that you do not stand in the bike paths. I saw several people go down, and when they have just left a "coffeeshop" and not a "cafe", its highly entertaining.) Another piece of advice for Amsterdam: Pickpockets. I think its mentioned in another review. However, I witnessed it with my own eyes here. After traveling to lots of big cities where that advice is given all the time, to actually see it happen in front of you was amazing. The guy who was robbed was wearing a long cardigan with big pockets, and his fat wallet was just hanging at the side of his body. As a chick, carry a purse with a zipper. And, leave all your fancy jewelry at home.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy banging doors”
Reviews.Author: TonyTravels262
Reviews.Content: The doors on the rooms are incredible, it has a slow close mechanism that suddenly slams the door at the last minute, I tried a few times to close the door myself, waiting for the moment it rocketed forward, but just couldn't close it quietly !!! So needless to say, people just let it close on its own, and this was an absolute nightmare. No partitions along the corridor so you have a whole floors worth of people coming in at all hours slamming doors. Apart from that...haha...Not sure about the 5 star rating, possibly on a good day ! Breakfast was very expensive too, staff were 'so so'.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: rlouisa
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short stay at the Renaissance in Amsterdam. The room was clean, crisp and well taken of. The breakfast was great and was close to many great places for walking and getting around. The only down side of the hotel was you just seemed to keep walking and walking to get to your room. Other than that I look forward to our next trip to Amsterdam, what a wonderul place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “If this a 5 star I can't imagine what a 2 star would be like”
Reviews.Author: LondonTourist3
Reviews.Content: Reception staff surly. Particularly Asian gentleman- Kit? Totally disinterested did not have a nice word to say. I was particularly annoyed that he disputed the fact that I was entitled to free internet in the room based on the booking made with BA. It was stated on the voucher which of course Kit chose not to look for. He was just being lazy and I could not be bothered for 6 euros - I know what I have booked and paid for The room was clean and smart but tiny. Bathroom was small with no decent amenities The concierge staff were a redeeming feature very nice and helpful at all times oh and the coffee machine was free and served good coffee

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel With Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1790
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel! The lobby was lovely and relaxing and the staff was very helpful. Our room was clean and spacious with a very comfortable king bed. The location could not be any better. It is literally a two minute walk to central station, where you can pick up pretty much any tram you need, high speed trains, trains that go outside of Amsterdam, and the train to Schipol airport. Although this hotel is near a lot of action, it is tucked away in a very calm and quiet spot. The only negative thing that I have to say about this hotel is that they made a mistake on the deposit. I had already completed paid for the room when I got there but they still took out a $1,200.00 deposit on my debit card. After seeing this, I knew it was wrong and had it straightened out immediately. The staff was very helpful with removing the deposit right away and they were extremely apologetic. This was a very big mistake on their part, but it did not interfere with my vacation at all because they fixed it so quickly. Despite all of that, I highliy reccommend this hotel and I will be staying there if I decide to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AWWTG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family for two nights. We were able to walk to most sites in Amsterdam from this hotel. The rooms are clean and modern, nicely appointed and quiet. My only complaint would be that there is just one computer available for use by guests of the hotel and it was often tied up for an hour or more by just one person. Free breakfast was great! We had an early arrival and they were able to get rooms for us so we could rest right away after our long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as promised.”
Reviews.Author: Torotravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with my wife and 13 year old daughter. We travel a lot (4 and 5 star typically) We were very satisfied with this hotel. It was exactly as portrayed by the hotel website. Room was spacious, modern, clean and comfortable. Club access a very nice plus - good continental breakfast, snacks, drinks etc..., free wifi... Very enjoyable. Staff helpful, and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Locatio, Location, Location. One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Ofir_yo7
Reviews.Content: Been to the hotel for a conference meeting. The location of the hotel is just fantastic ! 3 minute walking distance from the trains station, 2 minute from Dam SQ. The hotel is unique, to get to the room you have to go through a maze, but when you get there, you are getting to a very nice room. Spacy, not like other rooms at Amsterdam. We had the conference at a building that attached by a tunnel to the hotel, and it is a part of the hotel. This building used to be a church, and now it is the conference center for the hotel. The building is just amazing, highly recomended to host a conference if you like this WOW factor!! Will come back for vacation !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, absolutely enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: suma_shah
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just few minutes from central station, few minutes from tram stop and excellent location...very decent area. The staff are very polite. The rooms are large enough and well furnished.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: PennTraveler12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Amsterdam Renaissance for only one evening in late June prior to boarding a river cruise. We used 30,000 Marriott points , so this was a leap of faith based on other reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel is very modern and immaculately clean. We had a large lovely room (having just come from Paris, the room was twice the size as our former one).....the view from our room though was not much to look at. All of the staff were pleasant and one of the staff informed me that Van Gogh Museum tickets could be purchased from them (at the same rate)....this enabled us to walk directly enter upon arrival and not stand in the cue. They also provided good recommendations on Catholic Mass times and the Anne Frank Museum. We did not eat at the hotel but the menu prices seemed very expensive. The hotel was very crowded but it did not detract from our stay. I would recommend the Amsterdam Renaissance, but be forewarned it is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it and would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: eva0128
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Amsterdam and it really helped that we stayed at a nice hotel. The hotel is somewhat off the main strip of shopping, eating, bars, etc. but it was nice and quiet. But also, it wasn't far away from the attractions and sight-seeing as well. I never thought it was noisy here at all. I do remember it taking awhile to get checked-in and checked-out, but there were tons of people that arrived at the same time, so I'm thinking that's the reason why. The workers were always very helpful, especially the concierge. The breakfast and happy hours were pretty good too and again, the servers were very accommodating. I also remember using free Internet while I was there. Rooms were always meticulous, the bed was extremely comfortable and again, it was pretty quiet throughout our stay. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience in my life in a so-called luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: EM-75004
Reviews.Content: Incredibly poor level of service: trays with rests of breakfast still in the corridors at 7:00pm, total unability to deal with large arriving groups making your check in/out a nightmare, restaurant's food **very bad**, internet at 20â‚¬ per day (yes, twenty euros per day...), very small rooms and loooong corridors to reach them, low quality soaps in the bathroom, disturbed twice during my stay by maids willing to make up the room even though I had put a do-not-disturb sign at my door. What else ? they lend you umbrellas when it rains, but most of them are broken. One more ? ok: we had a seminar room so close to the elevators we could hear distinctly all the discussions of the clients => we had no privacy either during our meeting, of course. Terrible experience in every sense!

Reviews.Title: “Good "corporate" hotel”
Reviews.Author: wwelburn
Reviews.Content: Sometimes "corporate" hotels just work well when you're traveling. The Renaissance Amsterdam was just what we needed. We arrived a day late thanks to mechanical problems with our flight and, because it's a Marriott property we were able to adjust our reservation with ease. True, this is a haven for tourists preparing for river cruises, and its conference center will appeal mightily to individuals arranging meetings in Amsterdam. This hotel has an excellent location, only a few blocks from Amsterdam Centraal railroad station and within walking distance of sites of interest. The hotel is clean and well kept, and staff provide a high level of service, especially for somewhat weary travelers. We also had a package that included a free buffet breakfast, museum tickets (which allowed us to beat the long lines at the Van Gogh), and 15% off on dinners in Scossa, the hotel's restaurant. You can do worse, a lot worse in Amsterdam. This is assured to be a decent place to hang your hat, surpassed by luxury hotels and boutiques strongly recommended by friends (and perhaps not travel guidebooks).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mehorst
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in central Amsterdam, 5 minutes from Centraal Station, in an area with lots of pedestrian streets, bars, coffee shops, and restaurants and lots of tourist and local foot and bike traffic, and a block from a canal. The hotel consists of several old buildings put together so the rooms vary and the hallways are a bit of a maze. The room we had was large and well appointed, and very clean, and I suspect the hotel was modernized not too long ago. Service was excellent and breakfast was very good. We were there for 2 days before leaving on a cruise as were a lot of other people and check out was very crowded and somewhat chaotic. The doorman was very helpful getting people into cabs and combining groups into cabs and keeping all of the luggage straight, but the cabbies were overcharging. (Not the hotel's fault.) I would come back. Being right in the center of Amsterdam is exciting.

Reviews.Title: “I amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kerata_10
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay in, I liked the breakfast - so generous, I loved the location - just 5 min walking to any popular places. My first time in Amsterdam was splendid and the hotel played guiding role.

Reviews.Title: “Fleeced in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ArdmoreTraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but out to get you. To use the phone, even an 800 number, you pay handsomely, so beware. I had pre-booked and pre-paid this stay, but was billed twice on my credit card. In trying to get the hotel to credit me, I had to call 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BSinPNS
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights pre-cruise. Room was available early in the morning after an overnight flight from Atlanta which was much appreciated. Concierge and bell staff were excellent, particularly Ben (handlebar mustache) and his team. Recommendations were spot on for places to go, tours to take and places to eat. The hotel was clean throughout, bedroom and bath spotless. Front desk staff was professional and quick to resolve a minor billing issue. Requested and was granted a late check-out (one hour) since we were going to the Anne Frank House and we wanted a place to store our luggage and make a pit stop before taking a taxi to the Amsterdam Cruise Terminal which is about a 5-7 minute ride. The hotel is near the Centaal Station, but is on a side street. This is a real positive after watching others having to fight through the sidewalk crowd to get to their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: OldGrayGrammy
Reviews.Content: Within an easy, 10-minute saunter to Amsterdam's Centraal Station and a 2-minute walk to the Singel canal, the Renaissance was a very nice place to stay during our first visit to Amsterdam. The hotel seems to cater to groups of visitors: (1) pre- and post-cruise ship passengers, (2) tour groups, and (3) convention attendees, which means that the Desk and Lobby areas can get somewhat mobbed at times, but the property seemed to handle the needs of such varied, multilingual groups well. Everything, including rooms, seemed clean and well-maintained. Having both a nice restaurant and a corner bistro (both serving a good variety of tasty foods) connected with the hotel was a real plus. Our only complaint was that our windowless bathroom had no ventilation or fan. Even so, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Elizwannatravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Renaissance Amsterdam and have nothing but good words. The location is fabulous, accommodations very comfortable and spotless, sheets crisp and beds comfortable, really helpful, friendly staff who always went the extra distance for us. We would stay again. Only critique is that the breakfast buffet was VERY expensive (E17-25) so we asked to order from the menu. Worked out better. Catch the #5 (to go to the museums) just around the corner. Walking distance to many sites. Lots of close restaurants to choose from. Three blocks from Centraal Station and close to other tram stops.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kenfaisey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Renaissance Hotel with three other couples. The rooms were large and the beds were enormous and we enjoyed the hotel and the visit very much. The Renaissance is located near a canel in the centre of the city and is within walking distance of all major attractions. Despite the bustle of the city centre the hotel's position is in a quiet side street and we had no problems with noise. The hotel was very busy with conference trade but we had no delays at reception or in getting a drink from the bar. We ate in the hotel one night and found the food and the service to be excellent. The restaurant felt more like a small local restaurant than one in a hotel and has direct access on to the street should you want it. Overall a very comfortable stay and we would have no hesitation in staying there again if we come back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: rdabca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very walkable from the train station and well situated for sightseeing and taking canal tours. Although we had booked a club room none were available at the time we checked in and the standard room we were given was fine. The club lounge was great. Spacious and comfortable with a nice variety of breakfast items and evening snacks. Beware if you have mobility issues -- there are unavoidable stairs leading off the lobby area. There is a ramp for luggage.

Reviews.Title: “15 minute walk from Train Station”
Reviews.Author: tjpines
Reviews.Content: The hotel is approximately 15 minute walk from the train station. It was clean, american style shower. The staff is very nice and helpful. You can catch a tram not too far from the hotel to assist in getting across town. Althought it isn't too far from Dam Square and the Red light district.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamon68
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a beautiful historic location in Amsterdam Centre, The rooms are pretty standard but nice and spotless. The bed was extremely comfortable, loved the mattress. The hotel reception however was not flawless. They charged my personal credit card while I clearly stated at check-in and at check-out that the bill would be covered by the company I work for (and who had made my reservation).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Honeybee2121
Reviews.Content: This is a big, modern hotel in an old historic dam building within an easy walk from Central Station. It definitely caters to business people (it's owned by Marriott) and has the minibars and business centers to serve that market. The staff was absolutely lovely and helpful, and I enjoyed being able to get museum tickets at the concierge's desk. The main restaurant and bar are very hotel-like, but there's an adjacent cafe in the hotel that actually feels authentically Dutch. Although it's definitely a chain hotel, there are touches of charm. The room was comfortable, clean and very modern. The neighborhood, while touristy, is very convenient and walkable to many great attractions. I did ask the best way to get to the airport, and the concierge suggested a $50 Euro cab as opposed to a very nearby and cheaper train, but that seems to be a Marriott thing. Also, things that are free at less slick hotels (like WiFi) often cost money, but you just need to be aware of that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GeoffL
Reviews.Content: We all very much enjoyed this hotel. It is a couple of blocks from Centraal Station, the concierge is very helpful, the hotel is clean and modern. It is a bit pricey but the amentities more than make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JimmyUhe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in Amsterdam downtown! The hotel is so nice and we really liked to stay there. The staff was nice and friendly, the hotel is charming. We stayed a couple of days and we recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So close to train station with attention to customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Skarlett123
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many, many hotels and have never experienced such a warm welcome from reception to the concierge who had a refreshing sense of humor. Room large with two big, comfortable beds within. Bathroom great. Access to the train station is excellent which we needed for an early departure. Arrived for check in early and absolutely no hassles to get access to the room immediately. Room phone did not work and someone was there within 5 minutes. Housekeeping kept the warm greetings flowing through our stay. The only glitch was in relation to the hotels capacity to manage diet requests. I had made my diet requests known the day prior for breakfast and was advised these would be met. Upon arrival I had to ask for the gluten/lactose free foods. I was given two slices of gluten free bread readily defrosted in the ,microwave and a small glass of milk. Compared to all the other customers I felt like I was on rations. This was the only unsatisfactory element of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: StevePaterson
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for a weekend break in Amsterdam. We didn't eat in the hotel (only because we were out and about most of the time) so can't comment about the food. However, the reception service was very good. Our room (144) was right next to the street and a bit noisier than we would have liked so I asked Reception to move us. They were very helpful and within minutes we were placed in a much quieter room (339) and had two undisturbed nights sleep. If you are staying here and want a quiet room, I recommend you try to get a room facing away from the street. Although the hotel is in a fairly quiet area, go for a quiet room and a good night's sleep to make the best of your days there. Top attractions for us were: Van Gogh museum, Anne Frank house and the Keukenhof gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, Reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: audies
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in a twin room, breakfast not included. The room was quite comfortable, spacious single beds. Everything was clean and functional. The view was pretty rubbish, but the location was excellent. The concierge was very helpful with maps, dining recommendations etc. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a little expensive for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: SACas50
Reviews.Content: We generally had nothing that we could complain about except that the bed felt small the first night but they did confirm that it was a queen size. I suggest that you do not order room service - the charge was an exorbitant 35 euros, more than the food that we ordered. Parking our rental car at the hotel was 50 euro per day, which is the going rate for Amsterdam hotels and parking garages. But these high costs does influence ones perception of the place. A highlight was the room service staff who was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay in this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: 4inarow
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3nights stay at this hotel , we arrived at hotel checked in delighted to have finally arrived got to our room to discover their was one trible bed which only looked like a double in eash room. We were a party of six ladies and had booked and payed for two trible rooms . Straight away we said the hotel are after making a mistake, my friend contacted reception and was told there are no trible rooms available and that we would have to sleep three ladies per bed . How could three ladies be expected to share one bed so this was not exceptable ,then the staff arrived with a single bed for each room , the room was so crampted .The next morning we were moved and offered complimentary dinner , when we went to the restaurant the next evening we were informed by the restaurant manager that we all had to have the same lamb dish valued 14euro and that was our complimentary dinner. It was terrible there were other guests dining and could hear everything this was so embarrassing , so we got up and left . On the day we were leaving one of the ladies in our group who put so much effort into organising this 5* hotel spoke to a different manager. He said he was very sorry over what had happened he could not believe himself when he read the report that morning. He offered a full refund for our first nights stay. Finally just to say we all enjoyed amsterdam but as far as the hotel we were all very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerisj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked two rooms, one for us one for daughter and her husband and 3 year old granddaughter. They had the roll a way bed set up for the 3 year old when we checked in, and the great thing was we got there about noon and they let us check in early for both rooms! The woman at the desk gave us a nice map and marked our hotel location. The rooms have been redone and look brand new. Very comfortable bed. Very clean. Neither of us had more of a view than a wall, but that was OK for the time we spent in the room. No coffee pot in the room but my husband just ran downstairs and got coffee. Sat outside for a afternoon drink at the restaurant. The service was very slow but we wished later we had eaten at the restaurant. It looked better than we ended up that night. Our fault, should have used the concierge. Concierge very helpful but busy. Good location. We parked in a metro park and ride and took metro to central station. Very short walk to hotel. Close to Dam square, boat tours, street cars.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic Hotel in a Beautiful Central Location”
Reviews.Author: memoreks
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Renaissance Amsterdam three times now, the last time with my family whilst on a long weekend in Amsterdam. The hotel has a lovely location, 5 minutes walk from Amsterdam Centraal station, surrounded by classic Amsterdam architecture. The staff were pleasant and accommodating to us and our young son. The rooms were spacious, and still had sufficient room, even with the guest bed for the little one. The only gripe I would have is the 25 EUR per person for breakfast, which is vastly expensive, but we ate each morning at the little sandwich cafe across the street instead.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edoronina
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, location is good - quite, a bit out of centre. However, we paid 308 EURO and did't even get a free wifi. breakfast was not included and car park cost 50 EURO. Public car park costs 50 EURO as well! In the other hotel (where we staid the next night) the hotel offered a discount of 25% for a public car park. Room was rather small, bathroom as well. The only thing that we did really enjoy was the breakfast! Just to have the breakfast worth staying in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: francevisitorLeeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights over the Easter weekend in a double and a twin room. The hotel is very well located and easy to access from Centraal Station. The rooms were nicely fitted out, the twin being slightly larger than the double and were lovely and clean. We were staying on a bed and breakfast rate, which entitled us to the full breakfast tin the restaurant. The selection available was the largest we have ever encountered, the cooked items were all well prepared with the option of requesting some items such as fried eggs and pancakes to be freshly cooked for you. There was a desk off the lobby that was staffed to assist with any queries, as well as a concierge desk and the staff were very knowledgable on the area and very happy to help. We also ate in the restaurant one evening and had the special offer main of lamb and found it to very good quality and reasonably priced with the discount given to hotel guests We appreciated the nice touch of wine in the room as it was my birthday. The only improvements we could suggest would be to have two armchairs in the double room and to provide tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Also having requested two adjoining rooms at the time of booking some months ago we would have expected a hotel of this size to ensure they were available rather than the check in staff having to look through rooms on his computer screen to find two that were close together but not next to each other. Overall we had a wonderful weekend in Amsterdam and would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ambernectar85
Reviews.Content: Hotel location - 4 minute walk to the main station. Which costs 4 euros on high speed double decker train to get to the airport. Great stuff. Very close to main shopping streets. Close to tram stops. Close to red light district. Hotel - trendy lobby, spacious. Helpful staff. Concierge very helpful. Rooms - spacious! (compared to others in amsterdam). Clean. No coffee? no tea? no kettle!!! Quite dissapointing considering the rate we were paying. Mini-bar - do not use. Very overpriced. We bought from supermarket and put in fridge. Bathroom - very clean. Toiletries provided. Resaurants - breakfast = 26 euros!!! We ate breakfast outside the hotel, lovely croissants and coffee. There are lots of cafes nearby or down by the canal. We ate out on two nights - there is a lovely traditional resaurant on spuistraat. The concierge will recommend. Thinks its called Haesje Claes. Lovely food - Reasonable prices. If you turn left out the hotel and then left again. There is a cafe on corner which does english breakfasts for about 6 euros. Very friendly. Sightseeing - I'm a student doctor so not probably to everyones tastes. But the Vrolik museum is fantastic. Has lots of preserved specimens and strange anatomical abnormalities! It is accessible by metro, and is situated in the academic medical building (which is nice to look around in itself!). Alot fancier than my medical school! Reijksmuseum - quite busy. But very enjoyable. Begijnhoff - very pretty. Where some of the nun's still live. Red light district - self explanatory! Lots of pick pockets. We just went out with our hotel cards and cash in our jackets. Much safer i felt than having a bag etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable hotel, with a premium for price and space.”
Reviews.Author: stevekub
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to say that much like the other guest reviews, the location really cannot be beat. If you arrive here by train to Centraal Station, it is a quick 5 minute walk down Stationsplein to Spuistraat to the hotel. The only caveat here is that the sidewalks can be busy, and they aren't necessarily flat terrain. The service, by far, was the friendliest we've encountered on our journey through Europe; the reception and concierge staff were helpful upon check-in, check-out, and with all questions that we had about our trip. One note about reception to the elevators - you will have to make use of the ramps by the stairs from reception to get to the elevators if you have luggage and wish to carry this yourself. We were in room 562, which is their normal "Deluxe" room, with a view of the church across the street. The room was small (237 square feet), but functional for our short 2 day stay. If this were a longer stay, I would have attempted to book a larger room, as things did feel a little cramped after a while. The bedding and bath were both functional and comfortable, and the water pressure and temperature in the bath/shower were excellent. The only minor annoyance is that the corridor between our room and the elevator had a smell of fried/prepared food - sometimes smelling like fish. Reception believed it to be ventilation from one of the local restaurants in the area; however, this did not permeate into the room at all. The location is fantastic as a jumping off point for the rest of Amsterdam, with a lot of attractions and museums within a short walking distance, or a quick tram ride away. There are many restaurants and shops nearby, and this felt like an extremely safe area of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kellyoffshore
Reviews.Content: Great location, Just 5 min walk from Central station and 5 min walk to Dam Square. My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights in April from 17th-21th. The lobby and personnel are both great, with check-in fast and efficient and good service. The rooms are very nice and ok size but we didnâ€™t like the carpet on the floor. No rooms should have that. Not dirty but hotel rooms should have parquet floor, much easier to keep it clean. The bed, mattress, duvet and pillows were just fantastic. Breakfast great, but too expensive, 24 Euros per persons. Some negative issue; internet to expensive, should be free. 1 hrs 6.95 Euros and 24.95 Euros for 24 hrs. Could not log out and in and pay for the time you were using. We had room 529, donâ€™t chose this room, there was horrifying noise/ swish from â€œpossibleâ€� air condition pipe line. They tried to fix it but there was still noise when we left. We had to buy earplugs to get any sleep. Overall a high quality hotel I would stay at again, but not in that room. TorbjÃ¸rn VÃ¸lstad Norway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Part of Town”
Reviews.Author: mottyandfluff
Reviews.Content: Nicely situated in the heart of canal land: some picturesque walks and the city centre very close by. lots of nearby bars and resatuarnts. Spacious common areas, but the bed rooms are a bot poky. Excellent breakfast buffet and comfortable business centre

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: KristinManz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Renaissance property. Quick walk to Central Station (but not in a sketchy area), and very close to the nice canals. Excellent concierge with helpful tips. Also great Concierge Lounge for Elite members - extensive snacks/breakfast, free wine/beer, and open on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, lovely hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JoMcI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location, within minutes of all the main sights but in a quiet area. On arrival, the staff were very friendly and we were asked if we had a room preference, so we asked for a nice view and were allocated a room overlooking the Church across the street on a high floor. The rooms are fairly small but very well decorated and laid out. The space was fine for a weekend break, although I imagine it may get crowded if there for longer. Housekeeping were in both days. The bed is very comfortable and the rooms quiet. We found the Concierge very helpful and obliging, and mostly friendly. All in all, I would definitely stay here again if visiting Amsterdam and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Markryker
Reviews.Content: Thankfully first impressions are not everything! :) We were at first given a room that had not been cleaned, the horror of opening the door and seeing a dirty toilet, towels all over the floor and an unmade bed made us think, where have we come! After a swift return to reception, (who cannot be blamed, they were told it was ready after all), we were upgraded free of charge by the lovely Emma to a club room. The check in staff could not have apologised any more, they were great. Not only this, after an evening out for dinner, we returned to the room to find a bottle of champagne on ice awaiting us, another gift for my wifes birthday, totally unexpected. Thank you Emma :) As for the hotel in general, it is in a perfect position to explore everywhere that the city has to offer, and yet retains a lovely ambience in a quiet spot alongside one of the many canals. Ten mins walk door to door to Central Station, the same (ish) for Dam square, red light district and many chic restaurants and cafes all within easy walking distance. I must stress to anyone thinking that it may be a bit near to some of the, shall i say noisier reaches of the city, that this hotel, although close to everything retains a lovely sense of calm and serenity, being in a lovely little tree lined avenue. The staff, from the concierge desk to the cleaners and bar staff, all conducted their business with a smile on their face and a cheery hello. I really cannot pick fault with this wonderful hotel, after the mix up with the room in the first instance, which is now just a hazy memory after the excellent recovery made by the staff. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a central place to stay while in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Rlm61
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend 2 great days at this hotel and wished we had booked more rather than going to a B & B in Amsterdam. Location was great and a short walk, even with luggage, from the central station. Everyone from the check in personnel to concierge were great. We had no problem with the information given to us by any member of their staff. Our room was clean, beautiful and quiet. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations for Marriott Brand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelnuts88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in excellent location. It is within 5 mins walking distance to the central station & dam square. The tram stop is less than a block away from hotel entrance. Easy access to restaurants and laundromat. The hotel also provides good security coverage: security guards at the hotel entrance, using room card in the elevators to get to floors, safety deposit box in room and double locked keys in the room. We left some money for the housekeeping on 2nd day and it did not get touched. Excellent housekeeping. The room is also quite spacious for European hotels standard. BUT, * the hotel is very old in look and feel and badly needing renovation. The carpets are dingy and musty. Colors are gloomy and dark. The only bright place is the lobby by the entrance. Bright and modern. * the check-in/out staffs were not friendly and helpful. For the rate we paid, our room faced the parking garage. Our request for moving to other rooms were denied eventhough I'm a long time Marriott Rewards member * the concierge though very friendly kept on giving us wrong directions and information. After going through one day following bad information, we no longer went to see them. The map is straight forward and asking locals with smiles always get us to the right places * lack of basic amenities such as kettle for coffee & tea. We finally able to get hold off one for 6Euro, but the coffee / tea did not get refill

Reviews.Title: “Finally A European Hotel That I Can Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: wurldtech
Reviews.Content: First, I'm a gold status member with Marriott so I am a little biased but I've commented on poor experiences at many a Marriott in Europe that simply do not meet expectations. i've stayed in hundreds of hotels in Europe over the past few years and this one made me feel at home - finally. For me services takes priority over all else as most of my travel is for business and the frills don't impress me much anymore, especially when I need a snack at 2am after getting in late or my dry-cleaning done asap even if it is not within the allotted hours. Great work guys. For readers, take my word for it and don't risk blindly hitting hotels in Amsterdam - it can ruin your stay for sure...Go with what you know and ignore the negative fluff below. For management (hopefully you track these) Steve at the front desk was fantastic and deserves to be recognized. As you know, the Dutch do not have the most overly outgoing friendly dispositions in the world, just their style, but Steve was the first face to the experience and he nailed it. Also, Leo the conceriage was great as well and i must say he was brave in recommending the Supper Club to us for dinner but i didn't give him much to go on - WOW was I ever glad he did. What a great experience.... so Leo great one and make sure you keep recommending this place. Concierge lounge was great too! Thanks guys, we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: akp_va
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of my expectations and more. The beds were beyond comfy and the hotel overall is beautifully furnished. The staff were courteous and professional. I especially enjoyed one ... I believe his name was Collin and he gave us so many helpful insider tips to the city. He went beyond his call duty and was polite, funny and made us feel at home. Overall, this hotel is a great choice for luxury, comfort, and ideal sightseeing. Oh and just one little tip, if you plan to get there by walking from the train station definitely google map it before you go... i had trouble finding the hotel (ofcourse, it was probably just me and my map skills)

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Gr8 place”
Reviews.Author: foodddd
Reviews.Content: Went for the weekend break,from airport you need to take one train & you are @the hotel in 20min right in heart of city centre this lovely hotel is there from station 5min walk & I was there hotel staff very good & helpful I was welcome very well They allocated me room on top floor size of the room is just ok but than the service &all the staff very helpful, downtown very near from the hotel good local restaurant some italian place is was very good can't remember the name overall the trip was excellent with hotel I am looking foward to go back in summer again.gr8 city n excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Crasie
Reviews.Content: We were here only one night. It is a great location. We took the train from the airport which is really easy and only around 3 euros. When you get off the the train you are right in Amsterdam. The ride was only 10 or 15 mins and goes directly trhere. The hotel is a short walk from the station and it is right by everyhting, but far enough away you are not right in it. Dam Square is a five minute walk as well as everything else. The hotel is great and the breakfast is awesome. We had it included in our price. We booked early at Marriott.com and did one of there pay in full deals. Check that out before you book through any other site. We wish we stayed longer, but we were on our way to Italy so we just extended a layover. We took the train back to the airport. Really great place and when we go back for a long weekend we will be staying at the Renaissance. Room service was great for late night food as well, and of couse Renaissance hotels always have comfortable beds and rooms!

Reviews.Title: “When ONE person can make a huge negative difference”
Reviews.Author: travelkd
Reviews.Content: Before I go on with actual hotel review let's name the person that can ruin a hotel's reputation, this being Collin --, some kind of evening manager. The Renaissance Amsterdam is basically a good business type hotel conveniently located close to train station and Dam square. Upon booking thru Marriot's own site we called the hotel to double check the possibility of having 3 adults in the rooms (had booked 2 rooms) and ask for "nice views" as Amsterdam is of the few cities having so many "blind" rooms. We were allocated club rooms and we were happy...until we saw them...from the attached pictures one can see that it is absolutely impossible to fit 3 adults in a club room without actually jumping into the bed! In a 5 star hotel! The only available actual solution was an upgraded room with an extra charge of 75 euros per night, including breakfast and "happy hour" drinks in a designated area. So, some of us decided to pay the extra 225 euros, not having another choice, and the others not, as the third person was coming just for 1 night. And now comes Collin -- striking issue. One evening an extra guest from the allowed number joined the rest of the group in an empty bssiness lounge for a drink. I repeat one extra guest, one time. Having no idea whom we were, Collin -- gave us a ...warning not to repeat it, as "the business lounge is for those paying for it"! Never, ever in our lives had we been insulted so much. And please, keep in mind that we were there on a medical meeting with a registration fee of 1500 euros, staying at a 5 star hotel! I guess to that person's mind we had a great need for a free drink!!! Nowhere in the world that we have so far traveled or lived such an attitude was encountered. Assistant manager Marielle -- was very nice and apologetic for the incident but we think that the hotel and the Marriot chain should not let people such as Collin -- ruin their reputation. Afterall, we, travelers, are paying so that hotel business people have their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, knowledgable and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rob231231
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel about ten years ago, decided to go back. Wasnt disappointed. Hotel has undergone a major refurbishment and is without doubt in the best central location to visit all of the cities attractions. Check in was quick and easy thanks to samantha. We opted for a room which gave us access to the club lounge. Room was on the fifth floor but club lounge is located on the first floor. No problem though as hotel is very secure. Room was excellent, everthing worked bed was comfy. Didnt have the need for use of a pc but internet access was included for personal laptops but not on equipment supplied in the room on the rate we were on. As a brit i do like my early morning cup of tea but no coffee or tea making facilities are supplied in the room, and the walk to the club lounge in the morning was far to much too endure after a wonderful evenings excess in this brilliant city. Club Lounge continental breakfast is good but busy, (extra coffee machine needed) and we felt somewhat restricted in the evening using this facility but that maybe down to the large number of corporate guests that were resident during our stay. To find the hotel if coming by train stand at the entrance of centraal station look to the right for the dome and its opposite just off a side street. If you face the other way you will end up in a canal. Non-stop cheap trains from the airport best way to and from the hotel. Taxis readily available at hotel entrance if you wish to venture further. So in summing up if you can afford the upgrade go for it, if not still stay there but take your own kettle whatever rate you opt for ! A very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No way would I return”
Reviews.Author: jumpsturdy
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled, this used to be a Ramada and remains so by any other name. Once again, no amount of research or preparation helped me out in Amsterdam. As Marriott member, I thought I would try this for 1 Sat. nite -- we needed to be downtown for an event at Oude Kerk.. as someone stated, this is definitely better for business. I don't think this hotel would be able to exist sans business guests... rates exorbitant considering we paid less than 1/2 the price last month at Apollo Museum Hotel for nearly identical room (and both properties have lifts, which are important to me): barely adequate in size, bed certainly not large enough, decor staid and uninteresting, tub impossible to get out of --- only this pricey hotel has no coffee maker but the audacity to charge for a kettle that takes 15 minutes to boil!! The only thing that looked interesting was the quaint old restaurant across Katgatan but we did not have chance to dine there.

Reviews.Title: “Noise and bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: MadridClydo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance two days this week and one night in January. For me, the price was OK with free internet due to a corporate agreement. One big negative was I came home twice with red bites. The first time I thought maybe the red marks were hives or a food reaction, but after a second time, I think it may be bed bugs. Secondly, for such a nice hotel, it is noisy. One morning I heard the television in the room next to mine. On another morning I heard people in the halls and the cleaning people. Final negative, parking was â‚¬50 per night. An incredibly high fee! I am going to pass on staying here on my next trip to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for leisure and better for conferences”
Reviews.Author: Ejewett
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times this month and love the location. The hotel appears to be recently renovated and is nicer than the Marriott. I highly recommend it if you get a good room. Generally, the service is very good, although the breakfast service definitely varies depending on how busy they are. At the peak, everyone is running around or standing by the entrance talking together. When there are not many guests, the restaurant staff are very friendly, talkative and helpful. The room vary in size and view from adequate size with a great view of old buildings to small with dark, interior views. Also be careful of too much noise from trucks outside in the morning. The food is similar to high-end hotels. My only complaint is the Internet service from ibahn. It is often slow or having problems that require calling tech support.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: gproyd
Reviews.Content: On our stay at the Renaissance, we were using Amsterdam as a base for trips out to towns and cities in the area. We chose the hotel partly for this reason as it is within easy walking distance of Central Station. The location generally is good, roughly mid way between the station and Dam Square, with shops, nightlife and other attractions only a few minutes walk away. The public areas of the hotel are comfortable and welcoming. Our room was large and spacious - very comfortable beds too. The hotel staff were always polite and helpful. Breakfast is very good with plenty of choice and dinner in the Mediterranean restaurant was excellent. The hotel also has a good bistro. Would recommend the Renaissance to anyone planning a short break in Amsterdam. The only downside is that it is rather expensive, not a good choice if you're on a travelling on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced (without the extras)”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner4life
Reviews.Content: We spent New Years in Amsterdam and found this gem on the tripadvisor website. The price was incredibly reasonable for a five star hotel. Just a quick walk from the train station and equidistant to the center of town. The room was very spacious with an amazingly comfortable bed, but not much of a view. The concierge was very helpful in helping us find restaurants and make reservations. All staff were very accommodating and spoke perfect English. The best part? They served delicious pastries in the afternoon on New Year's Eve AND the caramel wafers for free at the desk 24/7. I would agree with the other reviews that the hotel charges astronomical fees for any extras, i.e. internet, room service, etc. Overall, a great start to 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: tex2step
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the train station and just about everything else. I had purchased a GVB (public) transit card for the duration of my stay but ended up using it only twice as most things are under a mile from the hotel. In regard to amenities, the hotel offers coffees and teas in the morning (at the bar) free of charge. They can be enjoyed with the complimentary newspapers located throughout. A concierge plus an information type office staffed by friendly personnel can help you plan your day. The rooms are larger than most standard rooms I've stayed at in Europe. Our room was equipped with a large flat screen TV with limited channels. We had a robe in need of fabric softener and slippers in our room. The room had a safe, hair dryer, and iron with ironing board. The comfy king bed had a total of 6 nice pillows. The room was warmer than I liked and a/c was a little difficult to operate. Fortunately, the windows open so the temperature wasn't too hard to control. Other reviewers are correct in stating that noise carries. Thanks to those reviewers, I took some earplugs and only noticed the noise before turning out the lights. I forgot to put them in one night and did get waken up but I think it all depends on how much of a light sleeper you are. It is by no means a "noisy" or unruly hotel. It is actually pretty quiet and I believe that makes the occasional door slams or voices in the hallway much more noticeable. Earplugs were a small price to pay for such a conveniently located and well managed hotel. The only other small nuisance was that water temperature in the shower fluctuated briefly but often while bathing. The hotel does have a pretty good sized, yet under utilized fitness center with modern equipment. Internet access is available for a hefty price. Unless you really need the web in your room, I suggest strolling into a coffeehouse and paying on average of about 1 euro/10 minutes to use one of their computers. If you're taking a laptop, free, albeit unsecured wifi can be found at many dining/drinking establishments. For those of you who are wondering but afraid to ask ......If you walk for 10 minutes you will have passed quite a few 'smoking' coffee shops, some gay establishments, several slot only casinos, a couple of windows for gawking at (or pitying) the ladies and well, just about anything else. In regard to food, there is no shortage of places to eat nearby. I didn't try the food at the hotel. There are too many choices nearby that will not put as much of a dent on your wallet. For breakfast, some egg & bacon type cafes were close enough, good enough and cheap enough (6-7 euro plates). For lunch, steer clear of the pizza by the slice place that's behind the hotel. You'll only get horrible pizza if you're lucky. Nice dining can be found around the corner on Spuistratt. The Chinese & Indonesian restaurant is terrible so opt for the Thai place next to it. Sorry if I went beyond just reviewing the hotel. Many folks, like me, choose a hotel based not only on comfort but also take convenience into account. After several trips to this fine city, I've concluded that the Renaissance is the ideal place when looking for an excellent mix of both. Many might find this hotel a little too modern, but after a 14 hour journey or in preparation for one, I opt for modern. Other than the occasional door slams or fluctuating water temps, I could find nothing else to complain about, a task for which I am well suited. This is now my hotel of choice when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay , fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: future2020
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel for 12 consecutive night . i had a club room with access to the club lounge. the rate was 264 Euro + 5% city Tax. every thing in this hotel is excellent especially the lounge where is spent all my tim in the evening due to freeze wether during my stay. breakfast in the lounge was excellent and simple . also, they serve brunch from 5:30 PM until 7:30 PM and sweet at 8:00 PM. there is a large screen TV and free wireless as well as a desktop PC in the lounge. My room was clean and very quite as i request. location of the hotel is very centralized and 5 minutes walk from train station. i also tried the GYM and was fully equipped with water and apple as well as fending vitamin water. i highly recommend this hotel for every body.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a short getaway”
Reviews.Author: A_Norski_Rus
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for two nights, very comfy, modern rooms, if a bit low ceiling. Location is great, short walk to pretty much all attractions and Central Station. Hotel staff is very friendly, great concierge at the lobby giving advice on shopping and restaurants. Lots of cosy places nearby, try Kobalt cafe, away from backpacking crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Watch The Prices Though.”
Reviews.Author: AlfonzeH
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The renaissance Hotel Amsterdam over the Christmas period 2010 and we both thought it was superb. Our room was modern, bright, spotlessly clean and the bed was luxuriously comfortable. The room had a big flat screen TV to watch with films, internet access and CDs (jazz, rock, classical etc.) to listen to on demand (However you did have to pay extra.) The breakfast and dining restaurant downstairs was fantastic. Lovely breakfasts with the works..cereal, fruit, coffee, bacon, eggs..you name it they had it!! All the staff we encountered were so polite and decent. The Dutch really are a race of affable, polite, and wonderful people in my opinion. What a joy it was to be served by such great, helpful polite staff. The hotel itself is a 5 minute walk from Damrak (the main central street of Amsterdam) and Centraal Station. It is very conveniently located and you really couldn't be situated better for a base for youir excursions. Now for the niggles of which there are 3..price, price, price. We were amazed to see that there was an offer on at the hotel, get a burger and small beer delivered to your room for only..wait for it..18 euros fifty (Â£16.50..works out about 4 quid a bite!!). Similar prices apply to the hotel breakfast restaurant..if it is not included in your room price the full breakfast would set you back a whopping 24 euros fifty (Â£21.50). There are 3 levels of hotel prices in my book..1. Reasonable. 2. Unreasonable 3. Totally taking the p#ss.Unfortunately these prices fall into the latter category. Why alienate potential customers with unfair prices? We know the difference between being slightly over charged and being fleeced. Fortunately there are plenty of nice cafes and restaurants a stones throw away where they will happily dish you up a big breakfast, luch or dinner at a quarter of the cost (6-9 euros) Conclusion: Fantastic, wonderful hotel but watch the prices of the extras. Make sure you get a good deal from your travel agent with BREAKFAST INCLUDED. All in all 5 stars. One of the best hotels I have stayed in, even with the criticisms of the prices. The staff, facilities and comfort of this hotel were second to none. ***** 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot to Launch a River Cruise”
Reviews.Author: RTK1316
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights in October, prior to a (Gate 1) Rhine River Cruise. We chose this hotel because I had Marriott points to use, but I can't imagine a better choice nonetheless. We took the train in from Schipol and the hotel was an easy five-minute walk from Centraal Station. (It was also no more than a ten-minute walk to our cruise ship, making it really convenient on both ends.) Lobby service was excellent, and the concierge got us tickets for a canal cruise, as well as the Van Gogh Museum. The Club Level was a real plus, with high-speed internet and all-day access to snacks, newspapers, etc. Our room was clean, well-appointed, and functional, offering everything we needed for a place that we pretty much only wanted to sleep and refresh in. (Really; we didn't come to Amsterdam to stay in our room!) More than anything, we loved the location of the hotel. Even though we could pretty much walk everywhere from there, we took the trams a few times, since they all seem to congeal at Centraal Station anyway. We found a great variety of restaurants and pubs within a block or so of the hotel as well. If we get back to Amsterdam, we'll definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Overrated, Noisy, Clean, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BeerinDaJacuzzi
Reviews.Content: Let's see...upon first impression of the lobby this looks like a "trendy hotel" slightly upscale which seemed GOOD and the free Stroopwafels in the lobby also were GOOD but alas for the money I spent on a room there was NO FREE INTERNET in fact it was 30E for 24 hours! That is a huge sum for U.S. citizens...anyway the room was beautiful but NO COFFEE/TEA FACILITIES, something I am quite used to in lesser bargain hotels. I wanted to watch a movie the 1st nite being so tired, but guess what NO TV CONNECTIONS for my WDTV box I was forced to watch lousy Dutch TV, CNN International, BBC, and if I wanted a movie it would be 12E! Oh and a special Heineken and Burger combo = 18E did I say this Hotel was overpriced?! It was cold in AMS maybe 3C which is freezing for a resident of Florida, and when I tried to turn on the heat the HEATER BLEW OUT COLD AIR. Excuse me? So difficult to sleep...so loud outside with doors slamming and an all-nite club right outside the window of my 3rd Floor room. Wonderful! So I was told turn down the heater from high to low. Yea, that did NOT help. Finally the front desk gave me a "club room." Club rooms come with internet, cocktails, cocktail lounge, appetizer/food, coffee/tea, breakfast...ah but I get NONE of it just the damn room. Thanks a lot...the Club Room was huge with a large foyer that seemed to serve no purpose. By the way breakfast was 25E. Overpriced much? The rooms were very attractive looking. The Club Room had a brick wall, and was an inside room so not that much noise from outside came in. All rooms have conditioner, shampoo, modern hair dryer, bath gel, bath salts, bath cap, modern bathroom, spray shower head, extra toilet paper, minibar (which you pay for, so not really a big deal), ice facilities, extreme security, elevators that were not really slow, and helpful "At Your Service" employees who allowed me to briefly check my email/print boarding passes/toothpaste and toothbrush which I forgot also given to me at no charge... Can't recommend this hotel at the moment. Prices need to go down 30E-55E per nite or at least include free internet...otherwise better values include the Crown Plaza and the Inntel down the street...this was a nice location though so you can walk across the street for a park bench on the canal, restaurants, coffee shops, ladies in the red light district...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel but noisy room doors disturbed sleep”
Reviews.Author: globegal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and I chose it again for its location, cleanliness and attentive staff. Unfortunately, however, I was awoken almost every night by slamming hotel room doors. The doors are very heavy and the hotel needs to put in place some sort of door stopper or quieting device so that all hotel guests aren't disturbed everytime another guests comes back to their room very late or departs very early.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing internet service, otherwise a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: carouge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before, but I can't recall having such a problem with the internet. As I was traveling on business, this was a big problem. I needed to reboot my laptop just to get 5-10 minutes of service. I asked to change rooms and went to check the service there, but it was the same. It's hard to believe such a nice hotel has this problem. Otherwise, the location is great- nearby the Central Station, Anne Frank House, etc. The club room is very nice, fitness center also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CHW102
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance last weekend, and it was a pleasure. The rooms were clean and modern, the breakfast buffet was loaded with selections, and most of all, the customer service was great. On the last day I left my purse, containing my passport, on the bed and took off for the airport. When I got to the ticket counter and found it was missing, I panicked. After a call to the hotel, they promptly found the bag, gave it to a trusted taxi driver, and he met me at the terminal within 30 minutes. Phew!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: triwinner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights using Marriott points and had a wonderful time. It is a very easy walk from the Central Amsterdam train station. Many restaurants, bars, and tourist locations are also a short walk away. The concierge also sold us tram passes (OV-Chipcard), museum tickets, and canal cruises. The Amsterdam tram system is very fast and easy, making taxis unnecessary. They gave us access to the Executive Room, which gave us free Internet, free breakfast, and free happy hour every afternoon. We spent one night in a room with a bad mattress and complained the next morning. We were given a new room. Special thanks to Michael at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: deleters1
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 9 and booked club rooms which gave us access to the club lounge where you have breakfast, soft drinks and canapes included in your room rate which was great and the lounge was lovely. The hotel is 5 minutes from central station so no hassle getting taxis. We arrived before check in time but our rooms were ready and we could go straight up to them which was great after an early flight. The staff are first class and everyone was friendly and helpful. Will be returning the hotel made our weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: KnowSnow
Reviews.Content: I had my first visit to this hotel in 1982 in a congress (Sonesta,that time) . Now we booked on Ebookers the flight+hotel a week earlier,so it was,to be honest,cheap. Anyway,we got the room we had wished,eg. all extras and we had a small balcony too on the 6th floor facing to a quiet yard.Tripadvisor tips were grate help.The room was cleaned for us much earlier than we expected so we could leave our luggage in our room and have a small rest. We had breakfast in the nearby-cafes along the Singel-canal. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The weather in Amsterdam was just super so we enjoyed strolling along the canals,had a nice boat-trip etc. People and the whole city is so easy-going it is nearly a miracle. -Unfortunately I left some of my belongings in a small purse in our room,I called the hotel after returning home.They were very friendly and in a few days I got a small parcel from the Ranaissance hotel free of charge; there were everything - even a ticket to Rijksmuseum!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TommyCork
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 night in October 2010 and we both loved this hotel. We stayed in a standard double room which was small but very comfortable and very clean. Room has cable TV but it's not great for English speakers, only options were BBC News and a few other options where were similar in prpgramme content. Pay-per-movies were a total rip off, as far as I remember they were â‚¬15 plus, even if they were cheaper we wouldn't have used them as we were rarely in the room apart from sleeping. In terms of location it is just 5 minutes walk from Central Station, the hotel website says that it's 10 minutes, so be careful and don't walk right past it like we did :) On leaving Central Station be aware for people offering you directions to your hotel, on giving us directions they requested money from us in return, simply tell them a firm 'no' and walk away and you'll be fine. We got a lot of warnings from friends about pickpockets and the likes in Amsterdam, thankfully we had no problems and found the whole city to be very safe and welcoming. It's a perfect location for exploring the city, most of the attractions are within walking distance and tram stops are just around the corner. It's also perfect for getting an organised canal cruise from right outside Central Station. Some of the best bars in Amsterdam are within easy walking distance of the hotel, these were located between the hotel and the Red Light District, lots of cosy pubs with wide ranges of beer and friendly people. The hotel bar is very modern, prices are typical 4* prices but they are worth it for the good service and atmosphere. Our only flaw with the hotel was the price of breakfast, far too over-priced in our opinion. We ate there one morning but for the other morning we went to a local cafe and ate lovely food for a fraction of the price. Front desk and concierge are exceptional in this hotel, staff are only too happy to help, especially the guy with the huge moustache! Overall, we loved our stay in this hotel and would definitely use it again if we were to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DC1619
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute when we decided to go to Amsterdam a few days earlier than planned. So happy this hotel was available. Yes, its a chain so you don't get the charm you might from a smaller place but this was unbeatable. Beautiful hotel, amazing customer service, incredible location. Right in the center of everything yet completely quiet when you wanted to sleep. Big rooms for Europe, extremely comfortable bed, great shower, etc. Can't say enough nice things about the place. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time in Amsterdam and we certainly chose the right hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Margaretandken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in August for my birthday. We were welcomed by friendly staff and our room was clean and comfortable. We were fortunate to meet with the hotel manager and Mr. David Ali, the director of food and beverage and they recommended some great restaurants. After my birthday night out, we'd been left not only a bottle of wine and cheese, but also a bottle of champagne and strawberries and a lovely birthday message! Such a wonderful surprise! Will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sheridan2867
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 2-week trip through Europe--Holland...Italy..France. Amsterdam was the first stop on my journey and helped to start my vacay off on the right foot. This hotel is about a five minute walk from Central station (I took a train from the airport to save $ because I heard the taxi ride was about 70 euros) which is super convenient if you're a heavy packer like me. Very few steps and traffic lights to get through before you hit the hotel. Just look for the dome-shaped building which is directly across from the hotel. My room was situated on the 2nd floor, facing Kattengat street so it was a bit noisy at night. However, once I closed the windows, the room was pretty sound-proof. Sure, the rooms are a bit small but that's Amsterdam. You can't expect a ton of space while traveling big cities in Europe--it's just not possible unless you're staying in Presidential suites. I found the bed very comfortable and the entire hotel was spotless. There are a ton of stores and restaurants around the hotel and lot's of places nearby to go for a relaxing boat ride along the canal. It's also about a 10 minute walk from the Anne Frank House which was a plus for me since that's one of the first places I really wanted to see. If you're a Marriot platinum member you are going to LOVE the concierge lounge in this place! The food & drinks didn't stop and it's open on the weekend's which is so convenient. I'm definitely going back to Amsterdam and I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY DO NOT RECOMMEND IT ! Old and expensive !”
Reviews.Author: v_seaborn
Reviews.Content: I picked a "Luxury" Room and paid the 220 EUR rate + taxes per night and ended up with a room very small with nearly no window. I had the feeling to be in a basement ! This hotel is old and need serious refreshing. The bar sucked and there was no service ! We had to stand by the bar and wait for 1Ã  minutes until the waiter would turn away from TV. REALLY DO NOT RECOMMEND IT !

Reviews.Title: “perfect central location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen7
Reviews.Content: we had a great weekend here. the hotel is only 5 mins walk from Centraal station (which has a 15 min train from Schipol airport at only 5 euros each way) so ultra convenient. we got checked in before noon after an early flight from the UK which was a great bonus and used the comfortable executive lounge a lot. the hotel is off Singel, one of the main canals, and in a great area for exploring on foot - something which is essential here unless you want to risk life and limb on one of the million bikes! would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tremendous staff”
Reviews.Author: Pacdan
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent locaton for anyone just arriving. It is near the train station, Amsterdam Centraal, but relatively quiet. Perfect for the traveller arriving after a long trip. The staff, particularly, the concierge and the staff in the customer delight office made our stay, giving good advice and detailed directions. The room was a quiet, clean room typical of Marriott. We were there as tourists, and though the hotel is clearly oriented toward the business traveller, we felt comfortable and welcome. The area has wine shops, cheese shops, and the bakeries and a lot of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “too many expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: tententen
Reviews.Content: we usually don't mind splurging on a nice hotel but we were disappointed that internet was not only not included, but a whopping 6 euros for an hour. If you wanted it for the whole day, it approached 18 euros! That seemed ridiculous considering broadband was included at the radisson blu, which we stayed at last year and was in the same price point for rooms. The clerk that helped us at check in was not very friendly, and loudly proclaimed after helping us that he was going on break. We had him more than once and he was definitely in need of hospitality lessons. The rest of the staff were wonderful. Room service was very pricey but good, the free club breakfast downstairs included (bad) coffee from a machine of all things. I felt like I was in an airport lounge. The decor of the hotel is fabulous, but as others have mentioned the hallway ceilings are very low so if you are approaching six feet, you should duck near the sprinklers! Comfortable beds, good in-house movie selection but the most irritating hairdrier in existence - you needed to hold down a button to keep it on! Very irritating for people listening to the constant stop and start, and cramp inducing for the person using it! Would I stay here again? Not if the radisson blu or amrath had rooms, those are two hotels I have stayed at and enjoyed where the staff were friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location. Love the Gummi Bears!”
Reviews.Author: dmc63
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel is an ideal base for exploring Amsterdam. And its close proximity to Centraal Station made it very convenient for airport access as well as daytrips to Delft, Den Haag, Haarlem, Arnhem, Edam, Marken, etc. After reading about the noisy rooms here on TripAdvisor, we requested a room on a higher floor. We were given a spacious and modern room on the top floor, but the window was very narrow so the room was quite dark. And it was still pretty noisy. The included brunch buffet was very good, with a great selection of fresh fruit, breads and pastries, cereals, yogurts, meats, vegetables, eggs, etc., which kept us going till dinnertime. And the candy dishes filled with Gummi Bears were a nice whimsical touch. It was kind of nice seeing a bunch of adults running around clutching their little bags of Gummi Bears. The service was friendly and attentive, with Bronwyn in Guest Services and one of the servers at breakfast (wish I could remember his name!) going above and beyond to make our stay special. The only blip was the woman who handled our check-out. I wanted to leave a note for Bronwyn thanking her for a small gift she'd left in our room but the woman said that no one named Bronwyn worked at the hotel. I asked her to check while I tipped the bellman for retrieving our stored luggage and when I returned to the front desk, still no such thing as a Bronwyn working at the hotel. I then spoke with her associate, who readily acknowledged that Bronwyn did indeed exist, whispered that the other woman was new, and promised to pass my note along. The only real negative has already been mentioned many times---the exorbitant internet charges. You'd think they could at least offer free w-fi in the lobby. Anyone looking for free internet should check out the Central Library, which is only a 15-minute walk away and has hundreds of PCs and Macs with free internet access. Make sure you also visit the La Place Restaurant on the top floor for the fantastic view and delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: H1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location, central to practically everything in the city. I walked everywhere except to and from the airport! The hotel is presented nicely and the rooms are what were expected. The staff were fiendly and helpful. I didn't eat in the restaurant but it looked nice. The bar area was a bit of a dissapointment as it closed early. Another upset was the fact that the hotel advertised a spa area which they don't have! There is a gym though.
