My booking didnt include breakfast which I was pleased about as I managed to find a couple of gorgeous little cafes just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price, no pool, no steam, no sauna”
Reviews.Author: travelwitsam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Amsterdam September end.We were expecting Marriott quality but were quite disappointed as the amount they charged was quite steep considering it was a business hotel. The staff was not flexible even after we admitted we committed a mistake and only waived off a fine after we apologized and created a stink about it. We did have a good time as there were many of us and were a bit loud.That did not go down well with the atmosphere of the hotel. Beside this there was no steam, sauna or a pool. all business hotels these days have such amenities especially considering the price they charge. The rooms are small.The only plus point is that the sleep quality is good and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & nice property”
Reviews.Author: tradi_travel
Reviews.Content: An easy 10 minute walk from AMS Centraal Station on a quiet street. We arrived mid-morning after an overnight flight. CS is a quick 20 minute train ride from Schipol airport. Checked our bags with the bell captain & the front desk offered up a pass to the executive lounge as our room wasn't available yet (wasn't expecting it to be given our early arrival.) We enjoyed continental breakfast and happy hour in the exec. lounge. Not lavish, but good quality and good selection. Our room was clean, quiet, & comfortable, typical EU-sized. A good location for train access, as well as exploring central AMS.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: tolitsa
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! The only thing that was a minus was charging the internet wifi!

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel - great location in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: LoveAllThingsDisney
Reviews.Content: We've stayed @ this hotel 4 times now, first in 2007 and most recently in August of this year. In 2007 we had a renovated deluxe room and an attic/non-renovated room with the rooftop views commented on in another review here. Both rooms were very nice, clean and snuggly. On our recent stay we had newly renovated rooms both times and had a wonderful visit. Our only complaint is the VERY EXPENSIVE buffet breakfast. We really don't get it as in the evening the same restaurant has very competitive prices but the breakfast - OUCH! Great choice for a well located hotel in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNY-DA
Reviews.Content: I have booked this Hotel based on this site's reviews and I have to agree with all comments that noted the great location. It is located in a quiet street directly beside one of the main "Grachten" and is a great start to explore Amsterdam by bike or on foot. We booked one of the offers that included the Full American Breakfast and was 199EUR per night. Amsterdam is a little more expensive for Hotels in general but for us this price was good value for money. The rooms where not too small, good size for a weekend-stay, clean, nicely designed, bathroom spotless and all necessary items available - toilettries and hairdryer. The only thing I didn't like about the room was that it had only one rather small window and therefore it was a bit dark even with opened curtains (that's 0,5 star minus). The Full American Breakfast Buffet offered everything one could ask for, the logistics could be improved, we had several empty tables but the dishes had not cleaned away and so we had to wait for a table to become available (that's the other 0,5 star minus). If the Breakfast-Buffet is not included in the Room charge, it is 29,90EUR per person. The Restaurant in the hotel - this is where the Breakfast Buffet is served as well - is offering a very nice selection of food and an Anti-Pasti-Buffet, Hotel guests get 15% discount on the meals. We had dinner and the food was very tasty and with fresh ingridients - again, prices are good value for money, especially with the discount. The service of the hotel was very friendly and attentive, we had our own bicycles with us and where immidiately told to put them togeter with the hotel-owned bicycles so they would be supervised. We asked for feather-free bedding in our reservation which was overlooked in our room, we got an apology and a free bottle of white wine and snacks to compensate for this. All in all we felt very good with this hotel and would choose it again for another visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLal
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel, with very friendly front desk staff that went out of their way to be helpful. The rooms were not large, but were very well equipped with beautiful bedding, 40" flat screen TVs and every possible amenity. No bathtub, but a good, modern shower that looked recently updated. There is a terrfic bar with modern decor and small food menu as well as a great pub-style bistro, a bit hidden at the back of the hotel, through the bar that offers burgers and sandwiches inside and on an outdoor patio. For the international traveller who wants to have some casual food choices for early dining after an overseas flight, this hotel had much to offer. We tried a trattoria across the street from the hotel pub for dinner and had a lovely meal. This was a luxury hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: aliasmalu
Reviews.Content: A cab from the airport to the hotel costs 45 Euros!! We chose to take a hotel shuttle instead. You can follow the signs once you come out of baggage claim. We took the Connexxion shuttle and it was 25 euros if you purchase a round trip ticket or 15 euros one way. I believe there is also public transportation that can take you to central station. Hotel is located close to tram stop and a short walk to central station Hotel a bit outdated. Our room was in a different wing of the hotel and we had to take 2 elevators and walk down several hallways to get to it. Front desk staff are nice and when we asked to switch rooms they were willing to accomodate us Room is an average size for Europe standards. We didnt spend much time in the room except to sleep and shower. they have lots of English channels on TV Hotel concierge sells tickets to the museums at cost. I thought this was great as it saves time having to stand in lines at the museums or go to the TIs to purchase them. They also sell the 24 hour transportation card for 7 euros. It can be used on trams, metro, train and bus. Individual tickets are 2.60 euros so its worth it to get the pass. You can also charge these to your room. We used the tram to get most places I had heard that many places dont take credit card in Amsterdam but most of the places we went to did. Only a few did not. If you change money at the airport I think if you change at least $300 they waive the commission fee that they usually charge. Maps can be a little confusing but if you are up for trying to figure it out its not impossible and people at the hotel and restaurants are very nice and most will try to help you. 20 Euros for 24 hour internet!! And you have to pay for internet in the public area as well. On the public internet area by the lounge, they do let you print your boarding passes for free which I thought was nice even if you couldnt use the internet for free. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant. For a Marriott property I thought it was an OK hotel for the price. Bring an umbrella. Apparently it rains alot in Amsterdam and it rained 2 out of 3 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel with renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: SenoritaL
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good business hotel. Check-in was swift and the concierge was very helpful with information. The room is on the small scale, but it has been renovated with contemporary decor and clean, nice bathroom. We didn't have the breakfast so couldn't comment on the quality. The hotel also has a decent size gym. The free packs of gummy bears offered at the front desk were a nice touch. The hotel is centrally located with tram stops and a supermarket nearby. Also walking distance to the central station. The Italian restaurant just around the corner serves fabulous food. The only down side is its less-than-appealing corridor, and a bit lack of value-added services in terms of the price paid. Stay here if you don't mind business style hotels or if you are in Amsterdam for a short period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and expensive”
Reviews.Author: Bussqvist
Reviews.Content: Good hotel - excellent location. Close to the centre but still not too close to the action. We had a deluxe-room which was nice but quite small. This is the kind of hotel where al lot of things costs money. 24h internet - approx 24 Euro. Breakfast approx 20Euro. The restaurant seemed nice but expensive. Maybe we were out place - most of the other quests seemed to be 50+. This is a hotel we would recommend depending how much you are paying for it. The night-rate if not using a booking site is 400Euro/night (we paid 160). Good but not great. Great location. A place where you sleep and not much more. ( and we slept quite bad since the bed was waaay to soft)

Reviews.Title: “Former Ramada hotel in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Content: We intended to stay here two nights, however after an awful first night we decided to check-out early and stay elsewhere. Hotels website terribly misrepresents the conditions at this hotel. We checked in at the late evening and were offered an upgraded club room, which was more of a hinderance than help. Our room was located in an adjacent tower-requiring us to take multiple elevators and a lengthy corridor to reach the room. Walls and doors at this property are paper thin, after returning from a late night out we faced hallway noise throughout the night and didn't get any sleep. Security and front desk did not follow-up on our complaints. We discovered by reading the in-room services directory that the property was converted from a Ramada Inn. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the breakfast which was fantastic. Next time I'm in Amsterdam I'll be staying at Hotel Pulitzer.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Dixie_Hollins
Reviews.Content: This visit to the Renaissance I stayed on the "Executive/Club Level" Rooms in the 900 series. I recieved a room on the top (attic) floor . The SPACIOUS room featured an outside view through floor to ceiling windows (which opened). The angled ceilings caused me to repeatedly hit my head which allowed me to improvise a story for my co workers about a late night run in with some non existant female mugger. The INTERNET Connection was as fast as advertised and easy to use. The Lounge offered free snacks in the evening, a continental breakfast in the morning and newspapers. The lounge also provided a lot of room to socialise with many sitting areas. It could be considered an extension of your hotel room. The lobby by the way features a striking fireplace. the gas fueled fire is a conversation piece. My room Service meal was delivered quickly and the order was accurately filled. One night I came back late to the hotel, very hungry after a full day of work. The Bar Tender at the Koepelcafe persuaded the Chef in the kitchen to prepare a meal for me. Very thoughtful and appreciated. The front desk staff made checking in/out a pleasure. All my early wake up calls were delivered by a real person! The wake up calls were accurate and necessary because the bed provided me with a terrfic night's sleep. No problem with noise or any element of my 100% Wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TyroneLou
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel. Location excellent, was able to walk from train station with our bags. Check-in efficient thanks to Ramon. Room was modern with all facilities and the bed was excellent but note you do have to turn turn sideways to get round it! Could do with smaller or less furniture so that you could manoeuvre more easily. Went to breakfast on our last morning but be warned..25euro for full "American breakfast" which is everything and it is good but my god they know what to charge. Continental is 19.50 and that doesnt even include cereal, it is the in-between option of 22 euro! Did have an enjoyable stay though and would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, newly refurbished, just nice...”
Reviews.Author: Koh_Nat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel during Sail 2010, the world's biggest sail event. The hotel is newly refurbished and is situated close to the Central Amsterdam station and close to nightlife, shopping and cultural spots. I really enjoyed the breakfast that was inclusive in the price of the room, as there was lots of choice on pastries, eggs, cheese,.. As anyone can imagine, you are in the middle of the action, so at night this hotel wasn't really the quietest choice. If you have the choice, take a room on a high floor to avoid the noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Deceived”
Reviews.Author: Fenway302
Reviews.Content: Rooms are MUCH smaller than advertised. I have a walk in closet at home that is bigger than our "Deluxe" room. Thank God I didn't get a standard. Stayed a night pre and post cruise, two people with total of three suitcases. Barely fit both of us and suitcases! Hotel is a long 15 minutes walk from Central Station. Longer if you have a few suitcases. And it's not a straight shot. Hard to find if you're unfamiliar with the city. Front desk and "concierge" (a bellhop behind the desk) were not knowledgeable. All directions were "two canals over and 10 minute walk". There are plenty of choices in Amsterdam, try another one!

Reviews.Title: “A reliable option”
Reviews.Author: surfman49
Reviews.Content: Overall recommendation The Renaissance Amsterdam is a full-service hotel with modern amenities and a convenient location for transportation and activities. This historic centrally located property inherits Amsterdamâ€™s unique character, including the local charm and quirks. It is an excellent hotel for business and leisure, but may not be the best option for travelers on a budget. Getting in and out The Renaissance Amsterdam is located a few blocks from the railway station, with regular and reliable connections to Schiphol Airport. Taxis to the airport are also available for approximately 50 Euro. However, parking near the hotel is costly. My first time finding the hotel, I got lost. The lobby entrance is tucked around the corner from the main road leading from the train station, so be sure to consult a map prior to arrival. After you actually get inside, check-in with the staff is casual and efficient. However, the lobby is small and awkwardly shaped with steps and ledges, and if you have mobility issues or lots of luggage, then ask for assistance from a bell hop. Bedroom and Bathroom The Renaissance Amsterdam has stylish, uniquely designed guest rooms that are carved into a building with historic architectural detail. This atmosphere is charming, but occasionally constraining. Louder guests can sometimes be heard from adjacent rooms, and guestrooms on the top floor have angled ceilings. Request a lower floor if this is a problem. I was pleased to find a large-screen LCD TV, an iPod dock, and a digital safe in each room. Some upgraded rooms also offer sitting area or couch, which is a great for relaxing with a few drinks. Internet access is available at an extra charge. The en-suite bathrooms are sleek and modern with chrome dark wood vanities, white surfaces, and chrome fixtures. On my first visit, I was pleasantly surprised with a walk-in-shower, but disappointed when I had to call maintenance to come and unplug the drain. Also, if you are traveling with kids, be sure to request a room with a bath tub when booking or checking-in. Otherwise, you might need to use one of Amsterdamâ€™s â€œsparklingâ€� canals. Food, Drink, and Amenities The Renaissance Amsterdamâ€™s surrounding neighborhood offers museums, restaurants, and shopping that attract a mixture of crowds during the day and night. Umbrellas are offered at the lobby entrance, which is convenient during one of Amsterdamâ€™s frequent and heavy downpours. The concierge desk did recommend ticket and transportation options, but did not appear to be a dedicated expert. For a great meal, check out the Turkish restaurant across the street. The hotel also offers a variety of in-house eating and drinking options, including a full-service restaurant, a pub/bar, and a club lounge. The squid-ink pasta at the Mediterranean restaurant was tasty and attractively presented, and and each dish features a wine suggestion. The pub was dark and cozy, with an attractive selection of light meals and snacks. I tried the burger with fries, which was excellent. Opening times for both options seemed strange, so plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “We don't have support when we ask some...”
Reviews.Author: Nathy007111
Reviews.Content: We don't have support when we ask some help to concierge and we need to go to train station...there we wanting for about 2 hours...this was terrible!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BOUTIQUE HOTEL GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: SUEBIDOUX
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance hotel one night would have gladly stayed on for one week!Great quiet location at 10 min walk from central station wich is central location. Near good restaurants, tramway, canals and all. Renanissance hotel is style modern boutique hotel, nice practical furniture, desk for lab top, mini-bar, internet, ergonomic chair, 2 small comfy chairs for relaxing, best bed I ever had, great mattress like i imagine a clowd would be ;) Staff also very friendly and very good helpful concierge. would definetely go back or recommend this one! Located in quiet street nice heaven in busy party town. The only down side is the carpet everywhere not to clean so bring your thongs. Enjoy this hotel as well as the lovely sight seeing in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: FifiBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for a short break with friends because of it's situation and the description on the internet. I'm fussy when it comes to comfy beds and a decent shower. This hotel had both of those, and more. Great location, only 3-5 mins walk from the Centraal Station, in the middle of everything but amazingly peaceful at night, Comfy enormous bed, huge, air conditioned room and spotless bathroom, good shower too. My only teeny gripe would be that there were no tea/coffee facilities in the room, but they tend not to do that in Europe, and it wasn't a problem as we went out for breakfast in one of the many nearby canalside cafes, so don't let that influence your choice. It did have a minibar and fridge though. We had a late flight on the day of departure and they let us store our luggage after checking out to collect later, as it was so close to the station, so it didn't spoil our last day either. Lovely hotel, lovely situation, would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!! Faulty Aircon Units and Fraudulent Credit Card Charges”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1059
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam however this hotel failed to help us when the air conditioning unit broke down. We were not offered a room change and had to stay in a very hot and stuffy room. The following morning we were promised that an engineer would visit the room and mend the air con unit that day. We returned to find the window open and the ac unit still not working, we later discovered that this is a common fault in the hotel, thanks to a helpful security guard. We complained once again, and were finally offered a room change which we took. Unfortunately to compound issues, we have now realised that the hotel has charged us a significant amount a week and half later for no apparent reason. We are very disappointed and feel that this whole experience has been a nightmare. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: guarros
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for a few days - at the beginning of our trip. We ended up wishing we had ended our stay here just based on how great it all was! Super friendly people, excellent location - perfect. We were able to take advantage of the Club Lounge which was fantastic - but even if we had to miss that - the location was amazing. It was central to everywhere we wanted to be - but on an offshoot of a street that it wasn't loud at all. Fantastic, overall.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Scotlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (husband, daughter & myself) for the first of our three nights in Amsterdam. I chose this hotel because it was one of the few hotels in Amsterdam that would allow three adults in a room (for 198 euros per night). Upon check-in, they asked if we wanted to upgrade to a club level room, which was about 70 euros more a night. Since this meant we could get two double beds instead of a rollaway bed, plus free breakfast, we went for it. So, I don't know what the standard rooms are like, but the club level room was very nice. It was definitely on par with a Marriott hotel room in the U.S. Average size, with nice amenities, nice bathroom. Very comfortable beds. And very clean, of course. The club level continental breakfast was wonderful! Best yogurt I've ever tasted, and a machine offering your choice of about eight different cappuccinos, lattes, etc. Also offered meats, cheeses, good pastries - all the standard stuff - in a very comfortable lounge. Club level also offered an evening happy hour that included an incredible array of desserts. And the fridge in the lounge always had a variety of waters, soda, and juices available. Club lounge also had a nice, fast computer available. Hotel lobby was very pretty (modern decor). We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant. Our experience with the staff was very positive. Very polite & fairly friendly. Got one good dining recommendation from the concierge. Also, my daughter left her wallet there and they went out of their way to return it to us. I don't think you could find a better location if you want to stay in central Amsterdam. It took us less than five minutes to walk from Central Station (with rolling luggage), yet the hotel itself is on a quiet side street half a block from a canal. We liked the location better than that of the Grand Hotel Amrath, which we thought was a little too far to the eastern side of the central city. So, bottom line, expensive - but if you want very comfortable accommodations for more than two people, the Club rooms here end up being cheaper than two separate hotel rooms at a comparable quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, well priced for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ailat
Reviews.Content: A great location about a 5 minute walk from the station. Newly renovated rooms with a comfortable bed. Room was very small but it didn't matter because we only slept there. The front desk and concierge were very helpful. It was not unreasonably priced compared to other Amsterdam hotels. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....a bit pricey but then again so is everything in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: yolove2travel
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights....GREAT Location....5 -10 mins walk from the Amsterdam Central Train Station. very nice and comfortable rooms....the beds were singles....all over Europe this was the case....but the beds were great. Service was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the center of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MvG_NL
Reviews.Content: This hotel costs a little above average but you really get value for your money. It's very comfortable with a fantastic restaurant and service so if you want to spoil yourself for a weekend, it's a great place. It is just a short walk from the central staion and therefore right in the middle of Amsterdam center. I would highly recommend the room service breakfast.. it was fantastic... and the staff was lovely. Compared to the type of hotel you find in the center of A'dam which costs just a little less the services and quality were excellent. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Best priced hotel for what is on offer...”
Reviews.Author: Peekmeister
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable hotel. Decent restaurant and bars and if this is not to your liking, then there are many options all within walking distance. Rooms are clean and decent size as well with all the usual amenities. Excellent hotel for business stays or also for leisure stays. I will defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, MAGNIFICENT BREAKFAST!!!”
Reviews.Author: RamTo
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice modern, big chain hotel. The rooms are nice and modern, but on the small side when compared to Marriott rooms in the states. The breakfast is AMAZING!!! It is expensive but well worth the 25 euro if you are not fortunate enough to get the breakfast cost included with your rate. We will go back in the future if we revisit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: palvs
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed 5 days at the hotel. We had an awesome stay in Amsterdam. However, I would like to point out that the bar/lounge on the first floor of the hotel annoyed me greatly. While the bartenders mix a quality coctail/drink they do take their time!! We had to wait 30 minutes for our drinks every single time and it was not like they were busy. When I wanted to pay, I had to wait 30 minutes. This happened several times, also to the friends we were traveling with. Seriously!!! I would also like to mention that the restaurant has an awesome breakfast/lunch (we never had dinner at the hotel) however the scrambled eggs are worthless. â‚¬6-7 per hour for wireless internet!! and â‚¬20 for an enitre day, that's outrageous! All in all we had a good stay, the hotel is very nice and has an awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Nahdiaa
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff who catered to our every whim! Breakfast was delicious and our room was clean, tidy and promptly cleaned :) Location was perfect, 5 min walk to station and shops, an an abundance of available taxis. We will definately be staying again :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Amsterdam continues to be grim in parts”
Reviews.Author: Madp0lka
Reviews.Content: Travelled here on business. Hotel is a period building which has been refurbished. Rooms are small but well appointed ( I had a king size room) with all the standard modern hotel trimmings - white walls, dark hardwood head board, flat screen TV etc. Common areas are very nice, bar was good, restaurant was above average for a chain hotel, all the staff were very nice and polite. Check in and out was efficient. The problem with the building being odler is the lack of sound proofing from the outside. My room (118) was just above street level and the traffic noise was quite intrusive late in to the night and from early morning. Also, when I got to my room at 7pm after checking in there was a lot of shouting from a bar next door to the Hotel and soon after one of the Patrons assualted a passer by (push, right cross to the chin followed up with a head butt for good measure). Once again I am saddened that the perpetrator was almost certainly English, drunk, and off his head on drugs. Amsterdam could be beautiful but its seedy red light district and fame for tolerance of narcotics continues to attract the dregs from all over Europe who come here to be foul and obmoxious. I feel so sorry for the Dutch people who are saddled with this legacy in their very fine capital city. So, having gone off topic this hotel is good and the Hotel has no control over the larger civic problems of Amsterdam. If you are coming to NL on business I would definitely recommend this hotel to you. If you feel you want to experience Amsterdam as a tourist then I would recommend it to you as well, however with so many other European cities to choose from I would never come to Amsterdam for leisure. When you consider that a city like Hamburg also is famous for its red light attractions but yet manages to contain these to a very specific area that general tourists would never knwo it was there if they wished to avoid it, it seems strange that the Dutch authorities don't take similar steps to contain the impacts of the darker attractions of their city.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, but worth it when you do”
Reviews.Author: lolanola
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel. Love Renaissance in general, which is why I booked it. We drove up from Germany, silly Americans, so we alone are to blame for being lost for about 2 hours....charming hotel, set back on a side street, you need sharp eyes for the sign! The staff was just great, friendly and efficient. Great public areas as in all Renaissance properties. The room was of course on the small side, we are in Amsterdam, here. But the decor was fresh and modern and I felt the space was well used. You can walk to anywhere you want from here, what great sights we saw!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dudee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room albeit on the smallish side (as many European hotel rooms are). Hotel staff easy to work with. Coffee/eat available 24x 7. Good location near the river. Bicycles available for use if you are so inclined.

Reviews.Title: “5 min from Central station”
Reviews.Author: Galprin
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel 5 stars. Not the best service but great location. 5 min to the train station and walking distance from the city centre. Very convenient. But very noisy even with the shut windows. Don't know if i'll stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location : More liesure oriented though”
Reviews.Author: Kris69Mumbai
Reviews.Content: Nice cosy hotel not too far from the tourist attractions of Dam Square and the Red light district, cafe's bars etc. Very comfy bed, decent sized room for Europe (I had upgraded to a club room) and OK breakfast. Staff was polite and helpful. Recommend the hotel for your stay. Safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except for the bed”
Reviews.Author: Ingmari
Reviews.Content: Great location, supernice staff, really good and quick concierge, good breakfast, friendly cleaningstaff, good housekeeping. Only three things i find they need to improve/change: 1. internet should be for free in 4 star hotels in 2010 2. The bed was awful, either broken or just really old, broken in the middle and far too soft 3. The food in the restaurant wasnt good. Otherwise i loved it and next time i go to Amsterdam i make sure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect central hotel - pieceful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Javanainen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just a huge surprise. The hotel must have really benefited from the recent renovations: it was all I could hope for. The staff was also very helpful and considerate. We didnÂ´t much make use of services, therefore this evaluation is quite short. However, there were such nice restaurants and cafes close by, you didnÂ´t even long for the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star at Best”
Reviews.Author: gpdean
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 5 minutes from Central Station. Tiny room and uncomfortable bed. Premier Inn provide a better room for a fraction of the price ! Most disappointing 5 Star Hotel I have stayed in. The reception staff could learn a lot from the concierge staff who were all very cheery and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: bschellenberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner for three nights in December 2009. The room was quite large for a European hotel and the bedding was unbelievable comfortable. Everything was very clean and the staff was friendly. We actually got to check in at 10am after an overnight flight without any problems. The location is excellent and despite the cold, we walked everywhere. The restaurant at the hotel is quite expensive and thus, we always went somewhere else. There are so many choices and you can eat high and low end nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean reasonable well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: JazzLimerick
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in the Renaissance. As we were using Amsterdam as a stop point for a few train trips the location of the Renaissance, five mins walk from central station was perfect. The hotel itself is what you expect from a Marriot hotel. Staff were not overly friendly and check in took a little wait. The room was comfortable - beds very comfortable - and clean. A little noisy at night but not loud enough to prevent sleeping. For location and price would return.

Reviews.Title: “A great find- location, food and facilities, will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: catmarie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend break for our wedding anniversary. We were so lucky with this hotel from the start. We had booked an early check-in, and we were able to check in to our room at 9 am! Room, if a little small, was immaculate, and was kept very clean by the Housekeeping staff each day. Breakfast was excellent, with four separate buffets- word of advice when booking see if you can get breakfast included (as we did) as otherwise it is â‚¬20 each! We dined in the hoel restaurant several nights as the food and wine was absolutely delicious with great choice. Hotel is in a great location, just a couple of minutes from Central Station, walking distance to Anne Frank's House, and near everything else, but in a really lovely location away from the madding crowds on Damstraat. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, modern rooms and a great location”
Reviews.Author: getouttatown23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as a base for sight-seeing, and it was great. It was near the central train station and we walked to the Anne Frank House, and the town square aka the Dam. It was maybe a 15 min walk or so to the Anne Frank House, it took us longer because we couldn't find it for a while. but it was our time off, so it was all very leisurely. Several canals all around. We could have easily walked to the flower market too, in the other direction, but we didn't have time. i liked the rooms, they were on the smallish side but well decorated and comfortable. i liked the coffee shop on the ground floor of the hotel with windows all around so you felt like you were on the sidewalk. it was cute. all in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “quite ok, considering rude staff”
Reviews.Author: mirush12
Reviews.Content: we arrived about noon, the room wasn't ready yet. that would be ok, but the receptionist was not very friendly. this was then topped by the concierge who was utterly rude, he told us off when asked for help with our luggage! I understand 12 o'clock is a busy time, but this was very unpleasant. we even considered finding a different hotel. glad we didn't do so after all. the room was very nice, especially the bed. very large and comfy. we got a king size and a bathtub as we requested. shame the room didn't have any tea/coffe-making amenities and the Internet was shamelesly expensive! and the heating was not working properly. the location is perfect, very close to the station and all major sightseeing/shopping. Later, the staff were nice and helpful. Especially staff in the kitchen. (oh, and a young concierge who was very easy on the eye ;))

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for tourists visiting Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. We arrived mid morning but our rooms were not available so we left our luggage with the concierge and headed out to visit some of the sights of Amsterdam. On returning in the afternoon we were allocated 3 adjacent rooms. All 3 rooms were spotlessly clean with very comfortable beds. Our luggage was delivered directly to our rooms. I had booked a package which included breakfast and I considered this excellent value. It was a buffet breakfast with an excellent selection of food. The position of this hotel is very good for visiting the sights of Amsterdam. It is only a 5 minute walk from the station so it is very convenient to take a train from Schipol airport. We found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Snazzy decor....medicore service”
Reviews.Author: Palpatine
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been refurbished, the beds are comfy, the restaurant staff is helpful, the spanish barman has no sense of service and does not know how to make a good cocktail. The 2 older concierges are excellent but the bell boys and night duty wannabe concierges are careless, rude and could not care less about guests. Most of the young bell staff is too busy oggling female customers, or trying to make sarcastic jokes at the clients expense in their broken english. In general even the top hotels in the Netherlands do not offer an acceptable level of service. Visit this great city with low expectations when it comes to service and you will be statisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with good location.”
Reviews.Author: bim0952
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine. Luggage taken to room immediately on arrival. Staff friendly and efficient. Room was comfortable. No coffee/tea amenities in room no bottled water available except if you pay for it. Breakfast was good with plenty of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: imfletcher72
Reviews.Content: i stay at this hotel when i'm in amsterdam for business. if you are a marriott rewards member looking for a marriott property in amsterdam this place is a million times better than the Marriott amsterdam. the lobby is modern and clean, the staff is very kind, the rooms are modern, comfortable and clean (even though the building is a bit old), the location is very central and the restaurant is tasty. i also have been lucky getting a very early check-in when i arrive at the hotel at 9:30am from the overnight flight from the states. for business or pleasure you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Good International Standard Hotel in Central District”
Reviews.Author: JP&mom
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Renaissance in early January on a stopover between California and Kenya. If you are looking for a unique hotel with Dutch ambience, look elsewhere. If you want a first class international-standard hotel, this hotel is one. I was almost entirely satisfied with the hotel. I no longer remember the price difference between our "club floor" room and a non-club floor room. (Both were painfully expensive to those paying in $US.) But for us, I suspect that our use of the club lounge made up the rate difference. The club lounge has a very good breakfast buffet and a very pleasant evening beer/wine/snacks service. There is also a computer (internet) and printer in the lounge and daily newspapers. We arrived in at the hotel at about 10AM and were able to get right into the room--much appreciated after long flights from California. In fact, I requested an early check-in when making the reservation, and, about a week before our stay, actually received a non-automated email from the hotel acknowledging the request and indicating that they could probably accommodate my request (no doubt--the hotel seemed nearly empty--middle of week--in January). The room was well appointed, with excellent bathroom supplies. The only negative was that, on the second day/night, we could not get the room adequately warm (I note others had the same experience). It was unusually cold in Amsterdam, however, with another storm coming in. If wishing to stay in the Central District of Amsterdam again (not much reason to do so in the summer), I would happily stay at the Renaissance again.

Reviews.Title: “If internet & breakfast were included and my heater worked I would rate this higher”
Reviews.Author: Robert-CSCO
Reviews.Content: Great view and old-world ambiance, but the fact that I was paying 151-Euros a night and that did not include internet or breakfast really made it feel like I was getting ripped off. My room heater didn't work and they had to provide me with 2-portable space heaters. The internet was an extra 20-Euros a day. The ice machine was all the way on the other side of the building. The hotel staff recommended that I upgrade to the deluxe package which was 60-Euros extra per day and that would have given me access to club lounge, breakfast and internet. I declined because what was the point of being in such a beautiful city if I were to just stay in the hotel? I stayed 2-weeks here and just because it was on the company dime, I still felt cheated. I sent some laundry off to be washed and paid over 75-Euros. I could have just bought new clothes instead of having them washed. Bottom line is - great looking hotel but it's not cheap, there's a charge for everything including local calls, so, better come with a lot of money and try not to think about how much your spending each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JosephC8
Reviews.Content: Very nice room with a comfortable bed. Beauiful reception area. Courteous helpful staff. Solo travelers know that single rooms in hotels are always more expensive, but I didn't want to stay in a bad hotel. This was the right choice for me. Close to the train station and right in the center of Amsterdam. The only thing that I found out of line was the 24 Euro/day charge for wireless internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spdst13
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with friends for a couple of days while vacationing in Europe. The hotel was in a great location, the staff was very helpful and friendly and the room was nicely-sized and modern. Getting to the room was a little quirky, as it seemed like you had to pass through a maze of hallways and the only entrance or exit was at the lobby. The best feature of the hotel was the Club Lounge, which I had free access to through my elite status. While we never were up early enough for breakfast, it had some of the best appetizers in the evening of any Marriott I've ever stayed at. It also had complimentary beer, wine and internet access. Overall, it was a great hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, nice rooms, good location.”
Reviews.Author: gettingandspending
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a friend with champagne tastes, so we were not surprised at the quality of the accommodations. It is situated in a quiet historic street only 5 minutes' walk from the train station, steps from the Singel canal and from shops and resraurants. It is, however, a fair distance from the main shopping and trendy areas of Amsterdam, but there's a tram only a block away that can take you wherever you want to go. The rooms are a decent size, the beds comfortable and the linens luxurious. The bathrooms are immaculate. But really, it was the friendliness and helpfulness of the front desk staff and the concierges that really made the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: SisuB
Reviews.Content: First, they gave me and my family a room whose heating didn't work (and it was December and freezing!). We complained about it and they gave us another room, but the extra bed they gave was broken. We asked for a new extra bed and they gave us an extra bed which was 160 cm x 60... ehm. We didn't want to eat breakfast at the hotel because of the prices (20-30â‚¬).

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: JCMJ
Reviews.Content: We telephoned before we arrived for directions from Central Station which is really only a 5-10 minute walk away. The hotel checked us in quickly and upgraded us as well. Security is great as you have to use your room pass to access the lift and this only takes you to your floor. They were very helpful when we had to book Anne Frank tickets on the internet (well worth it to avoid the queues). They let you use the internet for free for things like this and let you print off your tickets. We found a couple of places nearby for a nice breakfast - a lot cheaper than the hotel. The location is great with everything pretty much within walking distance and trams are also excellent and easy and the concierge will provide you with your tram tickets. Rooms were clean with lovely comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: blazedout
Reviews.Content: beautifull hotel with helpfull staff,not ideally located as u have to go down little alleys to reach red light ,shopping district ..been to amsterdam 4 times best hotel we stayed in by far

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location - great staff!”
Reviews.Author: katiej211
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during the Amsterdam leg of our honeymoon. The staff was nice and helpful, speak great English. recommended bars, restaurants and coffee shops. The room was incredibly clean - in the Marriott style, modern. Bar and restaurant are available, only had breakfast there once as it wasn't included in our room price. Used room service often, very convenient. The location is wonderful...near the train station and in walking distance of everything! Fitness center is big with cardio and weights.

Reviews.Title: “cool place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Delhi171
Reviews.Content: in the centre of city. saved a lot of time travelling

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast!!-Near the central station-Good prices! Very cold nights in Nov09”
Reviews.Author: nassos
Reviews.Content: Great hotel location indeed!! But it could be less expensive for what you get... Although it was extra clean, and the breakfast was really great!! The truth is, that everyone who worked there was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is one of the Marriott chain, so you can imagine the luxury and how modern everything was.. The location is great, as It's only 10 minutes walk from Amsterdam Central train station, and you can reach any place you want just by walking, or taking the tram. Amsterdam is a very small city... Don't miss the Van Gogh Museum and walk Amsterdam...Is really great!! PS. If you book online try to book a room with bf otherwise you're going to pay 24,50 euro pp!!

Reviews.Title: “During the week, the hotel is better managed. Weekends are not good time to check in.”
Reviews.Author: cargo13
Reviews.Content: I traveled the trans-Atlantic flight on Fridy to arrive 8AM Saturday morning in Amsterdam. I quickly exited Schipol airport and made it to the Renaissance quickly where I waited 25 minutes for check in. There were 3 front desk reps (2 very junior that were deer in headlights) working but they were disorganized and getting caught up in a group of 5 Americans checking in as 'associates' rate. I would think the manager, Sara, would have been wise enough to serve full paying guests (not associates) first and segment the staff if they are caught up on tough questions coming from demanding American Marriott associates about ability to use the concierge lounge, ensuring the full family (every room) gets the associate rate, etc. It was quite a seem for those of us paying customers that were waiting in line to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - A Little Expensive - But...I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: WarElk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel location. Place was a little expensive for what you get. Cleanliness: Above par. No complaints at all. Service: EXCELLENT. Concierge was terrific. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Front desk staff was efficient and helpful. Location: About 5 minutes walk (with luggage) from Amsterdam Central train station. Walking distance to most downtown stuff. 24 hour security is present at the hotel...so no worries around the hotel. Value: I don't know...I suppose it is Europe and the dollar sucks right now...but it still seemed awfully expensive. Breakfast buffet was expensive as well. All in all this is a great place. If you book here and are looking to save money on snacks, beer, wine...etc....you can always find a cheap place to eat....and buy some drinks. Heck..with the train station so close...eating breakfast was pretty cheap. Don't get a room on the bottom or 1st floor. Depending on your location in the hotel, you could be too close to the street level and thus...security could be jeopardized. Otherwise...you are good to go. PS...Internet is crazy expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: joesob
Reviews.Content: what more could you ask for? very nice, clean, cozy rooms. great location, close to train station (walking within 4 minutes) and on edge of the jordaan district. oh, and quite nicely priced. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeyMan76
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend (4 nights) at the Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel. This is a great hotel in a great location. Itâ€™s a simple five minute walk from Amsterdamâ€™s Central Station so if youâ€™re flying into Amsterdam, take the train from the airport. It costs only four euroâ€™s and takes around fifteen minutes. A taxi will cost up to eighty euroâ€™s and can take twice as long. The hotel was recently renovated and has a modern, comfortable look. Due to my Marriott Elite status, we were upgraded to a superior room with access to the Club Lounge. Even if you donâ€™t qualify for a complementary upgrade, you may want to consider paying for access to the lounge. Unlike many other lounges in the Marriott/Renaissance chain that close their lounges on weekends, the Renaissance Amsterdam Club Lounge is open seven days a week. Also unlike others that have an honor or paid bar, wine, beer (Heineken and Amstel of course) are free. An assortment of waters, juices and soda are available all day and night as well. There are three food offerings per day. Breakfast (cereal, breads, pastries, fruit, juices, etc.), nightly hors d'oeuvres and desserts. Also included is free internet but it is only available on the one computer located in the lounge. While wifi is available throughout the hotel, it comes with a steep price. 19.95 euroâ€™s per 24 hours. Thatâ€™s around $34! Another alternative for free internet is going to one of the several Bagels and Beans locations throughout Amsterdam. The closet one to the hotel is about a 10 minute walk. You can sit as long as you want and access their internet as long as you buy a coffee or bagel (both of which are pretty good in their own right). Other than Bagels and Beans, there are very few other free offerings for internet service. The rooms are comfortable and have more space than many typical European hotels. Beds are comfortable although they are not the new Marriott beds that you find state side. The room has a small but modern bathroom. There is a good size desk and plenty of closet space. There is an in-room safe, mini-bar and nice size flat screen LCD TV. There is a gym with plenty of new cardio machines although it is lacking in weight equipment. A rack of dumbbells but thatâ€™s pretty much it. The staff from the front desk, bell stand, Club lounge, housekeeping, etc., were all friendly and professional. Check-in was quick and my room was ready for my 9:15 AM arrival. The lobby maintains the modern, remodeled look with wood, marble and large fireplace and sitting area. Along with being easy to get from when arriving in Amsterdam, the hotel is also close to most of Amsterdamâ€™s major attractions either by walking, trams, bikes, canal boats, etc. If youâ€™re going to be in Amsterdam for a couple of days or more, rent a bike. Itâ€™s by far the best way to get around the city. There are bike lanes everywhere and itâ€™s an easy ride to just around anywhere in the city given the cities flat terrain. There are several companies close to the hotel that rent bikes. Hotel Scooters is located a couple of blocks away from the hotel. They rent new, easy to ride bikes for 15 euroâ€™s a day. Less if you rent for multiple days. There is a lot to do, see and experience in Amsterdam and the Renaissance Hotel is a great home base to do it from.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Antsey
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is located just a few minutes walk from Centraal Station and 5-10 minutes to Dam Square, the main shopping drag and the Red light district, you will not need to take a taxi or public transport to get about the city centre. If you don't mind walking, which Amsterdam is a very compact and walkable city, you can walk to Vondel Park in about 25 minutes from the hotel. The hotel provides a very good detailed map, make sure you take a copy when offered on check-in. The rooms are all styled in the same decor, we know because we stayed in three different rooms!! They look as they do from the website and other travellers photographs. One thing to note and to ensure you make a request for on booking if privacy as a couple are important to you, is that you request a room which does not have inter-connecting doors!! Our first room did and we could hear all the details of the conversation of the guests staying next door and I guess likewise for them!! In the end we decided to up-grade to executive level which meant our room was up-graded to include a supposedly bigger room, a king size bed and also included access to the club lounge, which was expensive but well worth it. The rooms are on the small size with small but perfectly adequate fully functioning bathrooms, as expected from a city centre hotel. Furnished nicely and with most of the touches you come to expect with this class of hotel. Beds are on the soft side and the queen bed that we were orginally allocated was obviously quite old as you would have a tendency to roll towards the middle of the bed! Plenty of pillows and towels though. No tea or coffee making facilities in room nor complimentary water but (expensive) fully stocked minibar as well as room service. All staff are very friendly and helpful and service very efficient. If you are looking for a good clean modern hotel in a central but quiet location in Amsterdam you probably will not find much better than this. It is however not boutique, unique or typically Amsterdam chince, more typical coporate, know what to expect standard but a good one at that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, above average location”
Reviews.Author: travelerguy23
Reviews.Content: Near the train station downtown. The hotel is modern and spotless. Front desk service was excellent. There are hotels closer to the museums and entertainment districts, but this is still a very good choice on a quiet sidestreet in the city. Room was quite large with plasma TV and nice amenities. You will pay for the luxury, but for this class of hotel, they delivered. This hotel is modern Amsterdam, not an old europe hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was exaclty what I was looking fo”
Reviews.Author: CoupleEspoo
Reviews.Content: Hetel Reneissance had it all: good location, quiet and comfortable rooms, great breakfast (included to weekend price), king size comfortable bed and friendly staff. The hotel was recently renovated and spotless. I have absolutely nothing to complain. We enjoyed our stay and would definetly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gorgeous and Amsterdam ditto!”
Reviews.Author: CItyBreak09
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel with Hotels.com, the price was very good Â£112 per night for the two of us. The hotel was beautifull and value for money through hotels.com. The satff were very polite and helpful. In fact the people of amsterdam were friendly and helpful and it was a beautiful place to visit. Will definatley go back again in the summer and stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely furnished, shocking service...again....”
Reviews.Author: DaveEssex_UK
Reviews.Content: Well, I thought maybe last time I stayed here they were just having an off day. so i booked in again with 2 colleagues, at the marvellous value (not) of EUR190 a night! The good bits - very clean, nice contemporary furnishings, lovely comfortable bed. Now, to the negatives. Breakfast EUR24. outrageous, and no where near as good as Hilton. Service, oh forget it. Bar - 1 person in drinking. order drinks. takes 20 minutes to get them!!!????? Check in - absolutely shocking. Arrive with 2 desks (alledgedly) manned. One is doing nothing. colleague approaches, the lovely Daisy just glares at them and continues doing something on her computer. Colleague left standing there. Customer in front of mine finished. I walk up. Receptionist has to write some note, walks off and comes back eventually. at least she did apologise. then i have the slowest check in ever. colleague 3 then checks in behind me. slowly. we're both done. colleague 2 is still standing there, incredulous being ignored by the lovely Daisy. Colleague eventually receives a stare, approaches desk. not an apology in sight she's grudgingly checked in! Outrageous! Check out..slow slow slow. oh, and how come the person in front of me, and me also had breakfast we'd never had on our bill. I merely got a shrugged shoulder and "oh well they put it on the wrong room" ... yeah great. You know what, this could be a great hotel. for the price it should be. but shocking service lets it down. so never again, i refuse to pay so much money and be treated like this.

Reviews.Title: “Always my preference in NL”
Reviews.Author: 300zxneed
Reviews.Content: Love the neighborhood this hotel is in also and so close to Centraal Station on Damrak. It isn't cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: kirklandkat
Reviews.Content: Booked online through Marriott.com. and this stay exceeded expectations--especially given the relative price. Very clean and contemporary; obviously newly remodeled. Bathrooms were great including ionic hair dryer and nice bath products. Bed had a bit of a dip in it, but linens were fine. Location was very handy to train station and city center. Service was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Asked for larger room and got it”
Reviews.Author: Ken243444
Reviews.Content: When I made reservations on line directly with the hotel (almost 10 months in advance) I asked for a room for two with a king bed. On arrival we were placed in what was a tiny room, obviously designed for a single business traveler. It had one chair, one set of towels, no room for our luggage at all. I had to wait several hours while another room was prepared but was eventually placed in a comfortable double room with much more space. But I had to be insistent (and courteous--anger gets you nowhere) about it. Don't be meek, just firm but pleasant. And ask to speak with the manager. The rest of our two-day experience at the hotel was fine. This place is a little too pricey for what you get, however.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: iarp
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, clean, superb staff, special location. Everything you expect from a Renaissance you find here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in very central location”
Reviews.Author: ispeaktheblondetruth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night whilst on a stopover to our holiday in Aruba, we have stayed in this hotel before whilst they were undergoing major renovations, so it was nice to go back when everything was mostly finished. We had two rooms, one which had access to the club lounge (which I thought was quite impressive) and our teenage sons were in another part of the hotel which felt like a two mile hike when we were walking from one to the other. Anyway dispite this little niggle the rooms were very nicely updated with comfy beds and the reception area was clean and contemporary. The bonus of staying at this hotel is it's closeness to Gaucho's Steak House just across the road, where we had a fantastic meal.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a convienient location”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Amsterdam surpassed our expectations. Upon check in there was quite a lenghtly queue but hotel management called on extra staff to ensure all check in desks were manned. The room was modern and well sized. King bed was definitely on the soft side, which may or may not suit travellers. The view was that back into the centre of the building so nothing spectacular. Bathroom was small but serviceable. Bathrobes and slippers available in the room. Housekeeping were very friendly and replenished used items upon each service. Breakfast was included in our room rate and consistented of your standard breakfast buffet choices with hot & continental options. Beware though that the wait at the egg station can be extremely long and stock of other items are not replenished as frequently as they should be. I wouldn't pay the EUR24 for breakfast though if its not included in your rate as that is way over priced for what you will get. I didn't use the Fitness Room but it did seem quite well equipped. The location of the hotel is defintiely an advantage. Located only a 5 minute walk from Centraal Station, its perfect for those arriving by train. The hotel is located just at the start of the Jordaan district which is great for cafes, bars and coffeeshops. The hotel lacks the little touches to make it a true 5 star property, such as newspapers in the morning but overall I would defintiely recommend this hotel to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bearcathk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, and loved it. The airline lost my wife's bag, and the concierge at the hotel continually checked on the bag for us, and called us when it was found (more than the airline was willing to do!). Our room was spacious (for European standards), and comfortable. The bathroom was well laid out, and as a tall person (6'7"), I loved the adjustable-height showerhead. Our room didn't have a great view, but it didn't really matter. The location is very good, just a short walk from Centraal Station, and near lots of restaurants and other attractions. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go quite easilly from the hotel. For destinations that were a bit farther, we rented bicycles from a nearby shop. My only complaint is that the internet costs 15 Euros a day to use, which we thought was expensive until we stayed at a Marriott in Copenhagen where they charged 30!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: KerryReview
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaisance Hotel Sept. 2009, Great location, big bedroom, spotless bathroom, very powerful shower, but the BED the most uncomfortable I have ever tried to sleep on -( saggy in the centre and I kept slipping in there then trying to sleep at an angle - not possible) I reguested another room with a comfortable bed, well I got the room but the bed was not much better! I have read other reviews and most of them praise the beds??? One other review says the 9.... rooms are to be avoided, I would agree as they are an annex to the hotel.Overall our stay was good, but I would'nt stay there again (because of the beds)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: mo1972
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve stayed 3 nights in this amazing hotel. As most reviews in here; the service, location and rooms are amazing. The hotel is about 10-15min walk to the main train station so it is very cheap to use the train from the airport (3.8Euro/person). We were offered to upgrade our room for just 50Euros/room/night to a club room. The offer includes buffet breakfast (usually costs around 25Euros/person), unlimited internet access (usually costs 20Euros/24h) and lounge access (priceless as you have unlimited alcoholic drinks and light snacks for about 3-4 hours every evening, coffee and light drinks are offered round the clock). As for the non-club rooms, all people have access to complimentary coffee and tea at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: jay379
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during the beginning of August and I have to say this is an amazing hotel! Staff were very friendly and check in was a breeze. The rooms and bathrooms were spotless and the beds were extremely comfortable. This was the start of my europe trip and the comforts of this hotel really made my stay in Amsterdam enjoyable. The only drawback was the fire alarms started going off during our last night. It wasn't too late and I wasn't too bothered about it. Maybe someone was smoking in their room.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Marriott experience”
Reviews.Author: Nomad464
Reviews.Content: Not much I can see really. It is a very typical Marriott: spotlessly clean, great comfy beds, great breakfast. The location is perfect to explore the city and is close to the central train station and the red light district. I have two minor gripes with regards to service. The cocktail waiter was nigh on surly when I asked for some ice to put on a sting, and breakfast is a free-for-all (you don't get seated, you just have to stake claim to a table and hope while you're off getting food that no one nicks it). Overall, another great Marriott experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: LondonLynelle
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel on every level. We were upgraded to a luxury suite and all i can say is wow. Room was spacious, beautifully decorated and the bed was huge and super comfortable.The only down side to a perfect holiday was the very very steep price they wanted to charge for breakfast. Could not justify a continental breakfast for 20 euros so had to go missioning around for a cheaper option. Other than that excellent value for money and absolutely perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “LIKED IT ALOT”
Reviews.Author: pegomh
Reviews.Content: There are alot of great things about this hotel: I stayed twice during this week and the staff was very helpful and friendly. BA lost my bag and they helped me and then stored a bag for 3 days. First room was small, second time it was much larger and the bed is fluffy and comfortable. I loved the bath, especially the sink - all modern and convenient. Internet stinks but they took the E10 charge off my bill. Only complaint is that the doors "slam" a bit so its not perfectly quiet, which is important to me. But I would definitely stay there again - that's just how great it is. Great location and I walked to the central train station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience at the Renaissance Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraLouise
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great European holiday with my husband and 16 yr old son. After much advance research I selected the Renaissance Amsterdam and was very pleased with the experience. My goals had been : -A good location -A large spacious room that would sleep 3 - A very comfortable bed for my picky husband(princess and the pea syndrome) -Ambiance, quality, decor, cleanliness etc. The hotel is near the Central Train Station which is actually very convenient and easy to access both in the arrival and in the departure from the city. The hotel has JUST been totally renovated and apparently fully reopened in May of 2009. The hotel is modern, well designed and appointed and very well maintained. As I was looking for a large room I asked the staff and they cheerfully supported my desire to actually look at and compare 5-6 rooms from a standard, deluxe and superior size. It was a Monday so maybe it was not as busy as later in the week. but it was very helpful for me. I found the front desk, the bell man(Marcelino) and the Concierge on duty(Leo) to be Excellent. Leo is originally from Indiana and knows his history and all areas of the city. from museums to restaurants. All of his tips were excellent. He was exceptional. I loved the location of the hotel although some might by looking at a map ask if it is really that convenient and the answer is yes. We like to walk as a matter of exercise(wearing off all the delicious food calories). But I liked the quiet street(this is a big deal in this city as it has a lot of young and energetic, visitors and residents) the modern sophistication of the hotel and the decor etc. So for us it was perfect. The city is fairly compact so walking to virtually all the areas we wanted to visit was very doable or if you prefer, the tram is readily available.I am very glad we selected The Renaissance over some of the more "famous" upper end hotels which frankly looked a bit tired from the outside and in noisier neighborhoods. While we mostly walked the tram is very easy to use and reaches all desirable areas. Biking was also great fun and while there are several rental shops one is very near the hotel. I have posted some photos of the room and the very nice size closet. The bathroom was very nice as well. This was a standard room but was spacious, quiet and comfortable. It was on an inside courtyard so no view but that ended up just fine. (rm 429). Each room has a similar overall interior decor but most rooms have differences in shape and view etc. There is an older portion to the hotel (back side I believe) that is thoroughly updated and modernized but some of those rooms were really great in their unique shapes. The first room I looked at on the 9th floor had a cool peaked ceiling, tall windows reaching up to the peaked ceiling and great light. A lot of ambiance but we decided was too small for 3 of us so we selected the 4th floor. There is also complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning! A nice perk. Typical in the States but not so much in Europe. Good luck. This was a very nice and enjoyable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: GoBoSox07
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, roomy to European standards, and had a comfortable bed. The HVAC unit left something to be desired but it was manageable. Club lounge was teriffic and had a nice array for snacks and drinks. The lounge actually saved us a lot of money on otherwise overpriced drinks in the hotel and city in general. Be prepared! Check in and check out was a bit slow but friendly. Friends traveling with us got a room in the dreaded 900 block. They actually had to go to the second floor and then down a really long corridor and proceed up and down an auxilary staircase to look for room numbers in the stairwell! Quite a strange set up, but their room was bigger with much more character than ours. Overall a nice stay in a good part of town.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittytravels_27
Reviews.Content: nice hotel and good location- walking distance to lots of places and close to train stops. the rooms are a little small, but the bed was very comfortable! they have free coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning and always have a candy dish out!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best choices one can make in A'dam”
Reviews.Author: Mista-go
Reviews.Content: Idally located in a safe lane 5 min walking from the Centraal Station, the Reinassance has a 5stars hotel charme without being too posh :) Rooms are clean and cosy and the breakfast is very tasty. Yep, it is a litte pricey, but sometimes you can get cheaper fares. Don't forget to drink a coffee or a beer in the lovely bruine cafÃ¨ on the ground floor!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, smaller rooms”
Reviews.Author: hjs19712003
Reviews.Content: Once again, Marriott didn't do anything special for this gold member. I got access to the executive lounge with it's paltry breakfrast spread and that was about it. Not sure what Gold status gets me with them other than executive lounge access (when they are open). Anyway, hotel is clean and modern, location is great, 5 minute walk to most everything, tram stop is 2 minute walk. Set just enough off the beaten path to avoid most of the undesirables that seem to be filling up amsterdam more and more these days. The room was clean but rather small, even by Euro standards. The hotel restaurant was good not too expensive. Not great food or great value but it does the trick if it's raining and you don't want to walk anywhere. Pricing was inline with other 4* hotels in the area so that means it's pricey and not a great value. I would stay there again mostly for location and cleanliness, not for value. As with anyplace in Amsterdam, leave the car outside the city and take the train in. Parking at the hotel is non existant and I heard it's 45Euro/nt. A taxi ride to the airport is also 45Euro.

Reviews.Title: “A real winner for Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: PettifoggerWA
Reviews.Content: I am surprised at those that raised an issue about service...ours was wonderful. From the doormen, to the bellmen, to the front desk, all were prompt and courteous. Location? Wow, could not have been dropped into a better place. A short stroll to the train station, around the corner from the main shopping avenue, tram and bus access. This place had it all. The rooms were modern and comfortable and had AWESOME air conditioning. If you are flying in or out of Schipol airport and have only one bad to manuver, you can walk to this hotel EASILY from the train station. We were coming in from a cruise that disembarked in Rotterdam and had 3 bags for 2 people so a cab may be necessary which should cost 7 euro. Price we had to pay! Great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: irlhelen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Renaissance Amsterdam for 3 nights in July 2009. I booked it online through the hotel website. I got quite a cheap rate for the weekend with slightly more for a Monday night. The lobby isn't big and 2 or 3 people waiting to check in quickly overwhelms it. However, the staff are very friendly and helpful. Location can't be beat as it's less than 5 minutes to the Centraal Station, very near the Jordaan and trams to the museums. The sound-proofing on the corridor and the street side window (we were to the front of the hotel) was not great, but we couldn't hear a thing from our neighbouring rooms. The street is also relatively quiet with only a few scooters making any noise. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, central hotel for a pretty good price”
Reviews.Author: DHHArizona
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a central area and everything was withing walking distance. It was also within very close walking distance of the train station. The lobby was nice and so was the staff. Our plane arrived in the morning, so they didn't have a room ready yet, but gladly held our ample luggage until our room was ready while we explored Amsterdam. They even gave us a lounge key since our rooms weren't ready. The rooms are quiet and extremely comfortable. The design is nice. They also had a very good breakfast buffet, which was included in the price. We got everything we needed, including adjoining rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: kumarv
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the heart of the city. Convenient to the Amsterdam Centraal station and has lots of food places near by. Easy access to public transportation. Room was good also although the hotel staff did not give me room with outside view.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: alxgr2
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, clean , value for money, in the centre of amsterdam , close to the railway station..nice restaurants inside hotel.Top Choice to Stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: GlobalExpat
Reviews.Content: I just spent the weekend there with my wife and children (age 3 and 7). The hotel is a story of two tales. In one hand the facilities are nice and everything is new (great job done with the recent renovation). The location is good as well. On the other hand, the service is horrible. Three examples: First, long lines to check in as the hotel is clearly understaffed. There were three positions to check in/check out but only one was open. Second, they told me by phone (their website says the same) that the parking lot is closed due to renovation, however, I saw cars getting in and out. When I asked they told me that I could have parked my car there but at that moment there was no more space. Third, the most shameful of all, when on Saturday 4th in the afternoon I asked to Simone, a lady that seats in the "Delighted to Serve You" office for directions on how to reach my room, she laughed as if I were an idiot, really incredible. When you're paying top dollars you expect top service in addition to great facilities. In this regard this hotel totally fails... they clearly need to invest more in training their people. Next time I go to Amsterdam I will spend my Euros somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hoppin' place with great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: lrynwnab
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The concierge staff were absolute pros and even made an international call for us to help us with the hotel at our next destination. The bar area was large and quite comfortable. The location is right by the train station which is nice and is close to a tram stop to get to the museums, shopping etc. The one problem was that the rooms were poorly soundproofed and we were woken up by someone snoring in the next room. Also, the elevators were slow and one night two of them were broken. So I would stay on the second or third floor to account for this. The room service was timely and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare at check-in”
Reviews.Author: traveler0001966
Reviews.Content: We paid top rate to stay at this beautiful hotel, booking through Holland America after a cruise with them. While reservations had to be made well in advance of our arrival and the hotel had more than sufficient time to prepare, they were totally unprepared and woefully understaffed for our check-in. Passengers (a number of whom were elderly or handicapped) who asked about porters to help bring luggage from the bus were told to bring it inside themselves and help would be available in the lobby. It was not. After standing in line in the very crowded lobby (lovely but not functional for a crowd), moving our luggage along with us, we were all told to see the concierge for help--which meant another wait to try to get that poor, very busy man's attention. Of course, because the concierge was drowning in luggage, there was no one available to help with info about tours, etc. As a result we lost out on opportunities for most of the longer tours we might have liked to book (that other cruisers we ran into who had booked themselves into lower priced lodging nearby were able to get assistance from their hotels in arranging). Hotel restaurants were closed on Sunday. After finding a place for lunch, then being able to check in to a room and waiting an hour, I wound up bringing up our luggage myself because things were still somewhat of a mess downstairs. The hotel itself was beautiful, if pricey when booked the way we did, and the location was wonderful. The assistance that was to be provided by Holland America was neither evident to us during check in nor were the hotel staff we talked to aware of its availability. I am a frequent Marriott customer and am used to getting much better service, even in less lofty surroundings. It seemed to me this place emphasized profit over service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelbee2008
Reviews.Content: Convienently situated next to the main station, shopping, and red lights district.
