Reviews.Content: We were looking to stay in a smaller hotel, but couldn't get a room for only 2 nights. The Renaissance had rooms available at a special weekend rate and the location looked convenient to the train station. When we arrived at the station, it was a short walk to the hotel through some slightly sketchy looking streets. The hotel itself is in a nice, charming, quiet square. The lobby is very nice and check in went very smoothly. We were able to get into our room even though it was before the official check in time. The room was very nice; presumably had already been renovated. As a Gold Marriott rewards member, I had access to the Club Lounge. Breakfast was very good and they had a very nice happy hour with free drinks and very nice food. The staff in the lounge were friendly and helpful. On the whole, it was a great stay. Service and facilities were all I expected.

Reviews.Title: “pretty average for the price”
Reviews.Author: cibogirl
Reviews.Content: We were looking for accommodation in Amsterdam for a weekend and there didn't seem to be much available. The location was good as it was only a few blocks from the main train station. The lobby looked lovely and staff were very helpful, but once we reached our room, we were a little disappointed. It appeared that the hotel is undergoing renovations and our room obviously had not benefited from that yet. Furnishings were tired looking and the bathroom needs a makeover. All of this would have been acceptable, but this hotel was significantly more expensive than where we stayed in the rest of Europe, including France, Germany and italy.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Room”
Reviews.Author: TallCool1
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out great for us. Is is an easy walk from the train station, and in a good location for doing tourist stuff. The best thing was the bed. It has a feather pad on the bottom that we liked so much we bought one when we got home. We nick-named their bed "Cloud 9". Our room was recently remodeled, and the decorating was very cool, very "Amsterdamish". Iwould stay here again, if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bbigdaddy
Reviews.Content: I left the North Sea Jazz festival in Rotterdam (3 days) and was very pleased with this hotel. The front desk was great! The room was great. they upgraded me because of Marriott Club member and my room was not ready. I have not read any review of the Breakfast Buffet. It is a must. Made to oder eggs, fruit, pastries, hot foods, cold foods and great coffee. The hotel is close to the tram, close to good resturants and a short walk to Central station. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scotslads
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend staying here. An excellent hotel in m any ways. Staff always polite and helpful, room beautiful and always spotless, food excellent (breakfasts and dinner in the restaurant). Only criticism is that coffee is not available in the room, only from a machine in the reception area. The hotel is central - about 4 minutes walk from Centraal Station (from the airport train)and for all the main sights. Trams run down the main street a short walk away so there is easy access to even the more distant parts of town. Also close to the nightlife on the Warmoesstraat with the Cuckoos Nest and The Web bars very close by, We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: crossVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a prime location within an easy walk from the central station. The rooms are pleasant and well appointed. The hotel is very clean. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The breakfast buffet is fabulous. This was my second stay at the property and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful”
Reviews.Author: advum
Reviews.Content: Decent location minutes from the railway station. Amsterdam is small and you can get about without a car. The hotel is swamped by groups/conference delegates/airline pilots who seemed to be more important than us. We were made to wait 3hrs as the room was not ready before we checked in @ 1730 and then given a room above the staff exit to compound our misery as the door kept banging throughout the night.Complaints were pointless as the hotel was full. I would definitely not recommend this place unless you have money to waste.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ted1690
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my Birthday, along with my wife and 4 friends. The Hotel has a perfect location, being 5 minutes walk from Central Station and the boat trips, and if you would like to see the Red Light District, that is on the opposite side of Damrak, again only a short walk. The rooms are spacious, clean and have everything you need to make your stay enjoyable, eg... hairdryer, iron/board, mini-bar, sat tv, gowns and slippers. The staff are very friendly Visit the old bars down the narrow streets for excellent beer and food, all at better value for money, it is like any big city, people are out to make money from tourists. If i had to whinge about something, it would have to be the whingeing Americans to which this Hotel is accustomed to. Read the reports on this site and all the negatives come from over the pond, dont let these put you off, as you should know everything is bigger and better in the USA. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Definately not worth 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: KPeirce
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Amsterdam & stayed at this hotel. Room definately not worth 300 euros per night, exceptionally poor value for money. Room was nothing special despite being upgraded to one of the newly refurbished rooms. Hotel supposed to be a 5 star but in reality should only be a 3 / 4 star. No pool which is a 5 star must. Hallways are ugly brick and dimly lit. GOOD news room was very clean and good location but BAD news all the hidden charges e.g. when we arrived to get in not only did we have to pay up front but was also asked for 50 euros per night deposit. Would definately not recommend this hotel. Staff very rude expected tips for even the simplist of requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jtriefen
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to mainland europe we loved this hotel. Great location, friend staff, lots of comfort, and very clean. I recommend this to any one traveling to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: skyewalker16
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend break. Personally thought the hotel was sited in an excellent location. Good bars and retaurants loated all around. Try Haarlemmerstraat for eating and drinking excellent quality. Hotel <5 mins from station. No complaints with room or service although we did not eat at the hotel thus would be unfair to give it 5/5. Taxi from airport 40 EU on a Friday evening so perhaps expect a little more with traffic. Approx 10 min walk to Dam Square where things liven up a little. Wouldn't say hotel was near Red Light District as some have said. RLD fun to people watch in the day but there's more to Amsterdam than the RLD. Best fun of the weekend - Hiring bikes for the day at 10EU/person. What a great way to see the city. Just watch out for the trams!!!

Reviews.Title: “4*...are you kidding me????”
Reviews.Author: bjorkman
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Amsterdam and stayed at this hotel and am absolutely amazed at how bad a hotel that claims to be this good can actually be... Our room overlooked a parking garage - the ceilings were less than 7'-0" high in the corridors - the dutch are tall people... has the marriott chain figured that out yet? the rooms themselves were nothing to write home about - very average and very ordinary with absolutely no character....borderline shabby actually. I understand they are undergoing a renovation.. the rates should be lower - under any circumstances. Booked the hotel at 200 euro a night for a double room with no extras- that too on lastminute.com - the rack rates are significantly higher - 390 euro - and am amazed that they can ask for so much for providing so little. Upon checking out they upped our rate and asked us to pay a 10 euro additional fee (apart from the taxes which were another 10 euro which we were happy to pay)... now 10 euro is not a big amount but saying that "the agency hadnt deducted the right amount from my card" was a little lame and frankly, in bad taste. We refused to pay and they didn't press it but it just left a bad taste in the mouth. Amsterdam is a wonderful city - the people are absolutely great- the only selling point for this hotel is its location - right within walking distance to Centraal Station so getting to and from the airport is easy. Having said that there are tons of hotels in the area so that is hardly a USP.... in a nutshell - stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: SailingTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for several weeks on a recent business trip. As mentioned in some of the previous reviews the hotel is going through renovation. Some of the rooms are already done. Even though the design is modern and friendly the size of some of the room make you feel like being in a cage. The Renaissance started renting out these rooms despite the fact that they are not fully functional. I am 6'4 (1.93) tall and my head hit the ceiling in the shower. The minibar wasn't in yet and additional lights were missing in the bathroom around the mirror. The closet is that small that you can't hang up too many suits and shirts. As they placed the safes in a way that your shirts can hang fully down it gives you the impression of being in a hostel. The biggest turn-off was the smell in the room I had. Initially I thought that maybe the new furnitures were the cause for it, but actually I was told by the front desk that the new carpet would be the cause for it and that it would be a well known issue. For business people it is key that they gym opens early in the morning - well, as the gym in the hotel is operated buy a third-party it does not open before 8:30 AM. Despite the fact that the hotel is located in a good area it simply has to do improve a lot to satisfy International business people needs. Other properties like nh-hotels or the Pulitzer certainly understand the business better. Last but not least the overall quality of the frontdesk, F&B and concierge staff is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a much needed update”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Lving
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights in early June. The hotel is in a great location, you can easily walk from Central station...just look for the dome as you exit the station on the right. The hotel common areas are fine, but the rooms and hallways scream 1982. Thankfully (mercifully?) Marriott has started gutting each floor and the work (according to the front desk) will last the rest of this year. The staff was great, there is good free coffee in the lobby and being able to walk anywhere in Amsterdam (or bike) within 20 minutes makes this hotel a bargain. I hope to return after the renovation, and feel it will be a MUCH improved property.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service, 3 star accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Digicision
Reviews.Content: I got a pretty good room rate directly through Marriott.com. The hotel was easy to get to, and given that it was my first time to Amsterdam, it was very nice that it was so close to central station. Once you get out of Central station, you head right towards the main street. Once you get to the intersection, you keep going straight -- you will notice that all the trams are leaving and arriving along this street... about 1 minute walk there is a small fork in the road... just before the fork, turn right and you're there at the hotel. Very close. The hotel is in/near the red light district... which wasn't too bad for me, because at least there were a lot of people milling around (I'd rather be in a busy place than in some deserted location). Very central location... easy to get on the trams and go where you want to go to. Hotel lobby was very nice, staff service was professional and friendly. However, the rooms are under constructions, and I basically stayed in a converted apartment style room. Not luxurious at all. Old carpeting, old beds, and facing a loud street. Bathrooms not modern, towels not that fluffy. Although the rooms were kept clean from the staff. In any event, it was like living in a student dorm. I know that they are renovating, and probably once the renovations are over, the rooms will be what I would expect of a Marriott stay... however, for now, the "temporary" rooms were substandard, in my opinion. Not much to eat in the area before 9am... breakfast terribly expensive (24.50 euros for an American type breakfast). I know that it's typical of European hotels, but given my overall experience, I couldn't get myself to dish out that much for a breakfast. Walked to Central station and got a croissant and coffee instead. Overall, don't expect anything special until the new rooms are ready.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldClassTraveler7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central and <5 min walk from the central station. It's pretty close to the red light district so it isn't the best area unless you want to be there. The beds were very uncomfortable the worst if slept on for a hotel of that class/price. The air condition was not working at all in the room. The superior room with a queen bed barely had enough room for the desk and the bed. The rooms are quiet old, but they are under going a remodeling so there is some construction. The staff was very courteous and helpful. In general there aren't enough class A hotel rooms in Amsterdam so with all the visitors coming to town, hotels like this can get away with the high price and deliver much less.

Reviews.Title: “typical 4-star int' hotel”
Reviews.Author: blackszabbi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with my wife for EUR 155 per room excluding breakfast which is below the list price of ca. EUR 250. The hotel worth a 4 star grading, nothing, special typical international hotel. The pro side is nice breakfast, 4-star services in general, good location (3-min walk from Central Station, 10-min from main square) the con is the relatively small size room and a bit uncomfortable bed. Maybe 1 more downside: concierge was available 1 time out of 4 as we wanted to have concert&museum tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: angelee
Reviews.Content: Not much to say... the hotel was perfect! I stayed last year with my boyfriend The room was perfect with mini bar, big comfy bed, dressing gowns, slippers... they put you name on the tv... the bathroom floor was heated. They have a one touch room service which was efficent and the food was excellent. The location is also perfect its right on the corner of Dam Square so only a few mins walk from the red light district, shopping area etc. we also went on the ben and jerry ice cream and dominos pizza cruise and to a comedy show and resturant which i would definetly recommend! There are some really good clothes shops and i would recommend the green house effect cafe, the Weed museum is also worth seeing, we also went to the sex museum which was good... again i got lots of advice and photos been about 5 times now (different hotels)...

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: cha630
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located, but definitely run down. Heavy rennovation of the hotel isn't pretty right now, but I think it will make a huge difference...wasn't bothered by the noise but I heard several other guests discussing it - if possible, wait to stay here until they're done with the work (Crowne Plaza is right across the street and looks just as nice). I asked for a non smoking room, which ended up being in the non smoking wing and it was a hike from the lobby. Especially bothersome when the elevator in the non smoking wing was not working. Other than all that - great location, nice chocolates at reception and very friendly people. Look forward to returning once they pretty up the rooms and hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smokemon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice and will stay here again during our next trip to Amsterdam. Everything about this hotel is excellent, the rooms, staff and location are perfect. It's just a short ten minute walk from the Train Station, but have that street map handy as one wrong turn will land you in a maze of walkways which could be frustrating if you're not familiar with the city. Look for the big dome on the right when you exit the station, that's where the hotel is. To save time, you can get your Museum tickets from the concierge who was very attentive, patient and helpful. When considering day trips to other cities, he offered fine suggestions and helped with the train schedules and had maps on hand. Both times we stayed here, our rooms were large, spotless, and extremely quiet. The beds are top of the line, no problem falling into a blissful sleep. The decor was pleasant and I enjoyed the brick corridors. We always run the risk of finding a great hotel with bad service, or a bad hotel with great service. Staying here, we received the best of everything. If you're going to splurge, you "will" get what you pay for at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fab location, fab beds and fab staff!”
Reviews.Author: caseyk1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for two nights on the 23rd and 24th of Febuary and loved this hotel! I had never been to Amsterdam before but my boyfriend had, and we and our friends decided to book here as the price was quite good. The hotel is only a few mins walk from Central, and very easy to find. We got to the hotel about 5 hours early but the staff kindly let us check in anyway. Our friends suitcase was still in liverpool airport when we got to amsterdam, but the staff in the Renaissance couldnt do enough for us and even got the suitcase back the same night! FIRST CLASS SERVICE! The bed we had was supposed to be a king size but was huge..and very very comfy! The room was very clean too. Overall a great hotel for the money and we are going to stay here on our next vist to the Dam!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: huntermvs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really loved our visit to this hotel and the city. The hotel was in excellent condition. We asked for a non smoking room and were very pleased to not smell any smoke on the entire 4th floor and our room and the service was immaculate. Every one of the staff went out of the way to greet us and help us--every day! There was always coffee available in the lounge and small chocolates at the desk. The infomation desk always had someone there who could give you advice about anything and promptly. The hotel was a short (5 minute) walk from the train station and close to all the main attractions. We are in our upper 50's and had no problem walking to all the local sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: petrol1967
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Central Station after catching the train from the Airport and kept right as we walked out of the Hotel. We crossed the road to be standing at the bottom of Nieuwezijds Voorbergwaal road. About 100 metres up on the left you will see the Hotel. Arrived at reception and the young girl was welcoming and informed us that our room was not quite ready, but she took my mobile number and said she would call when it was, so we could go for a wonder around the city. Once we were booked in our baggage was taken and stored until we were able to get into our room. About an hour later we returned to the Hotel and were shown directly to our room which as clean and well maintained with a good selection of toiletries. Bed was very comfy and had trouble getting off of it in the morning. Hotel bedroom was quiet and cleaned twice every day (in the morning and a turndown service in the evening) During our stay the staff were very friendly and professional and I would recommend this Hotel to someone who likes to be close to everything, but not quite in the middle. Within a 1 minute walk from the Hotel are a selection of bars and resturants and many places to have breakfast. Also a number of "coffee shops" are easily accessable if thats your thing. The Red Light District is a short 7 minute stroll away from the Hotel across the Damrak.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Barry,London
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and the staff were outstanding - nothing was too much of a problem. Hotel room was facing the inside of the hotel so nice and quiet, room was large with a king size bed. Ate in the hotel one night and the food was of a high standard and not too expensive. Another night we used a steak restaurant (rio grande) just up the road and this was also good. Hotel in ideal situation close to Central station and within walking distance of a number of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: raavani
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last weekend of Feb 2007. Very satisfied with the experience. The hotel is at a good location about 5 - 7 minutes walk from the central station. The shopping street is just next to the hotel. Plenty of eating places around and you can also catch the tram to the rembrandt square for more options. It takes only about 10 minutes. The hotel room itslef was nice and clean and there is a free coffee and tea vending machine available 24 hours in the lobby. The lobby is also very nice, but there is no wireless access at least not for a handheld device.

Reviews.Title: “"Over-promissed / under-delivered"”
Reviews.Author: Szymon-Luxembourg
Reviews.Content: Planned a romantic weekend with my wife in Amsterdam in Feb 2007. I booked an exec. king room at Renaissance Amsterdam - got a fair price of under EUR 200 for the room, breakfast, free minibar, etc... The room was old, was facing inner-court, so you could actually spy on other people who had rooms on the other side of the court. Old and uncomfortable bed, ageing bathroom, well.... not of Renaissance or Mariott standard you would expect. Breakfast included in the price was served in the business launge - and was probably the weakest point of the entire stay - extremly limited choice and no taste. I would not recommed this hotel to anyone, unless you can get a room at under EUR 100 (this is what it is really worth)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend. Very handy for the station - about 5 minutes walk. Reception staff are very friendly and helpful. We were given a complimentary upgrade to the club floor which included complimentary tea & coffee in the club lounge throughout the day, free mini bar in the room (wine & beer, no spirits) and drinks and nibbles in the club lounge from 5.30 until 9.00 each evening. Hotel room was very comfortable and spacious. Ate in the hotel restaurant one evening,which was nothing special, although again the staff were very friendly. We would certainly stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bintang
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel via the Marriott website which was easy to use. Excellent location, very near to the central station - we walked to the hotel from the station in only a couple of minutes. Reception staff were friendly but not the friendliest we've encountered but no complaints. It was our wedding anniversary and without us asking we received a free upgrade to a deluxe room which was spacious, very clean and had everything required of a 4 star hotel. We also received a welcome / congratulation bottle of wine upon arrival! A very nice touch. The hotel is very near the main attractions and only a short walk to Dam square and the red light disctrict. It's also near some very good restaurants including Gouchos just across the road which we used and would recommend. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel (which was quite pricey) but ate using a local delicatesen just around the corner which was lovely. Canal boat trips are next to the builing - ok but a bit boring. Would recommend this hotel and if we revisit Amsterdam we would stay here again. Typical 4 star hotel - very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GaryHLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are a regular visitors to Amsterdam and have stayed at numerous hotels throughout the city and for us the Rennaissance offers the best in location, comfort, service and value. OK it is a bit outdated in it's design and it doesn't offer the uniqueness of the hotels located in the Amsterdam canal houses but it does offer large rooms with extremely comfortable beds (served by lifts and not near vertical stairs), excellent service throughout the hotel from the check in desk to the very helpful and entertaining concierge, a substantial buffet breakfast (ensure this comes as part of your room rate) and one of the best locations in Amsterdam, giving easy access to the wonderful canals, the Jordaan Quarter, Centraal station, the main shopping street and the Damrak (if you must visit this awful area). I have stayed in a Club Room (offering free beer, wine & soft drinks from the mini bar and access to the club lounge) but for the extra cost I think the Quality Rooms are better value. So if you are considering booking the Rennaissance don't be put off by the negative reviews, you'll get a lot of hotel for a little money!

Reviews.Title: “smelled like an ashtray”
Reviews.Author: melyte
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to the train station and most anywhere you need/want to be in Amsterdam, but so are a whole lot of other hotels! We asked for (and confirmed again ahead) for a non-smoking room. We were assigned to a "basement-like" first floor room that smelled so bad that I had a hard time breathing. We called the front desk to ask for a non-smoking room and were assured that we were in one. When we told the front desk staff that there were cigarette burns on the same table that held the phone we were using, he offered to send a housekeeper down to spray something. He said no other rooms were available. A very pleasant woman arrived and we explained our dilemma. She told us that the occupant in the room just before us was a heavy smoker!! She called the front desk from our room and, suddenly, another room was available. It looked nothing like the hotel's photo of their rooms, but at least I could breathe. All the beautiful teaser photos on their advertisements are of the building across the street from the hotel with the dome. Apparently where they hold conferences. My partner and I are gold and silver (respectively) Marriott rewards members and this is what we got for our loyalty!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dfenz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while attending a conference in Nov 2006. The hotel was very comfortable, the bar very relaxed and the breakfasts very nice (if overpriced). My first floor room was quite spacious although as it faced the street there was quite a lot of noise that the windows did little to prevent coming into the room. The location is very central being close to Central station and the main shopping streets. The conference centre for this hotel is just across the street and its certainly a very beautiful surrounding to be spending a day in a former church!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: pamnrobnemnernel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel over the weekend and it was fabulous! First of all, it's only a 15 minute train ride from the airport and about a five minute walk from the train station (the train is much cheaper than a taxi!). It's very well placed. You can walk to everything. The entire staff is extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful, affordable and very clean. The room was a good size and had a mini bar. There were also several TV channels in English. The bed was VERY comfortable and had extra pillows! They turned down the bed for us at night. The hair dryer worked very well! The toiletries were really nice, which is good with the 100ml travel restrictions in place now. They have a nice shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion, shower cap, hand soap and face soap. They also supplied us with a razor and shave cream upon request. There were small bottles of mouth wash in the lobby restroom as well. There was complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby during the morning. They do have a restaurant and bar, but we chose to eat at the many wonderful restaurants out in town. The food was fantastic! If we ever go back to Amsterdam we will stay at this hotel again. The concierge was really helful telling us where to walk to for the canal boat tour and the Anne Frank House. They also stored our bag for us when we checked in early and after we checked out so we could walk around before leaving. Amsterdam is such a wonderful place to visit and staying at a great hotel made it even better. I hope this review is a help to you and have a great time in Amsterdam! Pam

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Febo17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Amsterdam for 4 nights on business. I enjoyed this hotel. The hotel is especially convenient to the Central Rail Station and the tram lines are only a block away. Facilities are modern and clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. My room was on the Club Floor. Club Lounge was quite convenient for breakfast and afternoon beers. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good city center hotel...would return.”
Reviews.Author: AP_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance for a weekend...first time to Amsterdam. It was in a good location, within walking distance to the train station, restaurants, pubs... Nice lobby, rooms were generic. Very nice front desk staff. Timely room service that was ordered late night. Also, the concierge was very helpful..recommended some great restaurants. I wouldn't consider the hotel luxurious by any means but I had a really nice stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “a different class”
Reviews.Author: mandylawson
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel as part of a dfds luxury mini cruise break and proved to be just that. arrived at reception early but allocated room straight away, room very cosy, bathroom very spacious with lovely toiletries. went for a walk and on return pleasantly surprised to find champs and strawberries in room with compliments of guest relations officer bronwyn leroux. on arrival i had mentioned we were celebrating my husbands 40th birthday. this put the icing on the cake and made our stay very special. a beautiful hotel very peaceful fab staff, breakfast first class, what more can i say, will strongly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Ask and it's yours!”
Reviews.Author: SelenaBartlett
Reviews.Content: We booked interconnecting rooms at a fabulous rate of 230 euros per room per night for dinner, bed and breakfast. However once there the rooms we had been allocated were very small (we have three children who always have their own room). At the reception desk (even though the hotel was virtually full) the staff were incredibly helpful and showed me two other 'setups' that would have been appropriate. We decided to go for a bedroom with interconecting lounge (with sofa-bed) for a fabulous rate of 309 euros (for both bits). The rate incuded the minibar (the free chocolate went down very well with my three children) and the wine was a decent standard, in addition to this, it included breakfast at the club lounge which offered a wide enough range of breakfast choices and in the evenings from 5.30pm had free wines etc and hot and cold nibbles. It felt a little strange going into the lounge to get our 'freebies', but once the room filled up the atmosphere was like a very chilled but lively (you get my drift) nice bar. Our children were the only ones there, but we did not feel self conscious and the manager when she saw our children there even went downstairs to collect colouring things for the younger two. The decor is rather peculiar and you are definately part of a 'chain', but that actually worked in the hotel's favour in so much as the staff were all very well trained, the hotel was spotless and the 'american' attitude to customer service was very, very welcome! The restaurant (behind the bar) was fabulous and very inexpesive compared to other five stars we have visited in mainland Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Ex-smoker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was generally clean and comfortable, and the staff was very professional, but the hotel itself was very generic. Once you entered the lobby, you could have been in any Howard Johnsons or Holiday Inn. There was no individulism. The location was good, being close to the train and canal stations and many tourist sites, but room service breakfast trays left in the hallways reamined there until well into the afternoon, and I was awakened very early one morning by a work crew hammering in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: KingDoody
Reviews.Content: Overall a pretty good hotel. We had a standard room which was spacious and clean. I requested a high floor room but we checked in late and only got a 3rd floor (out of 8) which looked out onto a car park! Air con in the room was good but it was noisy from about 6 am outside the window so I'd recommend going for a high floor on the front (city streets in Amsterdam are quiet as not much traffic) Hotel staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and a definate plus point fir the hotel. We paid 189Euros per night per room without breakfast . It's easy to get breakfast in the cafe's close to the hotel so not a big deal. Overal value for money was OK. Location of the hotel was excellent, all major attracttions were within 30 mins walk - most within 15 mins and public transport was excellent and cheap. Other negative point was room had no tea/coffee making.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Never Go Back”
Reviews.Author: allenweiner
Reviews.Content: A mix of bad luck and bad hotel services turned our stay at the Renaissance into a nightmare. It was a bad omen when we had to walk to the hotel from the train station as it was too close for any cab driver to take us. The front desk was staffed by an inexperienced trainee who had major difficulties finding our reservation. The room was OK, but rather dark and the halls were dirty, lined with room service trays that had not been picked up. The worst feature was the lack of an in-room safe which is peculiar given that Amsterdam is a dangerous place in terms of theft of personal property. To that end, we had a carry bag stolen that night while we dined outdoors, and without an in-room safe, we were left to carry our passports on our person forcing us to spend half a day at the US consulate getting new passports ($200 later). We also lost a camera and diabetic supplies. The next day, we used the safe deposit boxes at the front desk for what was left of our valuables. Later that day, when we went to retrieve some personal items, we find that the front desk clerk neglected to give us a key to the box. Instead, she left it in an envelope with our room number in an empty break room. Luckily, nothing was missing. Even though the Marriott site says there is a fitness center at the hotel, the fitness facility actually is not part of the hotel itself and has a hefty premium charge. Not even the priciest Marriotts in New York have that fee attached for health club access. The last oddity was our ride to the airport. The concierge arranged it with a shuttle service advertised in the lobby, but we were taken instead by a private cab. That caused us to wonder just whatâ€™s going on at that place!

Reviews.Title: “A modern American-style hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: saskatoonguy
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel right in the heart of Amsterdam. The Renaissance chain is part of the Marriott corporation, and this hotel is perfect for North Americans who donâ€™t want to endure the quirks of European-owned hotels. I paid 159euros per night in July 2006 (weekend rate booked through the Marriott website). I strongly recommend it. The room had air conditioning, a rarity in Europe. The chambermaid left two large apples on the table, and when I left a note saying â€œthanks but I donâ€™t care for apples,â€� she replaced them with *four* of the biggest plums I had ever seen â€“ a very nice gesture. Overpriced bottles of water were sitting on tabletops â€“ at 4.50euros per bottle, donâ€™t be tempted to open one! The hotel is not doing the customer any favors with water at that price. Instead, go to the nearby pedestrian street, Nieuwendijk, which almost (but not quite) borders the hotel on the north side, and stock up on goodies at one of the small grocery stores there. Donâ€™t make my mistake of taking a taxi from the airport to the hotel, which cost me 47euros plus tip. Much smarter is to take the train from the airport to the hotel for a mere 3.60euros, and then make the short ten minute walk from Central Station to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, wonderful as usual!”
Reviews.Author: andrewclauer
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively, mostly in the US but 6-7 times per year in Europe, etc. My decision to return to Amsterdam for some vacation time is of course based upon the beauty of the City and its people; however, the decision is made that much easier by my knowledge that the friendly staff and great stays I've had at the Renaissance will be repeated. This is my fifth trip to Amsterdam for vacation, and my fourth stay at the Renaissance. I can honestly say that the level of overall almost ridiculously friendly and attentive service has actually increased over the past 4 years. From the moment of check-in, great attention is paid to making sure that guests are comfortable, and that all needs are met. As with many trans-Atlantic visitors, we all show up and want to check in at 10:00am. This hotel goes out of its way to help make sure that guests are allowed to check in as expeditiously as possible. They hold luggage, give waiting guests access to the executive lounge upstairs and continue to follow-up with housekeeping to make sure that the wait times are kept to a minimum. The hotel has a large compliment of staff, including bell persons, front desk attendants, concierge, etc. Especially helpful and detail-oriented is the "Guest Services Manager" (whose name I must admit I can't recall at the moment). She is always there to help, and aside from the fact that she always seems to be going 1000+ MPH helping everyone within a 100 mile radius, she provides the finishing touch on what is a truly spectacular guest experience. In addition to the 400+ rooms (and they have some really cool Junior Suites which feature private balconies), the Renaissance has wonderfully appointed apartment units, located in several adjacent historic buildings. During my last two extended stays (last one was almost 3 weeks, this one only 2), I opted for the apartments, so that I could have a small kitchen, and some extra space for all of my junk. Last year, I was traveling with a friend, and we got a two-bedroom; this year, I went with the one. The apartments are a wonderful and affordable alternative, and I would invite people to enquire as to their availability. In both cases of my apartment stays, I have had a wonderful view of the Singel, and associated people-watching opportunities. The apartments are modern, spotlessly clean, fully amenitized sans air conditioning. I've not had a problem with this, however, as the apartments seem to be floor-through, so that you get a great breeze, and there are ceiling fans throughout. The hotel's location is great, just south of Central Station, and within easy walking distance of all attractions in the Centrum. There are canal taxis/boats which launch from the area just in front of Central Station, and you can easily take them down to the areas of the museums, and zoo, etc. I must admit that in the times I've been here, I've only eaten one breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. It was a great meal (if a little pricey, as I recall). There are so many places to eat within 1 block of the hotel, that I always feel compelled to wander about. There are two British pubs which serve "traditional" grub (heart attack stuff - GREAT!), and there's a cute little bagel place just across from the hotel entrance on the Singel canal. During the past year, the hotel has added high-speed internet access to all rooms, and there is high-speed wireless all over the place (for a fee). There is a business center, where you can hop on and check email, and print a document or two. For guests on the Club Floor (or those - like myself - who travel so much for work that we've managed to get Marriott Platinum), there is a wonderful executive club, with seemingly endless food and drinks on the 6th floor. That's my rambling for the Renaissance. I can't possibly recommend it highly enough. Whether for a short stay for business or pleasure, or a longer-term stay in one of the apartments of Junior Suites, the hotel is absolutely great and the staff's friendliness and helpfulness is what will make you want to return again and again. IDuring the course of the last 5 years, I have spent at least 100 nights per year in hotels for work, from JW Marriotts in Oahu, to the top hotels in most US cities. WIth all this said, I can honestly say that the Renaissance Amsterdam is among my favorite hotels out there.

Reviews.Title: “sure the decor is a bit dated but otherwise..”
Reviews.Author: burgo1804
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my wife for 5 days in June- and sure some of the decor is a bit dated- exposed bricks, low roof etc as others have said but overall I have to say that I was very happy with the Renaissance Hotel and would stay there again It is in a great location- a very short stroll from Centraal Station so easy access by either via the rail network or to the airport, an easy walk to the excellent (albeit a bit hot) tram network to anywhere in Amsterdam and close to the sites in the centre. We walk a lot on our holiday and found we could stroll and/or tram to just about anywhere with minimal fuss in Amsterdam- the redlight district and the "chinatown area" are easy to get too- if you wish- the food was good in the latter and the sights in the former interesting to say the least. The hotel itself was very secure- big doormen always around, we thought at first just because some of the Ukranian delegation was staying there but they security was good our entire stay, helpful staff and a good breakfast which seemed good value to us. internet facility was easy to use and relatively cheap The bed may have been a bit soft for our liking but we found the biggest problem was that the airconditioning wasn't as effective as we would have liked- the weather had just warmed up and sleeping with the window open could get a bit noisy late at night. Overall we enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam and the Renaissance was a good base for exploring the city

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat apprehensive about my stay at the Renaissance in Amsterdam after reading some of the reviews here and at another site. I was happily surprised that I had a very nice time during the three nights I stayed there. The hotel is close to the train station and an easy five minute walk. I was checked in right away and someone was available to help with my bags. The room was clean and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. I called for a robe and adapter and it was brought up to my room within minutes. The hotel had a very attractive lobby and bar. There was a computer room on the first floor with internet access for a nominal fee. I felt that having to use your room key to get an elevator up was a good safety feature. I walked to most sights but sometimes took the tram back. All the trams return to the train station which is minutes from the hotel so I never worried about catching the correct tram, I just got on any one that was going towards the train station. I booked my room through Priceline and had a great stay at the hotel. The room and bathroom were nice and clean although I wouldn't say they were five star luxury fabulous. I would happily stay at the Renaissance on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: ange70
Reviews.Content: myself and my husband stayed in this hotel in feb 06, the room was a little smaller than the one we had stayed in Manchester England but the quality was the same the standards were high room cleaned daily, staff very freindly and helpfull didnt eat in hotel restaurant so cant comment if i have one complaint(and i think it is a british thing) there were no tea/coffee facilties in our room but there were in the reception and it was all free but i can live with that it can be a bit pricey but if you shop around there are some good deals and im a great believer in you get what you pay for and i got a 5star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location: Very near to the Railway Station. In the midst of many restaurants and busy streets and yet somehow the entrance of the hotel was quite, secluded and nice. Staff: Very cooperative in stay and helpful with directions and sight seeing tips. Spoke extremely good English. The Concierge was most efficient, polished and very helpful. The hotel and the staff had an overall good old English charm to it. Rooms: Our room was very good and large enough with attached shower and WC that was very clean. Rooms were cleaned everyday. Hotel Ambience: Very good, immediately you feel you are in a truly class place. Enough staff for all needs and very good lobby. Breakfast: Sorry did not eat there. Other Convenience: None as such except that it is near the station. Shops and museums are close by, as is I guess whole of Amsterdam is very compact. Many restaurants and internet shops abound around the hotel which we found to be very convenient. The day we arrived it was their monthly guest reception day and we were served free cocktails. Overall: Very Good.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rsh1625
Reviews.Content: I also got a deal on Priceline and after reading a lot of reviews here expected to be uncomfortable. My room was huge (not a cozy Dutch interior but who needs wallpaper with all of Amsterdam outside). The staff were friendly and helpful. I did get room service (rushed before my airport shuttle even). Maybe some disgruntled lodgers have not stayed in some other hotels in Amsterdam. I've paid about the same, even more, for a lot less. Last good point, I had never explored this area as I usually try and stay closer to the middle and really enjoyed exploring the Brouwersgracht and around. Beware of rooms on the street, it is a lot busier and nosier than it first seems.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: thurmans
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights in this hotel on the hotel website, but this did not stop them from checking us out each day, meaning our door cards which give access to lifts, rooms etc, were cancelled each day. The first morning we received a phone call from reception telling us to leave the room as we were supposed to checkout. Despite providing our booking confirmation, they were adamant we had to leave. This happened the next morning as well, without apology. The rooms are generally very dated and lack tea and coffee facilites. As for the onsight bar or Kopel Cafe, the staff were rude, unhelpful and hard to find. It took over 20 mins to get served on the saturday night and then we could not have the drink we wanted as they had run out of glasses!! Overall, for the price, not very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: alexb2
Reviews.Content: At 165 EUR/night corporate, this hotel is exceptionally poor value for money. Not at all up to the standards one would expect of a Renaissance/Marriott property. Bedroom was small, very dark, and claustrophobic. Windows don't open properly, and ventilation either leaves you too hot or too cold. Thin duvets, small beds and uncomfortable mattresses. The rooms and hallways have very low ceilings. Being 6'3 tall, I had about 2 inches of clear space between the top of my head and the hallway and bathroom ceilings! The hallways are dark and scarily univiting. Bedroom windows face into a prison-like central courtyard. No room service is available. The decor is like something out of a 1970's time warp. Paper-thin walls so you can hear the various bathroom noises of the person next door and above you! The only plus point might be its proximity to Central station. Bottom line -- Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. They let us check in early and held our luggage for us to explore the city some more after check out. Clean, helpful staff. No problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: abece
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Amsterdam and wanted to be close to everything so this hotel was great. A five minute walk from Central Station and right on the tram line to the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum. And a ten minute walk from the Anne Frank house. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the hotel itself was ver nice. Definitely four star, also a decent size room for Europe. We got a Sunday night on Priceline for $100.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: CajunWave
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance for 4 nights after staying at Hotel Amsterdam de Roode Leeuw (see other review) for 3. I enjoyed the Renaissance but I agree with some other posters that the hotel is a bit dated. My room was paid via Priceline, however, and the value was very good. Location near Central Station is excellent although it's a bit far from the museum district. Luckily, Amsterdam has a wonderful public transit system. I stayed in room 355. Initially it was a bit hard to find as the numbering system on one side of the hall doesn't follow the other. (355 is nowhere near 354 and 356, for instance!) The room had two twin beds (I was solo so it didn't matter) and was a very good size for a European hotel. The hallways are made of brick, which is somewhat odd and makes the hotel feel a little institutional. Still, it was clean and comfortable. My only complaint is that the housekeeping staff is VERY noisy early in the morning. Also, the Renaissance has very high prices for in-room internet service so I used a local internet cafe instead. Overall, would stay there again, especially if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: Sacman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a short walk from the Central train station. The rooms, while a little small, are very American compared to other hotels in Europe. Someone traveling to Europe for the first time would be very comfortable. The rooms were very quiet. After an overnight flight from JFK I was able to check in at 9AM and get some much needed sleep. My only complaint is the hotel charges $20 Euro per 24 hour period for high speed internet access in the room. This access is for one computer only so it can't be shared if you are traveling with others. Overall service in the lobby and restaurant was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the 70's!”
Reviews.Author: DeusNYC
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is fine, but the hotel itself is very dated. Rooms are small and basic. We asked for a non-smoking, quiet room, and we got a room that reaked of cigarettes on the 3rd floor on top of the entrance. We moved to another room the next night, which was better, but you should be sure to check your room before you get settled in. The King bed is really just two twins pushed together with a fitted sheet over it. The cover sheets were weird too. There was not one complete cover sheet to cover both my husband and myself, but they actually make the bed up with two twin stuffed coverlets (like thin white quilts). The bathroom tub/shower is like a small plastic tub. Definitely not standard size bathtub. There also was a strange smell in the bathroom, like mold. Overall, if you're in town to take advantage of the legal herb, then who cares where you stay. But if you need a bit more than a Super 8-like motel, you should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms, tough to park.”
Reviews.Author: usflyer
Reviews.Content: Great location near the shopping district and within walking distance of the boat tours and other great area attractions. The hotel is laid out a little oddly, so it can take you 2 elevator trips and 5 minutes of walking to get to your room, but once there, the rooms are average Renaissance rooms. This means they are not particularly modern or luxurious (as some have been updated to in other cities), but they are very spacious for Europe and have everything you would need. This hotel is pricey ($185 for a weekend rate) and the location is kind of hard to find if you are driving (off on a side street, with not great signage). Also, parking is non-existent, so you either have to pay the hotel and park in the small garage (drive in an elevator and go up into the building) or find public somewhere else. Everyone speaks excellent English. I liked the location a lot and the ability to get Marriott points. Would consider this again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location so-so room”
Reviews.Author: Recent_TravelerCinci
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fantastic but as with any chain, you aren't getting the adventure of trying a local hotel. It is right near the train station and walking everywhere is a breeze. We were able to briefly see everything we wanted to see by foot in the three nights we stayed. it wasn't as nice as most Marriotts -- which I almost always like. The room itself was fine but the bathroom was nothing but basic. The hotel was always full of activity, which doesn't bother me but made it difficult to get in touch with the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: schrap2755
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 6-7 time over the past couple years with my most recent stay November 2005. It has never failed to deliver a consistent product. It is a 5-6 minute easy walk to the central train station, has a very good Concierge Lounge offering a good breakfast as well as complimentary alcohol and appetizers in the evening. The corridors are quite long and twisted at some points making the walk from registration to your room seem forever, however once there the rooms are functional and basic. I have stayed in far nicer Marriott/Renaissance properties, but the condition of this leave nothing really to complain of. They beds are comfortable, water pressure fine as well as the size of the room. The location of the hotel is also quite nice. Immedicately to the right outside the hotel are several restaurants and cafes along the canal and easy walking to shopping. Overall, a good value if you can get rates in the 129-159 Euro range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed staying at the Amsterdam Renaissance. I have stayed there many times. I find the location to be perfect. It is within walking distance to Centraal Station, trams, canal boats and the Metro. Taxis are usually cued up in front of the hotel, especially in morning and dinner time. The rooms are above average and exceptionally clean. Rooms that face the street do pick up some street noise but itâ€™s unavoidable. The hotel is a bit expensive when compared to some surrounding hotels, but you get value for what you pay for. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge desk is always ready to help, as well as the Guest Services Managers, Bronwyn and Christopher. Water pressure and plenty of hot water makes for a very comfortable shower. There are several restaurants in the hotel. Current security measures cause you to have to go outside the hotel to use the Koppel CafÃ©, but its no big deal unless its raining hard. Marriott Elite members have use of the Club lounge on the 6th floor. It serves a complimentary continental breakfast daily, including weekends and generous evening refreshments. I must say that this is one of the nicest Club Lounges I have ever used. There is free use of the lounge computer to check e-mails and web sites. They just ask that you are reasonable on sharing time with others. My only disappointment with this hotel is that the heating and air conditioning are sometimes difficult to regulate. On hot summer days, the air conditioning feels week to me. On cold winter days, the heat is very strong, but I tend to like my room cooler than most people. The hotel will not provide you with a lot of old world charm. It is a business oriented hotel what you might be accustomed to in the United States.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant stay at the Renaissance Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam and had a very pleasant stay at the Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel. Ideal location, large rooms, great breakfast buffet and very attentive/friendly staff. The concierge & bell staff were especially helpful. They recommended tasty restaurants and were able to get us last minute reservations on a Friday and Saturday night. The bellman went so far as to walk us up to the right street to get to the Indonesian restaurant. Haven't experienced that before. We would defintely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Higher Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Emmagale
Reviews.Content: For a 5 star hotel I expected better accommodations and better treatment. (The London Marriott Kensington the week before had been such a delight). Pros: location, housekeeping staff Cons:Holiday Inn-ish rooms, abrupt front desk, concierge and doormen Upon check in, my bathroom had a extremely strong urine odor. I contacted housekeeping immediately and they hand cleaned the toilet area. The smell was still there several hours later, albeit less so, when they called to check at which point they sent someone with a steaming machine. I'm glad to report that this did the trick otherwise I would have required another room. The housekeeping staff have been responsive and attentive. The front desk, doormen and concierge have been curt, abrupt but polite. They have not gone out of their way to make us feel welcome that's for sure. The front desk has a problem with picking up the phone. I must have called 3 times before I finally reached someone. Concierge kept interrupting me when I was trying to ask questions, as if he couldn't spare the time. I needed a taxi one day and the doormen behaved as if he were doing me a favor. The taxi driver told me he had been waiting several hours for a more worthy fare to the airport and did not hide his unhappiness that my ride was only going to yield 8 Euros. According to him, the doorman can pick and choose the taxis waiting in the rank because they get paid part of fare by the taxi driver.....what a racket! For 309 Euros per night was a big disappointment. If you can get the rooms for 100 Euros a night, as some reviewers have, then I say go for it. Otherwise keep your expectations low. My husband and I have traveled a lot and sorry to say this has not been one of our most memorable experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Not for everone”
Reviews.Author: denealio
Reviews.Content: For the timid American/Western tourist, this hotel will fit the bill: outside it's Amsterdam, but inside you could just as well be in Peoria. The hotel is clean, the staff friendly and the stay pleasant it's just that I would expect more from Renaissance, which I think of as the upscale part of the Marriott chain. Pros: - Easy walk to central station - Located in the heart of Amsterdam, easy walking to most sights - Safe/secure hotel (key needed for elevator) - Friendy English speaking staff - Excellent breakfast buffet (not always included, check your rate) - There are a lot of "bad" hotels in Amsterdam, and this hotel is much better. Cons: - No safe in rooms! (Desk staff happy to put stuff in hotel safe) - Looong hallways - Boring design, slightly outdated decor of rooms - "Chain" hotel feel. - No free wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: clean enough rooms, rooms small, no character long corridors better hotels for price .

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance M o t e l !!!”
Reviews.Author: ENK1973
Reviews.Content: Thankfully I was redeeming Marriott Reward Points and did not have to pay for this hotel because most college dorms are nicer. Donâ€™t be fooled by the curb appeal of the public spaces like the lobby. Rooms are in DESPERATE need of a refurbishment! The Mattress and furniture are deplorable as were the window treatments, bathroom fixtures and lighting. Equally bad were the guest room hallways. They are very musty and OLD Holiday Innâ€�ishâ€�. Front desk staff was pleasant, when they happened to answer the phone, however, the Doorman and Bell Staff were the most UNFRIENDLY people I encountered in all of Amsterdam. Iâ€™m not quite sure how Marriott allows this hotel to continue to run under a Renaissance flag. I know that Marriott Hotels can sometimes vary in quality but this hotel should be listed as a motel with a nice lobby and meeting space. I will go back to Amsterdam, but I will not stay here again, free or otherwise. This hotel does have a great location and you can easily walk from the central train station. However, they neglect to mention this on their web site. ***NOT A FOUR STAR HOTEL***

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only a few short blocks from Centraal Station, so it is very convenient if you are taking the train in or coming from the airport. There are trams, restaurants and 'coffeeshops' in the neighborhood. Amsterdam is pretty compact, so you should be able to walk just about anywhere from here, or catch a cab or a tram if you are feeling lazy and/or the weather is bad. The hotel is equivalent to an American Marriott or Hilton, very nice lobby. The room was on the small side with one queen bed. Can't say much for the view. Concierge was very friendly, having tickets to the Van Gogh museum at the desk for sale. All in all, a good experience. I got a deal on priceline, if you have only 2 people in your party I highly recommend trying to bid for it (4 stars in central Amsterdam). At a rate of $100/night including taxes, the deal couldn't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff makes up for average rooms”
Reviews.Author: msanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam on a busy Saturday (SAIL 2005) and chose the executive floors for free mini bar and access to the executive lounge for snacks, drinks and breakfast. The staff is amazingly friendly in all sectors: reception, luggage storage, concierge, executive lounge. The room was as expected based on reviews on this site: no safe in room, soft bed (pillows good for us, however), and air conditioning that had one setting -- cold. In spite of this, we slept well, had a very pleasant breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Their outdoor cafe is very pleasant, good for people watching and meeting friends. The location is great for the train station and major shopping end of the city. Even though it is close to the center, the hotel seems oriented to a quiet area. A couple other positives: 1) delicious chocolate on hand at reception all the time. 2) web site says 2 persons MAX in rooms, but calling the hotel directly got us a rollaway for our daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nly8826
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Renaissance Hotel was an incredible value after getting a $100/day rate on Price Line. The rooms were large by European standards, spotlessly clean, and the staff were friendly, cheerful and eager to help. The hotel has a retaurant, but it is expensive, as most hotel restaurants are. The hotel has an off-site gym, which is less than a half-block walk. The location is great - very central to the downtown district and Dam Square. You can conveniently walk to a number of sights, and the metro will take you virtually anywhere you want to go at a reasonable price. Taxis are expensive in Amsterdam, so avoid them. The lady who, in her review, was worried about her "pilates workout" should have stayed in Los Angeles, or wherever she came from. This hotel is nice by American standards, much less European standards. For those travelers who are expecting an American-style Hilton, go to America.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with style”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night visit to Amsterdam. Thsi was our first trip to this exciting city and based on trip advisor reviews we selected the Renaissance Hotel and were very pleased. Location was great, a 10 minute walk from the train station, great choice of dining establishments in the neighborhood and a interesting 15 minute walk to the Dam. The staff were extremely well trained and the conceirge personnel were the best I have run across in a long time. Rooms were fine and A/C was welcomed. For the money this is a good hotel and will have my business on the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, staff, value”
Reviews.Author: GBTravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for weekend in June 2005, nice room but no safe in room, which was a shame. Aircon was not that good either. Staff at reception were excellent as were all others. Good breakfast buffet. Someone complained in earlier review that a five star hotel should not have bare brick walls. It wasn't that bad really, just a design of the period, probably late 80s. I found it quite charming. Good security in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a 5 star but good location”
Reviews.Author: Johnwhiting
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 2 friends on 6 and 7 June. Previously asked for rooms overlooking the courtyard at the front. Ours looked out on a wall, our friends on a carpark. Rooms ok but bathrooms only 3 star standard. Very nice staff but overall a slight disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, but not 4-star”
Reviews.Author: ruben900
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a whole week around Labor Day. This hotel was shown on websites to be a 4-5 star hotel. Not even close! The rooms were like college dorm rooms....very basic and marginally comfortable. The highlights were good location and a pretty good gym (extra charge). DO NOT stay here expecting the quality of Renaissance Hotels you find here in the USA or you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: film54
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my 2 night stay at the Renaissance in March 2005. I was very impressed with the lobby area and professional staff. Our room was very comfortable and clean with a huge bed. Friends were travelling with couldn't check in right away and got bumped up to a mini-suite for no charge. The location of the hotel was wonderful as well. Everything was in walking distance. Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: jszyman806
Reviews.Content: This 4-star hotel is in a great location, a 10-min walk from the train station. Anne Frank House is a short 10-min walk. Museums are 25 min away, but very walkable. Rooms are standard. The hotel is nicely decorated. The concierge desk is very helpful. One hint-- buy tickets for museums and Anne Frank House from here or at the tourist info booth right outside the train station. This allows you to walk past everyone in line when you get there. What a time savings! Finally, eat at Humphrey's restaurant, just over a block away from the hotel. My friend and I ate there TWICE in our three night stay. For 18.95 Euro you get three courses with quite a selection. The restaurant is quite big with a nice atmosphere. More locals were there than tourists. How does white chocolate with egg nog sauce sound for dessert? I got that and a nice chocolate dish the next night. I got a deliciously prpeared salad with balsamic both nights (w/ sun-dried tomatoes, sweet peppers, etc.) One night I got the mixed grill, the other the grilled veal steak. Superbly done with lots of taste. Don't miss this one. We walked all over the city, looking to try something different. But, why pay almost double. We went back to Humphrey's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trav3lG1rl
Reviews.Content: great stay at this hotel. As everyone says - this is a great location. Convenient to everything in Amsterdam. Lots of nice restaurants, bars, internet cafes, coffee houses, etc. within a 5 minute walk. The Centraal station is also a 5 minute walk away and I took advantage of that to do day trips to the flower gardens and Delft. Very cheap and easy using the train - no need to take an expensive tour! I also can't say enough about the friendliness of the staff. They were so pleasant it was almost scary. I thought I'd stepped into some commercial. When I arrived at 2 there was no problem getting a room and I asked for one overlooking the street. They gave me a room with a nice view. The room was clean, nice, and everything worked so just what I'd expect in a 5* hotel. Since my flight was leaving at 10:00 p.m. - the staff offered a 3 p.m. checkout and let me store my bags with the concierge. Everyone was very-very - friendly - nothing seemed to be too much trouble. Also - great (free) chocolate at reception - I was offered some every day. I would definately recommend this hotel and would stay there again when I come back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is indeed somewhat dull, the quality of the hotel is excellent. As someone who came to Amsterdam for both business and pleasure, I appreciated the amazing location and the fact that the hotel makes everything easy. No stairs, large rooms (by Amsterdam standards), very cheap wireless in the lobby (important - don't go to the front desk to pay for wireless, they'll try to charge you 5 an hour - just turn your computer on, open the browser, and purchase a week for 15 euro). They're also very easy to work with on group reservations. Given that the hotel frequently gives very large discounts off their stated rates, you'd be hard pressed to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, together with two friends (all seasoned travellers), stayed here for three nights in December 2004. We thought the weather might be a little cold at that time of year so we decided to pay a bit more for "Club" facilities in case we needed that extra comfort factor. Wise decision. We arrived at the hotel at 9 am and were shown to our rooms. Massive bed, reasonable furniture, comfortable. Wonderfully friendly staff. We also arranged for a 3 pm check-out. Nothing was too much trouble. The mini bar is free as is a plentiful supply of chocolate and fresh fruit. The club lounge provides free internet access, a constant supply of tea, coffee, refrigerated drinks, complimentary breakfast and pre-dinner drinks and canapes. It was laid back and here's that word again - comfortable. Nearly forgot - board games too. The hotel has its own brown bar. It's centrally located with transport, restaurants, shops on the doorstep. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Buidling of the 70's”
Reviews.Author: European_consultant
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights with my family (5 persons) in 2 connected double rooms on the Club Floor. I was amazed by the size and condition of the rooms. Dark, relatively small and low ceilings with almost no view. And the bathroom was really disappointing: small and completely white tiled with a white plastic shower-curtain. Not really what you expect in a 5-star hotel. Apart from that everything was fine: the room is nicely furnished and clean, I paid a great rate including free minibar, snacks and free access to the clublounge including breakfast. The location is very good and the employees were friendly and helpfull. It is really the building (dating back to the 70's) that is disappointing. But if you can get a cheap rate, you can try it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “"Renaissance" more like Dark Ages!”
Reviews.Author: theoshow2
Reviews.Content: This place is a dungeon. The rooms are dark and drab. I requested a non smoking room, and it was given to me; however, I had to walk about 10 minutes through horrible hallways before I arrived at my room. The bathrooms smell horrible and have no upscale qualities...I got kicked out of my initial room because the bathroom sprung a leak...I thought Moby Dick was in the tub for heaven's sake. The maintenence guys were a gag! What's up guys? They did compensate me with a nice dinner voucher though. On the positive side, it's location is strong to quite strong--close to central rail station and walking distance to main attractions. Overall, if you get a super cheap rate, ahead and book the sucker, otherwise, shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at AMS Ren”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 8/21 at 11 a.m. prior to check-in time to a desk line 5 deep with all before me told rooms ready at 3. No members line or club floor line. Finally get to desk to discover the club floor room we had booked had been upgraded to Ambassador Suite and room was ready. This more than compensated for the queue. Card access elevator to club floor and suite is next to lounge. Suite is 2 full rooms, one as bedroom with king bed and one as living area with pull out sofa. 2 full baths, 2 minibars, bathrobes, slippers, bath condiments, bowl of fresh fruit as welcome amenity. Each room also had doors to double rooftop patio area with table and chairs looking at Koepelkerk. Usual tvs, magazines in room, etc. Lounge had morning and evening buffet and in evening had beer selection and wines. Soft drinks, tea and coffee available all day with some fruit and automatic expresso machine. Best part of lounge was Bronwyn who made our stay more pleasant. Room decor was standard Ren, but very roomy and comfortable. This hotel may be a 4 rather than a 5, but this suite guaranteed a pleasant visit and I would strongly urge those staying here to pay more for the club floor. The reviews here convinced me to do so and I found it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but NOT 5-star”
Reviews.Author: rdamore
Reviews.Content: Got the hotel through priceline--- at $100 per night. overall i'd say it's good but dissapointing. it's supposed to be a 5-star hotel, according to the guides. in reality it falls short. Location was great. Just a 5-minute walk from Centraal Station and 10 minutes from the red light (party) district. Service was fast but I do have one complaint. You have to prepay to use their business center....5 euros for 15 minutes of internet. You can get 15 minutes for 1 euro at any internet equipped hash house in town. Anyway, when the machine rebooted on me after almost finishing a long email, the desk lady told me she could not refund my 5 euros. I know it's a small thing, but a truely 5-star hotel would give you back your money and may even give you a coupon for a hotel massage. But this place have me Howard Johnson treatment. No pool, which a 5-start hotel must have. Hallways are ugly brick and dimly lit. Makes the place feel like a women's prison. Inside the room, everything's fine. Bed was comfy. AC worked great. They cleaned the room daily. Shower was fine. Room was quiet. Overall, not bad, and definatey worth $100, but whoever called this a 5-star hotel needs a brain scan.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, do not spend too much there.”
Reviews.Author: Paul75
Reviews.Content: I was lurred by the 5* rating. The hotel is definitely worth 4*, but not more. For 5*, you would expect that everything is perfect. I find that the hotel is nice, but by no mean luxurious. Although the entrance has a marble style, the corridors and rooms have walls with raw brick. My room was noisy (but it was not on the patio), I would have expected thicker windows to filter the noise from the street. The location is very convenient. I found the personel very friendly, specially the concierge, this was better than average. The hotel was crowded, we had to wait 15 minutes in line to be seated for breakfast... I got the best rate through the hotel web site directly, and it was 135 euros breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, aged rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the Visa special offer for 135,- Euro per night including breakfast for 2 persons. The lobby is big, nice and comfy, the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious for Amsterdam, with a kingsize bed, iron/ironing board, Tv with Internet and even Playstation, BUT unfortunately we could see and smell the age of the room. The curtains were yellowed, the furniture had little scratches, and the bathroom had just 80's "charme" with a bathtub with stains and little mold on the shower curtain. The amenities were ok. Try to get an special-offer including breakfast, it's really delicious (but 21 Euro per person is just overpriced) Our resume: Rooms need to be renovated in order to call the Renaissance a real 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real treasure”
Reviews.Author: TinaG
Reviews.Content: We are spoiled Americans, and though we like to travel, we also like a good night's sleep in comfort. This hotel is probably the best deal in Amsterdam for people like us. It is AIR-CONDITIONED!!! Bathrooms are quite good, and this hotel is tucked away in a quiet side street with lots of trees. Very friendly hotel staff helped us find the places we wanted to visit, and even booked our canal tour. Discount rates are available on the internet which beat many of the "charming" small hotels with no A/C or elevators. It was the perfect place to crash after a long transatlantic flight. We didn't try the breakfast. There are so many cafes and restaurants nearby, eating is no problem. If you're into it, (we're NOT) "coffee shops" are a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Genuinely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: polar_b
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through priceline and did not know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff were genuinely friendly and very helpful. Forgot toothbrush? No problem, we'll send one right up (on a silver tray...). Roomservice late at night? Coming in 20 minutes. The room service food was excellent and well presented. The breakfast buffet is good and not too pricey, with fast service. Not a very impressive amount of TV channels, but hey you are not in Amsterdam to watch TV are you?! The location is great: It's very central, close to the tram stops, yet in a fairly quiet side street. You could use this hotel for business, working from your hotel room, or for pleasure - getting anywhere from the hotel is a doddle as it's close to the central station and tram stops. The beds are good, there is a minibar and the bathrooms are OK. The rooms are of a very good standard, although the interiors in the hallways are a bit worn. The lobby is fantastic and is a place you can just sit down and relax after a hard day's sightseeing. Tip: If you have a laptop with a wireless card, scan for networks. When I was there a company provided free access to anyone in that street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Dingy Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days. Great service, everyone was nice and helpful, which you expect from a 4 star. The lobby is nice, but waiting area and restaurants are rather unremarkable. The room is a typical Marriot room complete with all Marriot furniture, printed materials etc. The problem is, all the furniture seems rather old and used. Dingy is the right description, and the bathroom needed some bleach - moldy crevices etc. I would stay there again, but not expecting much.

Reviews.Title: “funky econo rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel be careful not to get the economy room unless you like it funky the first time i stayed here they gave me a room across the alleyway from some restaurant's food prep area the room had worn out furniture but the bed was comfy and the windows opened anyway in the late afternoon i started hearing pots and pans clanging and this went on for several hours plus a bunch of steam and smoke from cooking food came in the window luckily the shower didnt drain so the next day they moved me into a normal room which was fine

Reviews.Title: “Rennaisance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dixie_Hollins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rennaisance Hotel for 6 nights in May.Room was spacious (for Amsterdam). Excellent bath and bed. Comfortable and quiet. Staff was very experienced and competent. Enjoyed a room service breakfast served hot and on time. Location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Big, yet friendly and very helpful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time in Amsterdam. A last minute business/vacation and the hotel provided one of the warmest greetings at checkin we've ever experienced. The conceirge(sic) service was excellent since we did not have alot of time to plan (they showed incredible patience!). The staff were as friendly as the wonderful people of Amsterdam, the room clean and modern. The location sensational, easy reach of tram and within walking distance of the train station. Would easily stay again!

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Amsterdam Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kattengat 1, Amsterdam 1012 SZ, The Netherlands
